loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta knows the hardship of life and even how hard it is to be too far from family. She worked abroad before. When she went back to the Philippines for good, she has managed her store. The profit gained from her business has been a big contribution to providing for her family's daily basic needs. Violeta wants to earn more and save some of it for any future emergencies. With her desire to get ahead in life, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, soap, toothpaste and cooking oil to sell. Violeta is looking forward to the growth of the business to further attain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, soap, toothpaste and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 22 years old. She is engaged in selling a variety of fish. With this kind of business, she is able to earn approximately 250 PHP per day. In order to improve her everyday net income, Jennifer is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a volume of fish. In the future, she would like to expand her business for her future children. Moreover, she hopes to have her own house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a volume of fish to sell.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Piseth, 24 years old, is single and lives with his parents and brother in a suburb of Phnom Pen. His mother stays at home and does housework and his father is a construction contractor. 

Piseth is now a third year student in Phnom Penh City, majoring in computer science. He is asking for a loan to pay for his school fees. He hopes he will have a good job in the information technology sector.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: 11-04-01 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Hương is applying for a loan to purchase clothes to resell. She has a retail business selling clothes. Hương is 55 years old and she is married with two children. Hương is the group leader of the 11-04-01 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her children are grown up.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
This is Gilbert, 38, a resident of Silang, Intramuros, Philippines. He is single, and he is working hard to provide for his everyday needs. He is also helping his parents and siblings financially.

Gilbert maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Gilbert hopes to buy another unit of tricycle and dreams to have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle unit.

loans.name: Upinisa

texts.ru: Упинисе 52 года, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывает 5 детей. Двух дочерей выдала замуж, сын служит в Армии, остальные двое детей проживают с Упинисой и помогают по хозяйству. У Упинисы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Упиниса занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Упинисы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу и морковь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Упиниса обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Упиниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для дочери.
texts.en:
Upinisa is 52 years old, a widow, and after the death of her husband is raising five children on her own. Two daughters got married, a son is serving in the army, and the remaining two children live with Upinisa and help around the homestead. Upinisa has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Upinisa raises livestock and crops, having begun 24 years ago with a livestock purchase of 1,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Upinisa today has on her homestead: one dairy cow with calf, ten sheep, and also a plot of land measuring 0.30 hectares, on which she grows potatoes, corn and carrots. Monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Upinisa applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase cows for fattening and subsequent sale at the market at a premium. Upinisa plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and intends to collect money for putting on a wedding celebration for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: 11-04-02 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Giảng has a retail business selling dry food and general items. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food and general items for resale.

Giảng is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 11-04-02 Trường Thi solidarity group. Her children are grown up so Giảng supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Giảng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Giảng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Giảng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general items for resale.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

She has been running a primary school for many years to meet her household expenditures. She has experience in her subjects and she teaches with good manners. In this way, she is enabling herself to generate more income. She teaches to the children living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Shahnaz wants to set up a book stall for her school, but she does not have enough cash in hand to buy new books, copies, and stationery items. 

Therefore, Shahnaz contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan, so that she can buy books, copies, and stationery. It’s her third year with BRAC Pakistan and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to set up a book stall for her school.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is an industrious farmer from Bakan district in Pursat province. She has been engaged in farming business which serves as her family’s main source of income. She and her husband primarily grow and harvest rice on about two hectares of farmland, which they inherited from both their parents. Having been in the business for almost 25 years, she is able to earn a proper income to satisfy the necessities of her family.

As of now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 to build a safe latrine for her family as she doesn't have a hygienic latrine. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phon is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for her family.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru:
Насимчон простой житель одного из районов городка Худжанд. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. Он с женой растит двоих детей. У них славные дети. Старшему сыну 16 лет, а дочери 11 лет. Они учатся в школе. В той же школе жена Насимчон работает преподавателям младших классов. 
  Насимчон работает водителям маршрутки. Его робота заключается в том, чтобы возить людей по определенному маршруту. Насимчону может выйти на работу даже в знойную погоду, потому что у него большой опыт работы. У него 10 летний водительский стаж. Насимчон возит пассажиров в маршрутке марки "Газель". Он хочет поменять машину на более новую маршрутку марки "Спринтер" с доплатой. Насимчон просит кредит, чтобы поменять машину, так как ему не хватает средств самостоятельно сделать задуманное. Помогите ему.
texts.en:
Nasimjon is a simple resident of one of the districts in the town of Khujand. He is 38 years old. He is married and is raising two children with his wife. They have nice kids. The older is a son who is 16 years old, and their daughter is 11. They go to school. Nasimjon's wife works in this same school as a teacher for the younger grades.

Nasimjon works as a minibus driver. His work is to transport people on a certain route. Nasimjon is able to go to work even in hot weather because he has a lot of work experience. He has ten years of driving experience. Nasimjon transports passengers in a Gazelle minibus. He wants to trade in his car for a brand new Sprinter minibus with an additional charge. Nasimjon is requesting a loan to change the automobile, since he does not have enough money of his own to carry out his plans.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is 63 years old and a resident of a peaceful village of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is married with five grown-up children who are already married and live independently. Oeurn has been a farmer for more than 30 years, mainly growing and harvesting rice.

Oeurn has been with Hattha Kaksekar Limited for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which were great support in the development of her family and business. Now she has applied for a loan amounting to 1,000 US dollars to build a household latrine to improve her sanitation practices.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Oeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve her sanitation practices.

loans.name: Yav's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Yav is 43 years old and married with three children. 

To support her family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava, and she supplements her family’s income by working for others for fee. From the current business, she can earn about 36,000 KHR per day and can save about 22,000 KHR each day for the future needs.
 
Yav has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yav is going to use her portion to pay for labor fee for harvesting rice and cassava. She hopes to earn more income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for labor fee for harvesting rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian, 47 years old, is married and has eight children. She has been selling a variety of fish in the village for 16 years, earning a net income of 200 - 400 PHP daily. To maintain a continuous smooth flow of her fish vending business, Lilian is seeking a loan of 8,000 PHP to add to her capital in purchasing volumes of fish. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her income and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase volumes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover marketing, payroll, and three months of rent, allowing him to see his vision for SociaLive as a world-connecting platform to light.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher, 30 years of age, is single and happy. He has owned and operated a retail store in front of the school campus for almost twelve years, earning a net income of PHP 2,500. Due to insufficient fund in the business, Christopher would like to take out a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase juices, canned goods, beverages, and breads to sell. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase juices, canned goods, beverages, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.ru: Иноятхон 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Иноятхон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Иноятхон занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Иноятхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,32 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, подсолнух и овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Иноятхон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Иноятхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en:
Inoyatkhon is 50 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Inoyatkhon has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Inoyatkhon raises livestock and crops, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 7,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Inoyatkhon currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow with calf and also a plot of land measuring 0.32 hectares, on which she grows potatoes, corn, sunflowers and vegetables. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Inoyatkhon applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase cows for fattening and resale at a premium at the market.

Inoyatkhon plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic livestock, and intends to save money to put on a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Kanzada

texts.ru: Канзаде 34 года, разведена, одна воспитывает 2 детей. У Канзады - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Канзада занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канзады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kanzada is 34 years old, divorced, and is raising two children on her own. Kanzada has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Kanzada raises livestock, having begun 10 years ago with a livestock purchase of 8,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kanzada currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow and ten sheep. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanzada turned to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase a cow for expanding her headcount of livestock. Kanzada plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of livestock, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Phalla is a 53-year-old mother of five children. For the last 33 years, she and her husband have been raising pigs and working as paid workers. She and her husband can earn about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is Phalla’s seventh microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets and pig feed for feeding them. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Chheung Prey district, Pov is aged 30 years and married. He has one daughter. 

To feed his family, he has worked hard as a rice farmer for 11 years and sometimes his wife works as a paid construction worker. The current business earns about 40,000 KHR per day.

Pov is in his second microloan with VisionFund. He successfully paid back the first loan. Now he is applying for another loan. Pov is going to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is from Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis, Occidenta, Philippines. He is married and gifted with one school aged child. Rene and his wife are engaged in a sari-sari store (General Store) business in order to have an additional source of income for their other needs. He's been in this activity for three years and so far, the business is doing well.

Last year, Rene tried his luck to join in PMPC; he's hoping that the Co-op could be of help in realizing his plans for his family. Well, Rene was just on a right track to fulfill his dreams.

Now, Rene is asking for financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 PHP to restock more inventories for his sari-sari store business such as bags of rice, cases of soft drinks, gallons of oil and other items. Expanding his business would mean an increase of his income too. 

Rene wants nothing more than to have a decent and happy life with his family.

loans.use: to restock more inventories for his sari-sari store (General Store) business such as bags of rice, cases of soft-drinks, gallons of oil and other items

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico, 47 years old, is married and has 4 children. He lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Rico has responsibly supported his family through his fishing business. He owns a small fishing boat and his catch goes to the market, where it is sold. He's been in this business for 10 years.

In 2007, Rico applied for his membership with PMPC. He did not hesitate to apply after hearing of all the benefits and privileges. Rico has taken out previous loans and repaid his obligations in a timely manner.

Rico has recently requested a loan of PHP 14,000 from PMPC to purchase needed materials for his fishing business. In the future, Rico wants to see his children finish their studies and live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase needed materials for fishing

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, 38 years old, is an MIGS (Member in Good Standing). She operates her sari-sari (variety) store, which is fortunately located in a populous neighborhood. Analie keeps on running the store even though she has a lot of competitors in the area. She hopes and prays that her business will be successful. 

Analie needs a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for additional stocks of basic commodities such as bags of rice. Paglaum MPC believes in Analie's capacity to handle her business and it is very successful. Analie believes that expanding her capital will mean additional income. She is also a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store in order to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of basic commodities such as rice

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is 48 years old, married, and is mother of five children.

She has been in the hog fattening business for sixteen years. She is thankful because through her hard work and patience she has been able to cover  their daily consumption.

For continuous growth of her hog fattening business, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. She hopes that these will be of great help in preparing her business to produce higher sales and income.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and vitamins for her hog raising business

loans.name: Gloria Rosaura

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, estado civil casado vive con su esposo en el  Cantón San Miguel  provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cría gallinas desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en San Pablo y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos para la siembra del maíz y para el balanceado para los animales. 

Su sueño es mejorar en los negocios.
Le gusta  trabajar mucho y caminar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and is married. She lives with her husband in the San Miguel canton in the Los Ríos province. Her loan group, called San José de las Orquídeas, is located in San Pablo in the San Miguel canton, where residents make a living from agricultural work and livestock.

Gloria has made a living from agriculture by growing corn and raising hens for a few years. She buys her products in San Pablo and sells them in the market there as well. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer to plant corn and for a balanced diet for the animals. 

Her dream is to improve in her business. She likes to work a lot and to walk.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant corn

loans.name: Seap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Seap lives in a rural village located in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She is a married mother of six children. For the last five years, Seap and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. Together, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Seap is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. The leader of her group, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is age 38. She is married and has one son and is living with her family in a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main sources of her family’s income for 20 years. Her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future needs.
 
San is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, San is going to use her portion to buy cassava for planting. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her cassava and rice production to increase her family’s income and she hopes to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy cassava for planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Markhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей, Мархамат очень заботливая мать и хорошая хозяйка. У Мархамат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мархамат занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мархамат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Мархамат доит коров, реализует молоко оптовым продавцам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мархамат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мархамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Markhamat is 26 years old, married, and with her husband is raising three sons. Markhamat is a very loving mother and a good hostess. Markhamat has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Markhamat raises livestock, having begun seven years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Markhamat currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows and ten sheep. Markhamat milks the cows and sells the milk to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Markhamat applied for a loan from the bank Bai-Tushum - to purchase sheep for expanding her livestock count. Markhamat plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 20-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 1 daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession and he has been providing transportation services for 5 years. Raheela also contributes to the family's income by providing tailoring services.

Raheela has to purchase different kinds of items, such as cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc. for her business use. Therefore she has requested a Kiva loan from field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase these items to earn maximum profit. Raheela will also make savings to fulfill her family's needs. Raheela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ariana Maria

texts.es: Ariana es una joven humilde que logro cursar hasta el quinto grado de primaria, se dedica al negocio de alquiler de equipos o articulos para fiestas como sillas, mesas, sonido, de sus ingresos mantiene a su hijo quien asiste a la escuela. Solicita el crédito para la compra de  parlantes, los que tiene no funcionan bien, lo que le dificulta dar a sus clientes un servicio de calidad.
texts.en: Ariana is a humble young woman who was able to study up to the fifth grade of primary school. She makes a living from a business renting equipment or items for parties like chairs, tables and sound equipment. With her income she maintains her son, who is attending school. She is asking for the loan to buy speakers. The speakers she has don't work well, which makes it difficult for her to give her customers a quality service.

loans.use: to buy speakers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 children. 

For the past 10 years, Victoria has been engaged in hog fattening, earning approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. She now has three 2-month-old piglets. Victoria has requested a loan to purchase 5 sacks of booster feed and vitamins for her business.  Victoria has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other forms of business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of booster feed and vitamins

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 47 years old and she lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with two children. 

For their means of living, Celerina earns from the sales of her little eatery business. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 5,000 each month in doing this type of work. 

Celerina has requested a loan to be used to purchase one sack of rice, five kilos of beef and meat, spices, and additional kitchenware to be used for her eatery business.  

Celerina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost six years. In the future, Celerina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used to purchase one sack of rice, five kilos of beef and meat, spices, and additional kitchenware.

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla is 59 years old, married and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs. 

Servilla is a MIGS member in Paglaum MPC. She requested a capital amount of PHP 14,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed for her business. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family with the support of her husband in handling their business. Someday, Servilla wants to renovate her concrete pig cage to easily keep conditions more sanitary.

loans.use: to buy four additional piglets and one sack of feed

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, a 63-year-old married mother of two, has operated a retail business for four years now, earning a monthly income of PHP 5000. A member of Paglaum Cooperative for four years, she has requested this loan to pay for additional stocks of basic commodities like bags of rice for her sari-sari store. 

Sabrina will use her profits in payment of tuition fees for her grandson.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of basic commodities like bags of rice for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gelacio

texts.en:
This is Gelacio, 49, resident of Silang, Intramuros, Philippines. He is married and he has a child. He manages their household as they operate the business. He works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Gelacio maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one unit of tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. They have four units of tricycle. The other three tricycles are being used by other tricycle drivers who then remit their daily quota.  He earns a minimum of PHP 1200 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, He is requesting an amount of PHP 13,000 in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Gelacio dreams to have another unit of tricycle and hopes to be in good health always. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Memuna. She is married and has 4 children aged 18, 13, 10 and 7. In 1998, Memuna established her foodstuffs business. While she was with her mother, Memuna became interested in business because her mother was a small-scale trader. When she got married she decided to start her own business to help her husband support their family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Memuna requires this loan in order to buy maggi, onions and rice for her business. She has managed to increase her monthly profit by 200,000 SLL, and part of this was used to give her children lunch, transportation and school fees.  Memuna’s plan to educate her children to university level is still standing. Memuna is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy maggi, onions and rice for her business.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia, 34 years old, is the mother of 2 daughters and a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband works outside the country and is responsible for feeding the entire family. 

Shazia has been providing beautician services for 2 years. She has to purchase different types of cosmetics and other items for her business but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member of BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help Shazia to buy these items and to expand the business to earn maximum profit, which will be useful for her to fulfill her family's needs. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business

loans.name: Karla Estefania

texts.es:
Karla tiene 20 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con sus padres en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolivar.
Pertenece a la Ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Karla  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz  desde hace dos años. Compra sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos, semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para fomentar la economía de la familia. Su sueño mejorar la calidad de vida.
Le gusta hacer deporte y pasear con sus padres.
texts.en:
Karla is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the county San Miguel, province of Bolivar. It belongs to the communal bank San José de las Orquídeas, it is located in San Pablo which also belongs to the county of San Miguel where they work in agriculture and livestock.

Karla has worked in the cultivation of corn for two years. She buys her products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same place. She requests a loan to buy soil amendments, seeds, and fertilizers for the sowing of corn. The loan will help promote the economy of her family. Her dream is to improve the quality of life. She like to play sports and walk with her parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Due to their financial burden, Jema engages in planting and selling vegetables in her community to supplement her husband's income. She is 48 years old and has three school-aged children. Despite the hardships of living, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

To improve their farming business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to increase her production and income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Sherelyn

texts.en:
Sherelyn is 32 years old and happily married. For the past 2 years, she has been engaged in the food selling business, particularly street foods. She usually earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. 

Sherelyn needs additional capital to make her dream possible, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy flour, spleen, liver, egg and chicken meat to cook and sell around her village. Sherelyn hopes to increase her income so that she will be able to meet the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, spleen, liver, egg and chicken meat to cook and sell

loans.name: Marie Madeleine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Marie qui est à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 44 ans,et mére de 02 enfants qui ont respectivement 18 et 22 ans dont l'aîné est actuellement à l'université.

Son activité est la production de jus.Pour ce faire elle utilise le pain de singe,le mil et l'arachide.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter du mil pour une valeur de 25000f,du pain de singe pour une valeur de 25000f et de l'arachide pour 25000f.

Son objectif est de pouvoir assurer le réglement des factures d'eau,d'électricité,assurer la nourriture et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group was created in November 2012. Its members live in the same neighborhood and work as vendors. 

Marie, the one raising her hand on the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 44 years old and the mother of two children, 18 and 22 years old. Her eldest child now studies at the university. Her business is making juice. She uses baobab fruit (“monkey bread”), millet and peanuts to make juice. 
With this loan, she plans to buy millet for 250000 West African francs, baobab fruit for 25,000 francs and peanuts for 25,000 francs. Her goal is to be able to regularly pay her waters and electricity bills and provide for the food and educational costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit, millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is a responsible mother of 2 daughters and 3 sons. She is 55 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a tailor by profession.

Tazeem's son has been running a computer accessories shop for 3 years. Tazeem has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan because her son has to purchase inventories of computer accessories for his business and, due to financial problems, is unable to purchase these items. This loan will enable Tazeem's son to make these purchases and to increase his profit margins and sales growth. It will also be good for Tazeem's son to make savings to fulfill the family's needs. Tazeem is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories inventory for her son's business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 35, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is providing services for polishing newly constructed floors. He polishes concrete and marble floors. For this purpose he uses a floor polishing machine; he has been providing these services for many years. A few days ago his floor polishing machine became out of order due to fluctuationa in electricity. For this reason, he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a new floor polishing machine.

Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new floor polishing machine so that he can continue his services smoothly.

loans.use: To buy a floor polishing machine for polishing floors.

loans.name: Nisar

texts.en:
Nisar is a 45-years-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son and three daughters. Her husband is working in a private security company, and one of her daughters has been running a beauty parlor for 10 years. 

Nisar's daughter has to purchase different types of cosmetics and other accessories, i.e., hair brushes, combs, nail polish remover, facial creams, lotions, etc. for business purposes, but due to financial constraints she is unable to purchase these items. 

Therefore Nisar has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can enable her daughter to purchase these items. This loan will help to increase her daughter's daily sales and allow her to earn more profit. This loan will also fruitful for her daughter in expanding the business.

Nisar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of cosmetics and other accessories, i.e., hair brushes, combs, nail polish remover, facial creams, lotions, etc. for business purposes.

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en: Sot is 45 years old and a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, all students.To support her family, she and her husband grow rice and soybeans as their main source of income. She has been with this business for 14 years and it earns her around 27,200 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loans and has repaid her loans with success. The loans have helped her to improve her lifestyle. For this fifth loan, she is the group leader of two. The total request from her group is 2,200,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan to pay the plowing fee and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay her plowing fee and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 32 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a clothing business, where he buys clothing from a wholesaler and sells it to the retailers. Her son has been learning to deal with the customers and has become very expert in the clothing business. Bushra decided to open a new clothing shop for her son, so he can contribute to the monthly income. This shop will earn additional savings to help the family cope with the future’s sudden surprises. 

Bushra requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her son set up his newly opened clothing shop by purchasing the initial stock. She dreams of a bright future for her children, the establishment of business, and a better living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her son's new clothing shop

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 35 years old and married with three children. She manages a piggery business and is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to get her requested loan to make her pigs healthy and well-nourished. In this way, she could sell them at a high price. Margie believes that with her requested loan, she will earn increased income someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Noeung's Group

texts.en: Noeung is 31 years old and married. She is a mother blessed with two dependent children: one in school and one who is too young for school. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district where she grows rice and cassava. She has been engaged in her current business for more than 10 years and earns about 40,000 KHR per day. She has never had a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Noeung leads a group of three to get a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 1,200,000 KHR; her portion is 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for both of her cash crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for both of her cash crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tolgonay

texts.ru: Толгонай 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом Толонбаем воспитывают 3 детей. У Толгонай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Толгонай занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Толгонай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, Толгонай имеет большой опыт в разведении скота, доит коров, молоко сдает реализаторам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Толгонай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Tolgonay is 47, married, and raising three children with her spouse. She has a high school education and earns the family's main income through animal husbandry. She started raising livestock 17 years ago when she bought cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Tolgonay now has six dairy cows. She has lots of experience breeding cattle, milking cows, and selling milk to distributors. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her farm, Tolgonay applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy more cows. She plans to use the profits from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: Phy, 40, is a resident of the SreySnom district of Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of three who are in school. To support her family, she does paddy rice cropping on one hectare of farmland as the main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. She has been with this business for 22 years and earns 19,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Phy and the first loan for her co-borrowers in her group of three through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and to pay the rice reaping fee. She hopes that she can grow her business gradually with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and to pay the rice reaping fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Nurizat

texts.ru: Нуризат 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Дети-школьники. У Нуризат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуризат занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуризат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуризат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нуризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Nurizat is 32, married and raising two school-age children with her spouse. She has a high school education and earns her family's main income through animal husbandry, which she started ten years ago when she purchased cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work Nurizat now has four dairy cows and 15 sheep, and her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her farm, Nurizat applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy sheep and increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use the profits from the loan to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Farhat Almas

texts.en:
Farhat is 56 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three sons and two daughters. One of her sons has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for three years. Another son works as a nurse in hospital and the third son is going to school. Her elder son is responsible for supporting the family.
Farhat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her son needs to pay for maintenance of the taxi to provide better transport service to his passengers. At present, the taxi is not working properly resulting in a loss of business. This loan will help her son pay for good maintenance of the taxi and earn a profitable income by providing dependable transport services for the public.
Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of the taxi for her son's transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her crop.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, 32 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a food vending business for two years, and she sells cooked foods for meals around their village. With this business she's earning a net income amounting to PHP 200 daily. Her daily profits are usually spent on the school allowances of her children. 

Melinda would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase vegetables, food seasonings, fish, raw meat, and chicken to cook and sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will able to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, food seasonings, fish, raw meat, and chicken to cook and sell.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo de crédito Pauteñitas, este es su segundo crédito y le gusta porque conforman un grupo unido y poco a poco está saliendo adelante. Vive en el cantón de Paute, lugar que goza de un clima templado y tierras fértiles donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores y una gran variedad de frutas, su gente es amable y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, lo que cosecha vende en su cantón y es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría cuyes y cerdos, pollos. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su meta es  criar más animales.
texts.en:
María is part of the "Pauteñitas" communal bank. This is her second loan and she likes her group as it is united and is progressing little by little. She lives in Paute Canton, an area that enjoys a temperate climate and fertile land. They harvest the most beautiful flowers and a great variety of fruit. The people are hard-working and friendly. They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

María is 51 years old. She is a widow, but in her common-law relationship had 4 children. Three of them are married and live independently. Her single son works and helps her financially. The house she lives in is her own. María works doing the housework and is a farmer. What she harvests she sells in her canton or uses in the household. She also raises guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. The money from this loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for the animals. Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in a small village of Bakan district, Pursat province. Sokhom and her husband have been working as farmers, particularly rice production, for more than 10 years. Through their hardships, they aim to provide enough for the sake of their children and give them educational opportunities.

Sokhom has never been with any local state banks before. Now she has applied for a loan to build a proper latrine for her family.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sokhom is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Chansa's Group

texts.en:
Chansa is a local citizen from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is 29 years old and a mother of two young children who are too young for schooling. 

Chansa's entire family solely relies on a single business, rice cropping, which they have done for five years and it has returned her about KHR 11,000 per day. Chansa, a former borrower who has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles, has successfully and wisely repaid her past loans, to uplift her lifestyle. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. Chansa is seeking a loan of KHR 1,400,000, while her co-borrower is applying for a loan of  KHR 1,000,000. 

As the leader, Chansa will spend her entire loan portion to pay reaping fees. She strongly believes that she can collect her yield in a timely manner, with a good income in return.

loans.use: to pay reaping fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mabel Del Socorro

texts.es: Mabel del Socorro mayor de edad acompañada madre de tres hijos los cuales dos de los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega donde predomina el comercio de pescado, y el turismo por sus hermosas playas, es propietaria y administradora de una pulperia el cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación en el cual comercializa todo tipo de productos abarroteros y de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, golosinas perecederos entre otros, dado a su localización ella compra al por mayor quincenalmente a distribuidoras mayorista del departamento donde ofrece sus productos al contado y al crédito iniciando su jornada diaria desde muy temprano, dándoles una mejor atención a sus clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para compra de productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, verduras, huevos, aceite, jabón, detergentes entre otros
texts.en: Mabel del Socorro is in a common-law relationship, the mother of three children of which two are dependent on her. She is a native of the municipality of Chingandega an area predominated by fishing and tourism with it's beautiful beaches. She is the owner and administrator of a small store located in her house where she sells all kinds of daily use grocery products like: rice, sugar, oil, beans, soft drinks, sweets, perishables etc. Given her location she buys wholesale every fortnight from wholesalers in her department. She sells her product for cash and by credit. She starts her work day very early, attending to her customers. The object of this loan is to buy daily use products like rice, oil, vegetables, beans, eggs, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy products for her store like rice, oil, beans, detergents, frozen goods, etc.

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Age 40 and a local resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Savin is a married mother blessed with four children. Nowadays, she still needs to support her three kids who are in school. The only source of income which has been used to support her entire household is growing rice on an area of four hectares. The business that she has been in for five years has returned about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Savin is a fourth time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success and they have enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she joins a group of three as leader.  Savin will spend her entire loan portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can bring in her harvest on time.

loans.use: To pay reaping fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jenny Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una persona con ganas de triunfar, es madre soltera pero no por estar sola con la hija va a dejar los sueños y las metas atrás. Es mas ser madre soltera ayudo a que pensara en salir adelante, que si se puede, que todo lo que uno quiere se puede hacer realidad.
En esta carrera de la vida tiene a la familia que la apoyan, los abuelos y la mamá son personas que han estado con ella en las buenas y en las malas, son personas que le han dado ánimo.
Solo con pensar que mas adelante con la carrera de auxiliar judicial, puede aspirar a un buen trabajo y darle a la hija un buen futuro a nivel educativo y económicamente, esa es una buena motivación para estudiar. Además quiero que la hija cuando este grande vea el esfuerzo que hizo para que ella estuviera bien, para que ella tome el mismo ejemplo, para que todo lo que ella quiera hacer en esta vida lo pueda hacer, si la vida es dura pero con ganas y esfuerzo se puede hacer realidad los sueños.
 A  todas las personas que por varios motivos están pensando en que no se puede salir adelante y prepararse, no se rindan si se puede, aferresen a Dios, a las ganas que tengan y a la ayuda que kiva le puede ofrecer verán los resultados
texts.en:
Liliana is a person who has a desire to succeed. She is a single mother but she is not going to forget about her dreams and goals just because she is on her own with her daughter. It's more the case that being a single mother helped her to want to make progress, because it is possible to make all of one's dreams come true.  

Throughout the course of her life she has had people who support her; her grandparents and her mum are people who have been with her through good times and bad, people who have given her encouragement. Just thinking about how later on, with her qualification as a legal assistant, she will be able to aim for a good job and give her daughter a good future both in her education and financially, is enough motivation for her to study. 

When her daughter is older she also wants her to see the effort she made to make things right for her, so that her daughter can follow the same example. She wants her daughter to be able to do everything she wants to in life and to know that, yes, life is hard but dreams can come true through willpower and effort. 

Liliana says to everyone who for various reasons thinks that they cannot make progress in life and get an education, that they mustn't give up, yes it is possible, hold onto God and to whatever wishes they have, and with the help that Kiva can offer they will see the results.

loans.use: to pay for a term's course fees.

loans.name: Lamheng

texts.en:
Lamheng, 41, lives with her family members in a rural village of Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province and she has three children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. She and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava as primary sources of the family’s income. The current business earns her about US$4 per day and she can save about US$2 each day for future needs.

Lamheng is a first-cycle client with KIVA's partner, VisionFund. Now she is asking for an educational loan to pay the tuition fees for her daughter to study Finance and Banking. She hopes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy aluminium sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
Len is a local farmer residing in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is 40 years old and a mother of five kids.  To struggle for the daily cost of living, she grows rice on a half-hectare area as her main source of income. On average, she can earn up to 13,600 KHR per day to support her family. 

Len is not a first-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loans has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan. Len will spend her entire portion of the loan to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to bring in her harvest in a timely manner with a good selling price.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de NIONKOMA, dans la préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, comprimes et de poissons. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de la clientèle elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente NENE la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises  n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments et tabac en poudre à Wacoro (lieu d’approvisionnement). Elle compte acheter 10kg de sel, 5kg de poisson fumé, 20 cubes Maggi. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle à la maison en espèce.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  7500FCFA. Ce bénéfice mensuel sera utilisé pour les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group BENKOLA is composed of married women. who average 37 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nionkoma, in the prefecture of Dioila, a region de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, 'comprimes', and fish. 

The women of the group are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous customer demand, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise, as cited above. 

This client, NENE, the second person sitting at the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of condiments and chewing tobacco in Wacoro (where supplies are gotten). She intends to purchase 10 kg of salt, 5 kg of smoked fish, and 20 Maggi [bouillon] cubes. Sales are made in cash to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de, commune de NIONKOMA
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, d'arachide,  de céréales, de tubercules, et de condiments. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente SINA la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains d’arachide chose qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs d’arachide avec les paysans sur place au village, et quelques fois au marché, qui seront  décortiqués et mis au marché. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte  en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses quotidiennes: frais de scolarisation, sanitaire, et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The Siguitemason group is made up of married women with an average age of 44 years and four children on average. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nionkoma, in the district of Wacoro, located in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women know each other through being relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade groundnuts, cereals, root vegetables and condiments and this is their second solidarity loan.
 
Sina, pictured standing in the middle, never went to school. She currently sells groundnuts, which is a business she inherited from her mother. 

Sina intends to buy two sacks of groundnuts, which she buys from the farmers in the village or occasionally from the market. She then shells them and resells them to both men and women for cash. She is hoping to make 17,500 CFA francs a month, which she will use for daily expenses: school fees, health care and clothing her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Dalanda Sow's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2010. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture et le petit commerce.

Goulo qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture et le petit commerce.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter des semences pour une valeur de 40000f et acheter des marchandises pour une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was set up in December 2010. It is made up of members who live in the same village. They practice farming and have small trading businesses.

Goulo, who is on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 26 years old, married and mother to two children.

She practices farming and has a small trading business. With her loan she is planning to buy 40,000 francs worth of seeds and spend  50,000 francs on other goods.

Her aim is to increase her savings and help out her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other goods.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is aged 31 and is married with one child. She owns a boutique and has been running the business for the past seven years. She would like to use the loan, to buy more retail items such as sugar, soaps, rice and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more retail items such as sugar, soap, rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Amka Tujenge Group

texts.fr: Le Client Nyakabinku est un brave commerçant, d’une expérience de 6 ans président et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Amka Tujenge», entrepreneur dynamique,  âgé de 48 ans et père de 7 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 1 encore gamin. Le client est vendeur de divers pièces de rechanges véhicules et sociétaire d’un garage. Il installe ses marchandises dans un magasin du centre ville Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 30 filtres a huile, 20 filtres a gazoil, 40 pièces amortisseurs. Il démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu dans le revenu de rente. Dans l’avenir, Il souhaite  accroitre son capital et être grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The borrower, Nyakabinku, is an honest shopkeeper with 6 years of experience. He is the president and member of the «Amka Tujenge» business association and also a dynamic entrepreneur. He is the 48-year-old father to 7 children, 6 of which are receiving an education, the remaining child still being a boy. The borrower sells various spare vehicle parts and is a business partner in a garage. He displays his wares in a shop in the centre of town. He is requesting this loan from Hekima in order to grow his business. He plans to buy to buy 30 oil filters, 20 diesel filters and 40 oil dampers. He will start up his business with the funds received from private income. In the future, he wishes to increase his capital and become a wholesaler. He also wishes to clothe, feed and give his children an education. He would like to thank Hekima for their support of male and female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system by offering them loans, especially during this difficult period of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 30 oil filters, 20 diesel filters and 40 oil dampers

loans.name: Christelle

texts.fr: Christelle est une jeune dame célibataire âgée de 25 ans mère de famille. Elle a un bar restaurant qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis un an. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son savoir vivre, elle a développer une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire à cause gde la petitesse de son capital, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité car il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses casiers de boissons, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en: Christelle, age 25, is a young single mother who owns a restaurant-bar in the capital that she has been running for the past year. This activity allows her to support her family. Her good manners have helped her to build a customer base that is steadily increasing, but which she can no longer satisfy due to her limited capital. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to increase her stock of beverages. This should help to bolster her profits, which she plans to invest in the expansion of her activity, while a portion will be used to provide for her family.

loans.use: to bolster her stock (cases of beverages).

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en: Sarvan has a store. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a teacher. They are living in the Fuzuli region but Sarvan’s family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. In the store, Sarvan sells different clothes and shoes. This is his second loan. Today he wants to support his business, so he wants to buy more products for sale. For this reason, he needs a loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Sarvan says he is greatly thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is from the village of Centro 2 in the town of Angadanan. He is 25 years old and single.

To earn a living, Jeffrey operates a transportation business with the use of his motorcycle. He has been in this business for four years and typically earns at least 300 PHP each day. He is happy because, through his transportation business, he is able to meet his daily needs.

Now, Jeffrey wants to borrow a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy a sprocket, tires and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes to increase his daily earnings from this transportation business so that he can save money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a sprocket, tires and gasoline for the upkeep of his motorcycle

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a taxi driver. He is 23 years old and single. Taleh lives with his parents. He is engaged and in the near future wants to get married. Taleh’s mother is a housewife and is not employed. The family lives in the Absheron region. 

Taleh is a taxi driver. He needs an 800 AZN loan to buy winter tires for the taxi, so he has applied to Komak Credit Union. 

In the future, Taleh wants to replace his car, to get married, and to have children. 

He is thankful for the aid from the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy winter tires for taxi

loans.name: Basaid

texts.en:
Basaid is 27 years old and lives in Gardnersville, one of the early communities in Liberia; it is well-known. 

He is married, and is a high school graduate. He has a two-year-old child who stays at home. 

For a year now, he has been selling rice, oil, and other items from a shop in his community. He makes lots of profit since he is the only one who is involved in this business in his community. One of the problems he is facing is he has less income. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and other items for his business. 

His plan is to build a decent house and educate his children. 

He appreciates all the lenders of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Tamba J.

texts.en:
Tamba J. lives at New Kru Town area in Montserrado County. His wife is a nurse and he completed the 12th grade. He earned a certificate from a vocational school to make furniture. 

He has a two year old child who attends school. For the past five years, he has run a shop to produce and sell chairs, beds, and dressers. He makes a good profit because he sells these products at a cheaper rate than his competition. Business problems include a small income and the high cost of transportation. He requests a loan to purchase more wood, vanish, and sandpaper. 

He plans to build a house and become a famous business man.

loans.use: to purchase more woods, vanished, sandpaper, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old, lives in Bardnersville, and is married with two children between 8 and 12 years old who live at home. His wife is a local businesswoman. For the past six years, he has been selling lots of alcoholic drinks from a shop.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks for his business. 

He started his business with a little amount from friends. His mother taught him this trade, and he like his business because it  provides for him and his family. The problem he is facing is a shortage of goods. 

His plans are to send his children to school, build his house, and a store.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable) and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Isreal is 42 years old and lives in Bardnersville.  He is married, and has two children, ages 5 and 8, who are currently in school. 

For the past six years he has been selling auto parts in the local market. One of his major problems is the shortage of goods in his shop. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more auto parts for his business. 

He hopes to expand his business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more auto parts for his business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es un joven emprendedor de 41 años nacido en La Paz – Bolivia, es soltero y vive junto a su tía, quien fue su apoyo durante el transcurso de su vida. 
Abel se dedica al comercio de artículos varios en un conocido mercado de esta ciudad, cuyos ingresos utiliza principalmente para apoyar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar, con mucho esfuerzo culminó sus estudios en la carrera de Comercio Internacional de la Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana y solicitó un crédito educativo para poder obtener su título profesional que es uno de sus más grandes anhelos. 
Abel manifiesta que con los conocimientos profesionales adquiridos, le permitirán mejorar son muy la administración de su negocio; asimismo, en el ámbito personal desea poder conformar una familia y brindarles condiciones adecuadas de vida. Su sueño es llegar a ser un exportador e importador exitoso y con el fruto de su trabajo dar oportunidades de superación a otras personas, así como a él se las están otorgando ahora. 
Abel agradece de antemano a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Abel, age 41, is an enterprising and youthful man who was born in La Paz, Bolivia. He is single and lives with his aunt who has been his support throughout his life.

Abel sells various items at a well-known market in the city. His earnings are used primarily for the household expenses. With great effort, he is finishing his degree in International Business at La Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana. He is requesting a loan so that he can obtain his professional degree, which is one of his greatest wishes. Abel says that the professional knowledge that he gained will allow him to do a better job of managing his business. In addition, his personal ambition is to start a family and provide them with adequate living conditions. His dream is to become a successful importer and exporter. The results of his work will provide opportunities to other people so that they can succeed, similar to the one that is being given to him now.

Abel would like to thank in advance those individuals who have used their financial resources to help others and provide them with new growth opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for the completion of his degree in International Business.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun, a resident of Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, is 39 years old and a mother of five kids. On the half hectare of rice she plants as her single source of income, she is able to get about 7,800 KHR per day on average to cover the daily cost of living. This is the fourth cycle for  Phoeun and first cycle for her co-borrower.

 The past loan, which Phoeun has fully repaid, has helped her to uplift her lifestyle gradually. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan. Phoeun is the leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can harvest her crop in a timely manner, with good income received.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea, 31, lives with her family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. For the last 13 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting rubber trees as main sources of their family’s income. The current business earns her about KHR 44,000 per day.

Kea has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a fourth loan. Kea is going to buy fertilizers for her rubber trees and use a portion of her loan on buying more piglets. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rubber trees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shaiyrkul

texts.en:
Shayirkul is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia in the  department of International and Business Law.

“I decided to enroll AUCA's Department of International and Business Law. There are many reasons for applying to this department. I want to get the best education, it is very important for me. One cannot reach any success without a high quality education nowadays. I have heard  that not every Kyrgyzstan university can provide a good foundation of knowledge. There are good educational institutions and AUCA is one of them. After graduating from this university, students become skilled and qualified. I have been dreaming of entering this university for a long time, and I will do my best to meet everybody's hopes who support my journey to get the education and profession that I prefer. It will be a great honor for me to study at this university. I would be very pleased to receive your help and it will serve as a great stimulus for my further studies.”
