loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags of flour and butter

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 42-year-old lady from Katito region in the western part of Kenya. She is married and takes care of her family. She also takes care of five people in her family.

She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she has been doing for the last five years. She generates a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She is applying for her solar loan with VisionFund Kenya. This will help to provide energy in her home for lighting and other uses, such as charging the phone. 

Her dream is to grow her business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel (sunshine box)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old married woman. She has one child who is three years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food and tea. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area by the roadside and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortage. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to increase the size of her restaurant to enable her to accommodate more customers. Her business goal is to have a large restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to fulfill her dreams as an entrepreneur. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase the size of her restaurant

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a married Iraqi client who is 36 years old and lives with his family consisting of three members, two of whom are employed. Amir owns a carpenter’s shop; he specializes in making furniture.

 Amir has been in this field since 2007, and through practice he gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee and is well-known in his neighborhood, thanks to his competitive and affordable prices. 

Amir is applying for a loan of 1,200 USD. He will use this loan to buy a wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory. Amir is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be aggressive in business. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize flour, potatoes and groceries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy inventory of beans and maize for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale grocery within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a great role model to her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory of beans and maize

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en: Savorn, 38, is a mother with three children. Currently, she needs to support only one child who is in school. The main sources of her family’s income are rice farming (on 1.5 hectares of land) and fishing selling. These businesses generate about 19,400 KHR per day for her. Including this loan, Savorn and her co-borrower are third-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). This group of two is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Savorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline for irrigation, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can triple the yield of her crop so that she can keep her child in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline for irrigation, and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Sokteng

texts.en:
Sokteng is a 21-year-old married woman with one son. She and her family live in a wooden house, with thatched walls, in a rural village of the Memot district of Kampong Cham province.

To earn a living, she and her husband grow cassava, which they have been doing two years. Her current business operations earn her approximately 30,000 KHR per day, which enables her to save approximately 20,000 KHR each day for her family's future needs.

Sokteng has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle already. She explains that she successfully repaid her prior loan, which helped her to better provide for her family’s living expenses. Now, she is requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR, to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her current business so as to increase her family’s income and to thereby improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Crisencio previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his personal, household and business expenditures. He also has a shuttle service used by a company for taking their employees to work.

Crisencio would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Crisencio dreams of having more units of Jeepneys and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima is a 56-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons. Her husband sells different kinds of vegetables to earn a living. One of her sons is mechanic. Her husband and son contribute their income to meet the family's needs.

Her husband would like to purchase different kinds of vegetables for re-sale purposes, but due to financial problems, he is unable to purchase these vegetables in bulk. Therefore, Kaneez Fatima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan would help her husband purchase vegetables for the business. She hopes to save some of the profits she expects her husband to generate as a result of the loan. Kaneez Fatima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase different kinds of vegetables for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 35-year-old married woman. She and her husband live with their four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband earns low wages by working for a small firm.

Khalida owns a small clothing business that she operates from her home. She purchases clothing at low prices from the market and sells the clothing for higher prices in her community. The ladies in town really like her collection of clothes. She explains that her family members appreciate her for her efforts.

Now that it is the winter season, she wants to buy winter clothing to re-sell in her community. But she has insufficient capital to buy more clothing. As a result, she is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing and to thereby meet her customers' demands. She hopes to provide her children with a bright future and a good education. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand by purchasing winter clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is from the village of Bantug Petines. She is 47 years old, married, and blessed with five children. Elsa is engaged in a hog-raising business, while her husband manages their transportation business, specifically motorcycle transport. She and her husband both work hard to provide their children a better quality of life. To obtain her goal, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase vitamins and feed for the proper growth of her hogs. Elsa hopes to grow her business with the help of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has a single child. Bayan and his wife work in order to provide for the family’s monthly expenses. Bayan owns a small shop, where he has some Play Stations and televisions that provide entertainment services for his neighborhood’s children. He has been providing for his family through this business since 2008. Bayan has good experience in this field and has an excellent reputation in his neighborhood.

Bayan is applying for a loan of $2,400 USD in order to buy some modern Play Stations and to buy more gaming DVDs. He is aiming to grow his business and open a bigger entertainment center one day, so he may provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy some modern Play Stations and to buy more gaming DVDs

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years old. She describes herself as courageous. Stella operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a fair place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as an unfavorable climate which affects the growth of crops. 

Stella will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to buy more land and increase her production within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a well-educated family and be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Все дети помогают по хозяйству. У Гульмиры - высшее педагогическое образование, она работает в качестве преподавателя русского языка и литературы в местной школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 52, married and raising four children with her spouse. The children all help out around the house. Gulmira has a degree in education and teaches Russian language and literature at the local school. She earns additional income for her family through animal husbandry, which she started 14 years ago when she bought cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Gulmira now has one dairy cow, one horse, one bull, and ten sheep. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her farm, she applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows for breeding. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money to finish building a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco, 37 años de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario del municipio de chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: electrodomésticos menores (reproductor de DVD, Abanicos, Planchas, Licuadoras, Otros), bicicletas, celulares, productos plásticos entre otros, dicha mercadería la compra a distribuidores mayoristas de nuestra ciudad de Chinandega la que entrega posteriormente a sus clientes con sistemas de pagos semanales, quincenales y mensualidades, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia con capital propio producto de sus ahorros como empleado, el cual tiene ya ocho años de dedicarse a este negocio, el desde muy temprano comienza su jornada de trabajo la mayor parte de su mercadería están en cuentas por cobrar, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer en su negocio y lograr de adquirir una vivienda propia, el objetivo de este crédito es par a invertir en mercadería como: abanicos, planchas, productos plásticos, cosméticos, celulares entre otros
texts.en:
37-year old Juan Francisco is married and has two children. He is from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. To earn his living Juan buys and sells merchandise such as small appliances (DVD players, fans, irons, blenders etc.), bicycles, cell phones, plastic products etc. He buys the items from wholesale distributors in Chinandega and then delivers them to his customers. They pay him either weekly, bi-monthly, or monthly. He has both regular and occasional customers.

Juan started his business using savings from his previous job and has now had his business for eight years. He starts work early in the morning. Most of his merchandise is sold on account.

One of Juan’s dreams is to see his business grow. He also wants to get a house of his own. The goal of the loan is to invest it in his business by buying items such as fans, irons, plastic products, cosmetics, and cell phones.

loans.use: buy small appliances, plastic products, fans etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items, fruits and vegetables and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold

loans.name: Najam

texts.en:
Najam is a hard working Iraqi client. He is 50 years old and has 2 children. Najam and his eldest child share the family income together.
Najam owns a small shop where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. He is very well known in the neighborhood thanks to the high quality of his products. He has been providing his family's income through this business since 2003 and has good experience in this field.
Najam is applying for a loan of 2,000 USD to expand his shop and to buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide better income for his family.

loans.use: to expand his shop and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Andrea Milena

texts.es:
Había una vez una joven llamada milena patricia que se enamoró muy joven y dejo en un segundo plano a la familia se fue a vivir con el novio pero no pensó en superarse academicamente, cuando estaba con él, se dedicó solo a estar con el novio, no se dedico a estudiar ni pensó en superarse academicamente, 
Tiene una una hija y una de las motivaciones más importantes para salir adelante  es ella, escucho de campo alto y le llamo la atención el programa  cosmetología y estética, desea mejorar la calidad de vida de la hija y la de ella, puesto que cuenta solo con el apoyo de ella y ya que sabe que con kiva le pueden subsidiar un aparte del estudio ella  sabe que puede cumplir y sería muy bueno que ella cumpliera el sueño que tiene de mejorar su educación y tener un futuro  aun mejor.
texts.en:
There was once a young woman named Milena Patricia who fell in love quite young and, leaving behind her family, went to live with her boy friend. She failed to focus on getting ahead academically. When she was with him, she though only of being with her boy friend. She did not study, nor did she think of advancing her education.

Now that young woman has a daughter and one of the mother's most important motivations to get ahead is her daughter. She now hears the call to advance her education, and she is motivated to enter a Cosmetology and Aesthetics training program. She wants to improve the quality of life for both her and her daughter. Since the child depends solely on her mother's help, and since Kiva can provide a loan for a portion of her studies, she understands that she should comply, and that it will be very good if she achieves her dream of improving her education and having a better future.

loans.use: pay a semester's matriculation fee.

loans.name: Sabino Antonio

texts.es:
Sabino de 38 años de edad, desafortunadamente solo estudió hasta séptimo grado, pues su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, y eso no le permitió continuar sus estudios, además, él era el mayor de los hermanos y se vio en la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, ya que eran demasiado pobres. Está separado, tiene 3 hijos y actualmente solo 2 hijos depende de él.


Él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, trabajo que ha desempeñado desde que era un niño y fue su tio quien le enseñó esta actividad, pues en aquel tiempo, no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura. 

Además de trabajar en la agricultura, él alquila 84,000 metros cuadrdaos de tierra que son de un amigo que vive en Estados Unidos, entonces él se las administra.
Sabino se levanta a las 4:00 AM, y debe trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de 1 kilómetro a pie, hora de salida no tiene, pues regresa a su casa hasta que termina de hacer sus actividades programadas en ese día, luego de sus labores atiende a sus hijos. En el trabajo de la agricultura, es su hijo mayor quien le ayuda.


El necesita del crédito, para invertirlo en la siembra de 14,000 metros cuadrdaos de maíz, además desea sembrar yuca,  porque el año pasado hizo siembra de esta, y vio que es buena tierra para trabajar con dicho cultivo. En el transcurso de estos días, comiezan a movilizarse para la siembra de este año, pero por el momento está comprando y vendiendo semilla de marañon.

En el futuro, él sueña con tener tener una vivienda digna, en el cual puedan habitar sus hijos,  poder darles los estudios necesarios y de esta manera logren tener un mejor trabajo que él. El crédito será un mayor esfuerzo, pero él confía que con la ayuda de Dios,  obtendrá una mejor situación económica y mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sabino is 38 years old. Unfortunately, he only studied until the seventh grade. His family had limited resources which did not allow him to continue his studies. Furthermore, he was the eldest of his siblings and he saw the need to help his parents by working since they were very poor. He is separated and has three children. Currently, only two children depend on him.

He makes a living sowing corn and beans, work that he has performed since he was a child. His uncle taught him this activity. At that time, he did not have any other way to survive other than agriculture. In addition to working in agriculture, he rents 84,000 square meters of land that belong to a friend that lives in the United States, so he manages it.

Sabino gets up at 4:00 a.m. and has to travel to the field where he has his corn field. He walks 1 kilometer on foot. He does not have a quitting time; he returns home when he finishes his work scheduled for that day. After his work, he takes care of his children.  In his agricultural work, his eldest son helps him.

He needs this loan to invest in planting 14,000 square meters of corn. He also wants to plant yucca because last year he planted it and saw that the land is good for this crop. In the course of these days, they are beginning to mobilize for the planting for this year, but right now he is buying and selling cashew seeds.

In the future, he dreams of having a dignified home in which his children can live, and to be able to provide the necessary studies to his children so that they can have better work than him. The loan will be a greater sacrifice, but he confides that with God’s help, he will obtain a better economic situation and better quality of life for his family and for him.

loans.use: to plant 14,000 square meters of corn, and also to plant yucca.

loans.name: Carlos Remberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 37 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta noveno grado, pues decidió dedicarse al trabajo del campo, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en oficios domésticos, tienen una pequeña hija. Además de su esposa e hija, su madre también vive con él.

En la actualidad, él trabaja en la agricultura y lo aprendió de su padre, pues desde niño tenía una relación muy cercana con él, además de trabajar en el campo, tiene un pequeño negocio de “Carwash”.

Para trasladarse a su trabajo en el campo, hace un recorrido en bicicleta de aproximadamente 3 kilómetros., para llegar a las 6:00 AM y salir a las 3:00 PM. En su negocio del “Carwash”, es un familiar suyo quien le ayuda mientras él se encuentra trabajando en la agricultura.


El necesita del crédito, para comprar una novilla y para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maiz, además tiene la cosecha anterior que aún  no ha vendido.

En el futuro, él sueña con tener una vivienda digna, pues donde vive actualmente no es propia. Además sueña con brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar a su hija, también desea tener mas ganado para adquirir mayores ganancias y está seguro que con la ayuda de Dios y este crédito, todos sus sueños serán posibles.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old. He only studied until the ninth grade. He then decided to dedicate himself to working the fields. He is in a relationship, and his partner works in the domestic trade. They have a small daughter. As well as his wife and daughter, his mother also lives with him.

Currently, he works in agriculture, which he learned from his father. Since he was a child, he has had a very close relationship with him. As well as working the land, he has a small carwash business.

To travel to his work in the field, he makes a trip on bicycle of approximately 3 kilometers, arriving at 6:00 a.m. and leaving at 3:00 p.m. In his car washing business, one of his family members helps him while he performs his agricultural work.

He needs this loan to buy a heifer and to plant 7,000 square meters of corn. Furthermore, he has the previous harvest that he still has not sold.

In the future, he dreams of owning a dignified home; where he currently lives is not his own. Furthermore, he dreams of providing the opportunity of studying to his daughter. He also wishes to have more livestock to acquire better profits, and he is sure that with the help provided by God and this loan, all of his dreams will be possible.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Ruth Miryam

texts.es:
Ella se llama Miryam, tiene 32 años, es una mujer divorciada, tiene 2 hijos y trabaja en servicio al cliente.
Escogió esta cerrera porque desea aumentar los ingresos para poder brindarle un buen futuro a los hijos y para demostrar las capacidades que tiene en algo que le puede ayudar a la gente en el medio dela salud.
El proyecto a futuro es independizarse creando el propio negocio y lograr todas las metas personales y profesionales que tiene a corto y largo plazo.
Necesita el apoyo de kiva para poder terminar el semestre y graduarse, ya que los gastos que tiene la sobrepasan para poder dar cumplimiento a campo alto.  
Agradece a campo alto todo el apoyo brindado para poder culminar la carrera.
texts.en:
Her name is Miryam, she is 32 years old, divorced, and has two children.  She works in customer service.  She entered this career because she wanted to increase her income in order to provide her children with a better future, and demonstrate her ability in a field that can help people's health.  Her plan for the future is to become independent, start her own business, and reach her short and long-term personal and professional goals.

She needs the help of Kiva to finish the semester and graduate because her expenses are exceeding what she can afford to pay.  She is grateful to Campo Alto for the hep they have given her in completing her education.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кулнаре 49 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает дочь. У Кулнары - средне-специальное образование, работает в местной поликлинике медсестрой. Стаж работы более 27 лет, имеет большое уважение среди сельчан, всегда готова придти на помощь заболевшему. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Кулнара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец параллельно Кулнара занимается полеводством, имеет 1,20 ГА поливной земли на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Kulnara is 49 years old, divorced and raising a daughter on her own. Kulnara has finished junior college and works at a local community clinic as a nurse. She has over 27 years of work experience. She is greatly respected in her village and is always ready to help a patient. As an additional source of income for her family, Kulnara raises livestock and grows produce, having started 26 years ago by buying livestock for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Kulnara’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow and five sheep. In addition, Kulnara grows produce; she has 1.2 ha [about 3 acres] of land, where she grows beans and clover for sale. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Kulnara has applied  to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution ifor a loan to increase her livestock headcount by buying cows. Kulnara plans to use the resulting revenues for an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save up to buy some household appliances.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: José Marcial

texts.es:
José es una persona trabajadora de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, él está casado y su esposa se dedica a  los quehaceres del hogar, tienen cuatro hijos y solo dos asisten a la escuela.


Su padre le enseñó a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace 13 años, realizaba un arduo trabajo en el campo sembrando 7,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. José es un hombre trabajador, por lo cual, le gusta desempeñarse en diferentes tipos de trabajos, tiene un pequeño molino con el que brinda sus servicios a los vecinos.

El necesita del préstamo, para comprar una novilla, así se le estará dando a José, el apoyo para que pueda invertirlo en una actividad productiva muy buena y además tendrá otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.

José anhela que sus 2 hijos continúen estudiando y lo que más le gustaría es que puedan graduarse en una carrera universitaria, trabajará muy duro para ayudarles a cumplir este sueño, además le gustaría comprar más ganado el siguiente año. 
Sueña también con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para que no vivan en carencias.
texts.en:
José is a 39 year old working man with a 6th grade education.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have four children, two of whom are in school.  His father taught him how to work in agriculture, and for the past 13 years, he has worked hard in the field planting 7,500 square meters of corn and beans.  José is a hardworking man, which is why he likes to perform different types of work.  He has a small mill that he uses to provide services to his neighbors.  

He needs this loan to purchase a heifer.  This will be helpful to José because he will be able to use it for a productive activity and develop a new source of income for his family.  José hopes that his two children will continue studying and he would love to see them graduate from college.  He will work very hard to help them reach this dream.  He would also like to purchase more cattle next year.  He dreams of improving his family's quality of life so that they will no longer live in poverty.

loans.use: purchase a heifer.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana Milena, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, alegre, es una gran madre de dos hermosos  hijos, ella es una madre cabeza de familia  con ganas de salir adelante, con ganas de aumentar los conocimientos para poder así mismo brindarle a los hijos una mejor calidad de vida , a ella siempre le ha gustado  todo lo que tenga que ver con el área de la salud, por eso ella decidió estudiar salud oral, ya que con esos conocimientos ella  ayudara a muchas personas  a tener una mejor sonrisa, el convenio con kiva le serviría de ayuda ya que los recursos económicos son un poco escasos y el valor de las mensualidades seria mas económico.
texts.en:
Ana Milena is an enterprising, charismatic and happy woman.  She is the mother of two beautiful children.  She is the head of the family and is eager to get ahead.  She has a desire to expand her knowledge so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.  She has always enjoyed everything related to health, which is why she has decided to study oral health.  With this knowledge, she will be able to help many people have a better smile. 

The Kiva loan will be helpful because her financial resources are limited, and it would make the monthly payments more affordable.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Soeng's Group

texts.en:
Soeng is a 44-year-old villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. To feed her family, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland to earn income and is a paid worker for another fee. She has been with this business for 15 years and it has returned her around 40,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for six cycles in the past with successful repayment. Now her living condition is getting better than before. Now she teams up in a group of three to get a new loan. She and one of her group members are applying for a loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each, while another one is applying for 1,100,000 KHR. As the group leader, Soeng will use her loan portion to pay for labor fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. She hopes this loan will promptly support her crop on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Karen Dayanna

texts.es:
Karen dayanna  es una mujer de 18 años que nació el 2 de junio, ella convive con los padres, abuela paterna y hermano, salió del colegio en el año 2012, ella desde ese entonces quería estudiar cosmetología y estética integral los padres con mucho esfuerzo la apoyaron por q ella siempre fue buena estudiante y la matricularon en campo alto a pesar de que esta carrera es algo cara por motivo de productos, ellos la apoyaron 2 semestres, hace 4 meses uno de los padres se quedo sin trabajo así que le dijeron que no la podían apoyar económicamente con los estudios ya que tienen otras responsabilidades como lo son arriendo, servicios públicos, alimentación, entre otras.                                                                               
Así que ella desesperada quería buscar trabajo pero por la corta edad y por no tener experiencia laboral no ha podido conseguir un trabajo para poder terminar los estudios, ya que tan solo le queda un semestre para graduarse de cosmetología y estética integral, ella está buscando un apoya ya que el mayor anhelo es graduarse, no quiere dejar los estudios porque es una mujer responsable y dedicada y en esos dos semestres se destaco con notas excelentes y excelentes trabajos y por esta razón anhela graduarse en el mes de julio del año 2014.
texts.en:
Karen Dayanna is an 18 year old woman who was born on June 2nd.  She lives with her parents, her paternal grandmother and a brother.  She graduated from high school in 2012, and since then, wanted to study cosmetology and holistic aesthetics.  Her parents have supported her with a lot of effort because she has always been a good student.  They enrolled her in Campo Alto despite it being an expensive career given the necessary materials.  They supported her for two semesters, but four months ago, one of her parents lost their job and they told her they could no longer financially support her studies since they already had other responsibilities like rent, utilities, and food among others.  Therefore, she desperately searched for a job, but because of her youth and lack of work experience, she has been unable to find a job that would enable her to finish her studies.  

Since she only has one semester left before graduating her cosmetology and holistic aesthetics program, she is seeking support because her biggest dream is to graduate.  She does not want to abandon her education because she is a responsible and dedicated woman, and in those two semesters, she excelled with great grades and work.  For this reason, she hopes to graduate in July of 2014.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en: Yon is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 55 years old and a mother of eight children. Nowadays, only four of her children rely on her, as they are still in school. The main sources of her family income are from raising pigs and selling pork. Including this loan, she has borrowed five times from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. She and two of her group members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, while the fourth borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy more piglets to raise. She highly believes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Ma. Menaliza

texts.en:
Ma. Menaliza is a diligent mother, who supports her husband in generating income. She is 49 years old and has three school-aged children. The couple aims to upgrade their standard of living, in order to continue sending their children to school.

Ma. Meneliza is engaged in the cooking and selling of meals and snacks, in her community. She plans to prepare more kinds of recipes to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings, which she will use in her food-vending business. She hopes that someday, she will further improve the business, through the financial assistance she has requested.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings, for her food vending business

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 50 years old and a villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is a mother with nine children, three of whom still count on her as they are in school. To support this big family, she grows rice on a half-hectare of farmland while her husband is responsible for a pig-raising business and a palm-sugar making business. 

The 20 years engagement in current business has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. Touch, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), leads a group of two to get  a new loan. She is seeking for 800,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pigs for raising. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle at a good pace.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising.

loans.name: Merlida

texts.en:
A hardworking mother of three from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Merlida is a 34-year-old farmer who manages her farmland to feed her family. She joined PMPC in 2008 and has since received several loans, always maintaining a good repayment record. 

Recently, Merlida requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other farm inputs. She wants to improve the family's living conditions and be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 44-year-old, married woman. She has five children, whose ages range from 1 year to 26 years. She describes herself as "patient."

She operates a retail shop, where she sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a local market, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is the high cost of transport.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a stock of bread, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bread, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is the mother of one child, who is too young for schooling. She is 31 years old and resides in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. To strive for a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She has been involved with this work for five years, earning about 20,600 KHR per day.

Sarom is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two now, to get a new loan. Sarom will spend her entire loan portion to build a latrine for her household. She hopes that she can own a decent latrine for her family, and to improve the sanitation practices of her family.

loans.use: To build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Gaukhar

texts.ru: Гаухар 55 лет, не замужем, одна воспитывает 4 детей. Дочери замужем, старший сын работает в России, часть своей зарплаты высылает матери в Кыргызстан, самая младшая дочь - студентка. У Гаухар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гаухар занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гаухар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 2 жеребенка, 25 овец. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Гаухар также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гаухар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Гаухар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en:
Gaukhar is 55, unmarried and raising 4 children on her own.  Her daughters are all married, and her oldest son works in Russia, sending a portion of his income back home to her in Kyrgyzstan.  Her youngest daughter is a student.  Gaukhar has the equivalent of a high school education and is a crop and livestock farmer by trade, first starting 29 years ago with 5,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has a dairy cow, 2 calves, 2 young horses and 25 sheep, as well as a 1-hectare plot of land for growing beans and clover for use on her own farm as well as to sell for a profit.  Her monthly income is 12,000 som.  She has everything she needs to raise livestock, including hay and other fodder prepared for her animals.  

To further develop her farm, Gaukhar is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy sheep.  She hopes this will help her increase her monthly income from producing milk, and plans on setting aside some of the profits due to the loan to buy even more livestock, as well as some new household appliances.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Due to financial hardships, Jennifer engages in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. She is 32 years old and has three children attending school. Together with her husband, they aim to improve their sources of living in order to generate sufficient income to support the education of their children and to satisfy their basic necessities. 

In this regard, Jennifer plans to strengthen her business, to increase her income. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted, so that she can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie  is  32 years old, single, and a resident of Barangay Toril Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. He earns a living through fishing.

Last year he became a member of PMPC and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 9,000 to purchase fishing materials.

Ronnie deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
Thach is a mother in her late 30s. She is from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, where she grows paddy rice. She has three kids to support, and all of them are in school. From her business, she can earn up to 22,800 KHR per day. She has had her current business for eight years.

Thach has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she forms a group of two, to get a new loan. Thach, the leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy materials to construct a latrine. Her goal is to improve the sanitation practices of her household. She hopes to own a decent latrine for her kids, preventing them from contracting diseases that result from poor sanitation.

loans.use: To buy materials with which to construct a latrine

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol is a 35-year-old woman who is blessed with two kids. She makes a living through rice cropping and her work at the garment factory. She is now able to earn up to 22,500 KHR per day to cover the daily basic needs of her family.

For this cycle, she forms a group of two to obtain a latrine loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a proper latrine for her kids. She hopes this new latrine will bring a good and healthy practice in her family.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her kids.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a villager from the Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children. Two children are in school and the third is too young for school.

She sells vegetables as the main source of income and tailors clothes in the local area as her supplementary source of income. She has been with VisionFund five times and it has helped her to provide sufficient food for her family and to keep her kids in school. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her her entire loan potion to buy more vegetables and tailoring supplies. She hopes to expand her business on time so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fabric.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en: Rogelyn is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is 26 years old and has 3 children who are school-aged. She manages a little sari-sari store that sells a variety of items.  Her store promises a good income of PHP 3,000 per month.  She registered her membership with the Cooperative in 2013 and has repaid her previous loan in a timely manner.  Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase inventory, including rice, soft drinks, soap, and other items.  In the future, Rogelyn hopes to send all of her children to school and to live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is married with five children. Lucita is 75 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Lucita is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She also has a poultry business. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and five sacks of feed.

Lucita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and five sacks of feed

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 37 years old and a married woman; she is living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works as a laborer in a small firm on daily wages. He is the only  earner for the entire family. 

Bushra's husband's income is very low, therefore she decided to have another source of income in the form of an electrician's shop. Her son has been troubleshooting the electrical components in water pumps, fans, and other electrical accessories. Now he has become very expert in his trade and can manage the full affairs of an electrician’s shop. 

Bushra wants to buy initial electrical goods to set up the newly opened electrical goods shop for her son. For this reason she contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her son will be able to buy initial stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches and other electrical goods.

Bushra hopes the lenders of Kiva will be so good as to help her. She is very thankful to Kiva, Kiva's lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy initial stock for newly opened electrician's shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be very honest. He operates a retail business where he sells goats and cows. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good market and his primary customers are local residents. Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be lack the of funds.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more goats and cows to sell. His business goal is to open a ranch within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Tep's Group

texts.en:
Tep is a farmer from Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 40 years old and a mother of two dependent children; both of them are still in school. To feed the family, she tailors clothes as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.  She has been with this business for ten years.  

Tep, who has never been with VisionFund (Kivas partner) before, is the leader of this group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to use her entire loan portion to buy more tailoring supplies. She hopes to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring supplies

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a new client of the Ugafode branch who has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 which he will use to buy retail stock. He is a married man with four children who hails from a suburb of Rwakabengo, Southern division, Rukungiri municipality. It is in the same location where he owns a retail shop.

His major challenge has been lack of enough capital to meet his clients’ demand. He has hopes that with this loan, he will be able to increase his income and be able to sustain himself and his family.

Nelson also hopes that he will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover his tuition fee

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea is a villager from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and a mother of one school child. To support her family, she grows rice on 1.5 hectares (the main source of income) and she tailors clothes as supplemental income.

Phea has been with VisionFund for ages. With successful repayment, the past loans have enabled her to uplift her living conditions better than before and to expand her business gradually. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for insecticide, seeds, and labor. She hopes that her family’s living conditions will get better than before.

loans.use: to pay for insecticide, seeds, and labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Imelda cooks and sells snack foods within her community. She is 44 years old and has four school-age children. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Imelda needs to earn a higher income in order to support her children's education She is therefore seeking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, yeast and other ingredients for her business. She is hoping that she will improve her enterprise through the financial assistance she has requested.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, yeast and other ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is 43 years old and a borrower from Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is a married mother blessed with four children. Currently, only three kids are her responsibility and they are students.  Her entire family relies on rice and corn farming as their main sources of income. 

This is not the original loan for Sarun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she repaid completely, has helped her to earn a decent income to support the family and to keep her kids in school. Now, the lack of financial support for her kid’s tuition fees is her big challenge. To overcome this challenge, she is getting a new loan with VisionFund.  She will spend her entire loan amount to totally cover the school fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree in Political Science. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To cover her son's school fees

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Ella es laura, quiere contarle porque le gusta la enfermería, a ella  le parece que la gente que trabaja  como enfermera siempre esta hay para la gente que lo necesita y para la familia  de igual manera, es muy  satisfactorio poder ayudar a los demás en los momentos difíciles o apoyar a una familia en una situación difícil, darle confianza , pues a ella personalmente le gusta por que tiene una hija y cuando ella se enferma ps le interesa saber que es lo que tiene,  ayudar  a la  familia también en los momentos que ellos puedan necesitar del servicio de ella como enfermera, el convenio de kiva seria un beneficio grande, ya que las mensualidades tendrían un valor mas económico y ella podría economizar algunos gastos con este valor que le queda, mas adelante los sueños de ella  es tener una especialización en cardiologia.
texts.en:
This is Laura. She wants to tell you why she likes nursing. It seems to her that people who work as nurses are always there for what people need and for the family in the same way. It is very satisfying to be able to help others in difficult times, or to support a family in a difficult situation, giving them confidence. She personally likes nursing because she has a daughter, and when her daughter gets sick she is interested in knowing what she has. She also likes helping her family at times when they may need her services as a nurse.

The arrangement with Kiva would be a great benefit, as the monthly payments are a more economical amount and she would be able to economize on some expenses with the amount she has left over.

In the future, her dream is to have a specialization in cardiology.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition

loans.name: Afag

texts.en: Afag is 45 years old. She is married with three children. Her elder child is 23 years old, who is study at University. Other child 20 years old, who is study at first course of college and another is going to eleventh class. Afag has been in tailor business for long years, she sew skirt, blouse, and other woman dress, also to sew curtain. She receive order from her periodically customer, prepares orders. Today she is planning to increase her working capital to buy new materials. For this reason she is requesting for a loan in amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). This is her third loan. Previously she took two loans from Kiva and all of her paid was is time. She says thankful to Kiva organization for a loan. In the future she wants to open a curtain store.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргаш 29 летний житель города Душанбе - столицы Таджикистан. Он женат и имеет трехлетнего ребенка. Эргаш живет с женой и ребенком у родителей. Он занимается в сфере торговли. Эргаш 4 года назад открыл продуктовый магазин. Ему нравится работать в сфере торговли продуктов и хочет дальше продвигаться в этом направлении. Он просит кредит, чтобы привести больше товара и увеличить ассортимент продуктов.
texts.en: Ergash is 29 years old and he lives in the capital city of Tajikistan, Dushanbe.  He is married and the father of a 3-year-old child.  He lives with his wife and a child, in his parents' house.  He works in retail.  Four years ago, he opened a grocery store.  He enjoys selling grocery products on a retail-basis and he wants to move ahead in this field.  He is taking a loan to bring in more merchandise and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: to buy more food products and diversify his inventory.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a youth residing in Nairobi. He currently vends water to people residing in his community. He also has a young family, which he supports using the money he earns from his business. He has been looking for alternative means of income to add to what he currently earns from his water vending business. 

He learnt about the Fresh Life Initiative and got interested in joining the franchise. He wishes to use the profits from the Fresh Life Franchise to better his family's upkeep and use the rest of the money to expand his ventures. 

He therefore seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets so that he could be part of the impact created by access to proper sanitation facilities.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Orozbu

texts.ru: Орозбу 62 года, замужем, все дети взрослые проживают отдельно и самостоятельно. Супруг Орозбу помогает ей по хозяйству. У Орозбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Орозбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орозбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 5 лошадей, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орозбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Орозбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Orozbu is 62 years old, married, and all her children (who are now adults) have left the house and live independently.  Her husband helps her around the house.  Orozbu has a secondary education and she is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this field 30 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Orozbu's very hard work, her farming business now consists of thee dairy cows, five horses and ten sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her business, Orozbu has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" and asked for a loan.  She will use this loan to buy some cows in order to increase her cattle headcount.  She plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to buy a new barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 36 years old and married with five school-aged children. She has run a sari-sari (convenience store) business for eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month. Recently, she applied a loan to buy stocks of shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles and other items.

She joined Paglaum Cooperative in 2003. She smiles at the thought of seeing her children finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay her workers

loans.name: Seanghort

texts.en:
Seanghort is a villager from Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province. She is 34 years old and a mother of three dependent children. Two of them are in school, and the one remaining is too young for schooling. 

To support the family, she has been farming rice on a one-hectare area and cassava on a three-hectare area for five years as the main source of income. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Seanghort with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking an education loan in order to cover the school fee for her sister, who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting.  She hopes that her sister can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the school fee for her sister.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be social. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable place with availability of customers, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. 

Her business goal is to open a bigger restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale.

loans.name: Muyasarkhan

texts.ru: Муясархан 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Муясархан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Муясархан занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Муясархан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Муясархан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Муясархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Muyasarkhan is 49 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides the main source of income for her family.  She started in this field nine years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Muyasarkhan's very hard work, her farming business now consists of three dairy cows and eight sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further increase her farming business, Muyasarkhan has turned to the bank Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan.  She will use her loan to buy some sheep, which she will fatten and then resell at a higher price at the market.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Chreang

texts.en: Chreang is 59 years old and a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of one son who is still in school. To earn a living, she farms corn and beans as the main source of income. This is the first microloan for Chreang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for an education loan to cover the tuition fee for her son who wants to earn a bachelor's degree in nursery studies. She hopes her son will have a good job to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a book binder and binds book at home. She helps him complete his daily tasks. Her husband uses cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for book binding. He takes orders from book publishers and binds books on order. He has been fulfilling many contracts but now is getting bigger contracts than before. The major problem is that he does not have enough cash to buy raw materials for book binding.   
Therefore, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw materials such as cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread to continue his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for book binding.

loans.name: Seanghai's Group

texts.en: Seanghai is 32 years old and a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three kids. To strive for a living, she does rice cropping as the main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, her husband can help her to earn extra income by working as a goldsmith. She has been involved in her current business for several years. This is the second microloan for Seanghai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to use her past loan wisely to improve her livelihood. For this cycle, she formed a group of two to get a new loan of 400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to support her husband's business by purchasing necessary materials to make jewelry. She hopes to support her husband's business promptly.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to make jewelry

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
“Hardworking mother” best describes Nora, 52 years old, who resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four children and is married. 

Nora wanted to start a small business. She applied for her membership in PMPC last July 2013. After hearing all the benefits, she didn't hesitate to become a member. She then requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 as start-up capital for a small business she planned. 

Nora wants to venture into snack vending. The money she requested from PMPC will be used to purchase raw ingredients. 

She wants to earn an additional income for their family and be able to send her son to college. Nora is eager to save money out from her business to expand it and hopes to live a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Gina Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Gina Paola, tiene  20 años de edad, es casada y con una bebe de 7 meses de edad. Uno de los mayores sueños es vincularse al círculo de la salud estudiando auxiliar administrativo en salud, primer semestre y así poder ayudar a pacientes moralmente y generalmente en las necesidades. 



Quiere estudiar en campo alto para aprender todo lo relacionado en auxiliar administrativo en salud, es muy importante y grato alimentar la mente y así poder velar por todas aquellas personas que necesitan ayuda respecto a salud, y campo alto es una opción muy buena para lograrlo tanto en la parte teórica como  en la parte practica. 


Quiere estudiar este programa ya que se siente capacitada para ayudar a los pacientes en todo tipo de inquietudes respecto a la salud, ya sea facturación, servicio al usuario, atender y orientar a los pacientes en las dudad o necesidades, afiliación a los nuevos usuarios. Este programa es muy útil para ella y los pacientes, ya que seria una buena manera de ayudar, satisfacer, emprender y colaborar en el lugar de trabajo.


Necesita el convenio KIVA, para una ayuda en los estudios, ya que se ahorra cierto porcentaje de las cuotas mensuales a pagar. 
El esposo es el que vela por el hogar económicamente y sería muy bueno que ustedes la beneficiaran con este convenio, personalmente este auxilio seria muy útil ya que la plata que ella se ahorra la puedo invertir en cosas para el estudio ya sea fotocopias y cuadernos otros gastos que tenga
texts.en:
Gina Paola, 20, is married with a 7-month-old baby. One of her greatest dreams is to join the healthcare field by studying to become an administrative health assistant. She is in her first semester of studies. She will be able to help patients morally and generally with their needs.

She wants to study at CampoAlto to learn everything about being an administrative health assistant. It is very important and satisfying to feed her mind and to be able to look after people who are in need of help in terms of their health. CampoAlto is a very good alternative to achieve her goal both theoretically and practically.

She wants to study in this program because she feels capable of helping patients with all types of issues regarding health, whether it be billing, patient services, attending to and guiding patients with doubts or needs, or registering new patients. This program is very useful for her and for the patients, as it will be a good way for her to help, satisfy, take on tasks, and collaborate in the workplace.

She needs this loan to help her with her studies. She saves a certain amount of the monthly fees to pay. Her husband is financially responsible for the household and it would be very good for her to benefit from this loan. Personally, this help will be very useful to her as she can invest the money she saves in things she needs for her studies, from photocopies to notebooks and other expenses.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: Horn is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 42 years old and a mother of six children: three daughter and three sons. Currently, three of them are in school, one is too young for school, and the remaining two children are helping in the business. To deal with the family’s hardships, she grows rice on three hectares of land as the main source of income and she raises pigs as a supplementary source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 11 years and it has returned her about 38,800 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Horn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan wisely and it has helped her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she teamed up in a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her paddy field and feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes to earn more income from her crop.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en: Khoeun, 36, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother blessed with three dependent kids. For the sake of her family, two hectare of rice farming and working for others for a fee are the main source of her income. They are the businesses that she has had for ages. This is not the first loan for Khoeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With successful repayment, she has managed to improve her lifestyle gradually.  For this cycle, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group's loan is 3,100,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and gasoline for irrigation for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield with a high income.

loans.use: To buy pesticide, fertilizer and gasoline for her farmland.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
An industrious mother of a child who is in school, Sina is 36 years old and a villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. The main sources of her family’s income are her husband’s job as a policeman and her eighteen-year-old grocery shop.

In this second cycle with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, Sina and her other co-borrowers are forming a group of three to get a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. The previous loan which she fully repaid on time has enabled her to keep her business operating and meet her family’s needs.

For this cycle, Sina will spend her entire loan on buying more groceries for her shop. She highly believes that she can make a good profit and keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her shop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children who are 5 and 10 years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows collard greens. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable climate, which affects the growth of her crops. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married and she is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a rice farm and does farming activities to support their family needs. Her six children are her reason to work hard for the family. As a member of Paglaum since 2007, she manages to be a member in good standing and makes sure to pay off all her obligations in a timely fashion. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase farm inputs. She wants to save more to be able to have enough savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, 54, is a hardworking married mother blessed with five children. To make an income she cooks and sells snack foods on the campus of the local school.

Due to insufficient capital, Adelina is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, fish balls, kikiam (pork and vegetables wrapped in bean curd sheets and deep-fried), hotdogs and other foods to be cooked and sold at the school. She looks to improving her business through this financial assistance.

Adelina and her husband aim to improve their living standards as well as educate all of their children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snack foods to sell at the local school.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 40-year-old lady from the Katito region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married and takes care of her family. She also takes care of five people in her family.

She sells groceries, a business she has been doing for the last seven years, and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her Solar Loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will no longer have to look for sources of energy in her home for lighting and any other uses like charging the phone.

Her dream is to grow her business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel (Sunshine Box)

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para pagarle una carrera universitaria. Está casada y tiene un hijo de 16 años que actualmente se encuentra estudiando, además de su esposo y su hijo, su madre tambien vive con ella.

Mirna trabajó durante doce años como secretaria en la alcaldía de su ciudad, lamentablemente, hace ocho años, la despidieron, desde entonces le ha sido muy difícil encontrar otro empleo por la edad, además su madre empezó a sentirse muy mal de salud y no había quien le brindara el cuidado que ella necesita, a raíz de esta difícil situación, Mirna decidió colocar una tienda en su vivienda para tener una fuente de ingresos, negocio con el que le fuera posible cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Desde hace ocho años, está trabajando solemante en esta actividad, y es su única fuente de ingresos.

El crédito desea invertirlo, en la compra de más mercadería, como bebidas, golosinas, productos de la canasta básica y uso personal, así lograra surtir su tienda. De esta forma, Mirna podrá seguir adelante con su negocio, obteniendo ingresos que le permita cubrir los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.

 Su sueño mas grande, es que su hijo estudie en la universidad y logre graduarse de una carrera profesional, ya que así, tendrá más oportunidades de encontrar un buen empleo. También desea que su negocio crezca y que su madre se mejore de los problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Mirna is 54 years old. She studied only until high school as her parents did not have the financial resources to pay for her college. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who is currently studying. In addition to her husband and son, she also lives with her mother.

Mirna worked for twelve years as a secretary for the mayor of her city. Unfortunately, she was dismissed eight years ago. Since then it has been very difficult for her to find another job due to her age. Her mother also began to feel very ill and there was no one who could give her the care she needed. As a result of this difficult situation, Mirna decided to put a store in her home to have a source of income to cover the household expenses. She has been working alone for eight years and it is her only source of income.

She wishes to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as drinks, snacks, staple goods, and personal use products to stock her store. This way, Mirna will be able to continue with her business, earn income to allow her to cover household expenses, and help her family get ahead.

Her greatest dream is for her son to study in college and obtain a professional career so he can have more opportunities to find a good job. She also wants her business to grow and for her mother's health to improve.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as drinks, snacks, staple goods, and personal use products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as potatoes, meat, condiments, oil, flour and more.

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en:
Almeda is 30 years old, married with 2 children. She is a vendor and focuses on selling sugar, eggs and mineral water. She has reached out to PMPC for her funding needs. She wants to buy additional inventories of sugar, trays of eggs and other items.

She wants to grow the profits of this business to support the daily expenses of her 2 college-aged students.

loans.use: buy additonal sugar, trays of eggs and other items

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 63 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, a part of Misamis Occidental Province on Mindanao Island in the Philippines. She was gifted with eight children but is now a widow.

Luzminda is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious and hardworking member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other types of crops.

In need of additional money, Luzminda decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 20,000 PHP to buy farm and garden fertilizers and pay labor costs for help on her land.

Being a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, Luzminda has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

Luzminda dreams of owning a tractor someday.

loans.use: to buy farm and garden fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Deysi Rubelina

texts.es:
Deysi, una ama de casa que busca cada día el bienestar de su familia la cual está integrada por su esposo y sus tres hijos, para colaborar con los gastos familiares se dedica a elaborar petates, que luego vende en el mercado municipal de su localidad. Está oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia y lo realiza de manera independiente hace 20 años, hasta la fecha no ha enfrentado ningún problema que le evite continuar realizándola.
El crédito lo solicita para comprar tule por mayor, ya que es la temporada en la que lo puede adquirir a un mejor precio y así podrá fácilmente aumentar su producción, cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes y con ello aumentar sus ingresos para cumplir debidamente con los compromisos que posee.
Su sueño es tener una economía más estable para poder hacer mejoras que tanto necesita en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Deysi is a housewife who looks out for her family’s well-being every day.  Her family is comprised of her husband and their three children.  In order to contribute to the family expenses, she makes bedrolls.  She later sells them at the municipal market in her area.  She learned this trade in her family, and she has been doing it independently for 20 years.  To date, she had not faced any problem that stops her from continuing to do this work.

The loan she is requesting is to buy tulle wholesale.  It is now the season when you can get it at a better price.  This way she will easily be able to increase her production and fill her customers’ orders.  With this she will increase her income in order to duly fulfill her commitments.

Her dream is for her finances to be more stable in order to be able to make the improvements that her house needs so much.

loans.use: to buy tulle wholesale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 42-year-old lady from the Katito region which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married and takes care of her family, and she also takes care of five people in her family.

She sells soft drinks and snacks , a business she has been doing for seven years, and it generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her Solar Loan with VisionFund Kenya.
