This will ease her from looking for sources of energy in her home for the lighting and any other uses like charging the phone.

Her dream is to grow her business so as to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel (Sunshine Box)

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 35 year-old man who is married and has four children. He is pictured here on the right with the UGAFODE Credit Officer.

For the last fifteen years he has farmed coffee on a large scale. He has a supportive wife who helps him supervise the laborers in the shambas, or fields. He also has at least six laborers who assist him in planting, weeding and harvesting the coffee.

Fred is working to modernize his coffee shambas through mulching and the use of fertilizers. He therefore is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan for this purpose. With this, he hopes to get a better yield.

As part of his future plans, Fred wants to buy more land and plant more coffee so that before 2018 he will be considered one of Bugangari’s model farmers.

loans.use: To buy mulch and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 21 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en donde todos los días comparte con ellos la alegría de estar juntos y trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Kelly se dedica a la venta de comidas, todos los días sale a la vereda de su casa por las tardes para ofrecer a la venta los deliciosos platos típicos la región que acompaña con refrescantes bebidas preparados con frutas naturales. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 04 años y empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que aparte de tener un tiempo disponible para otras funciones, también le genera muy buenas ganancias, antes de poder realizar este trabajo tenia problemas con el pago de sus mensualidades en el instituto en donde estudia, pero ahora está más tranquila ya que tiene un respaldo económico que le permite enfrentar cualquier situación. En esta oportunidad solicitara s/.600, esta muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como arroz, pollo, aceite, aceitunas y frutas, además de otros artículos como  mesas,  sillas, platos y otros utensilios.
texts.en:
Kelly, age twenty-one, is single with no children.  She lives in her parent’s house, where every day she shares with them the joy of being together; and she works to give them a better quality of life. 

Kelly works selling food; every day in the afternoon she goes to the lane outside her home to sell delicious meals that are typical of the region, along with refreshing drinks prepared with natural fruits. 

She has been doing this work for four years; she started out assisting her mother, who has now given her total control of the business. She likes what she does very much, as apart from having time available for other duties, she generates very good earnings.  Before being able to do this work, she had problems paying the monthly fees to the institute where she studies; but now she feels more relaxed, since she has the financial support which allows her to face any situation. 

On this occasion she is requesting 600 Nuevos Soles, and she is very happy to know that she is being given financial support, since this way she will feel secure moving forward with her business. For her part, she promises once again to make her payments on time, as she has done with her previous loans. 

She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of ingredients and supplies such as rice, chicken, oil, olives, and fruit, in addition to other items such as tables, chairs, plates, and other utensils.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, chicken, oil, olives, and fruit, in addition to other items such as tables, chairs, plates, and other utensils.

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: Sohiba is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 non-adult children. She started her own business of growing wheat, watermelon, maize and etc. 5 years ago. She has her own land. She organized her farm. Her husband and some of their relatives help her with growing crops and vegetables. Sohiba’s family income comes from her farm. She works hard and tries to grow her harvest with high quality. She must make a new sowing but does not have money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon, está satisfecho con los efectos positivos que tiene al utilizar créditos, por lo que nuevamente solicita capital para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras de temporada tales como: sandias, melones, naranjas, repollos, pepinos, entre otras, lo que le permitirán continuar satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo en surtir el inventario del negocio lo que le dio mejores ventas, más clientes, nuevos ingresos con los que cancelo las cuotas de deuda y ha hecho remodelaciones necesarias en su casa.
texts.en:
Ramón is very satisfied with the positive results he saw following his previous loan, and is therefore requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of seasonal fruit and vegetables, such as watermelons, melons, oranges, cabbages, cucumbers and others. This will allow him to continue satisfying his customers. 

He used the previous loan to stock up his business, which resulted in higher sales, more customers, and increased income which he used to pay off his debts and carry out some much-needed repairs in his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Leidy Hojanna

texts.es:
Ella es Leidy  Johana  una joven  emprendedora,  la cual quiere  salir  adelante  cumpliendo  las metas, superando  grandes  obstáculos  los  cuales  se  le van presentando día  a día  en el camino .
La madre, el  hermano y el  padre, el cual son separados desde  hace algunos años, la madre  le ayuda a el hijo con  lo del estudio el cual  está  cursando  grado 10° en  un colegio privado.  Ella   es  la encargada de  bríndale  todo lo que necesite, de igual manera  el padre   le ayuda a Leidy pagándo el técnico  campo alto quienes le han brindado un excelente  aprendizaje  a la joven.  
Por  tal motivo necesita  el convenio  kiva  para que  pueda  seguir  escalando  en la  profesión ya que le ha sido de agrado   y  para  que  los  padres tengan un buen  manejo en las vidas  financieras es  por  ello que  tendrán  la facilidad  de cancelar los pagos del  semestre a un valor mas económico. 
Es una gran ventaja  tanto   para  ella como para  los padres, porque la  ayudan a  continuar con el tercer semestre de auxiliar en enfermería.  El padre viene  cada quince días a visitarlos, él le deja el dinero de los  trasportes de  Leidy,  en ocasiones  no le  alcanza y la madre es quien se lo brinda.
Es  así como los  padres  poco  a  poco y con gran esfuerzo sin importar que estén separados quieren lo mejor para los hijos colaborándoles con lo que más puedan  para que salgan adelante. Con este beneficio de kiva seria gratamente satisfactorio ya que es un paso más que ella está dando  para  realizar  y cumplir  los sueños  preparándose  para tener grandes bases en   la carrera  profesional  ya  que  el  sueño  es ser jefe de pediatría y poderles ayudar a la  familia y a la comunidad en un futuro  con la dedicación y  profesionalismos  siendo totalmente  independiente.
texts.en:
This is Leidy Johana, an enterprising youth.  She wants to get ahead and accomplish her goals, overcoming the big obstacles that might present themselves in her path.

She has a mother, father and a brother.  Her parents have been separated for some years.  Her mother helps her brother with his studies, he is in 10th grade in a private school, and she also provides for her children's needs.  In addition, Leidy's father helps out paying for her tuition at Campo Alto, where she has been provided with excellent training.  

This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can continue to rise in her profession, because she has found it to her liking.  Also, this way her parents will be better able to manage their financial situation.  This will enable her to pay off her tuition for the semester in a more cost-effective way.  

This loan is a great help to her and her parents, because it is enabling her to continue with her third semester of nursing.  Her father comes to visit them every 15 days, and he leaves money for Leidy's transportation.  At times, when it is not enough, her mother provides it.  This is how her parents, gradually, with great effort, and without regard to the fact that they are separated, do the most they can for her, because they want the best for their children.  

With this benefit from Kiva, she will be greatly satisfied, because she will be one step closer to fulfilling her dreams, preparing herself to have a solid foundation for her professional career.  Leidy's dream is to become chief of pediatrics, so that she can help her family and the community in the future with her dedication and professionalism and fully support herself.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, se acerca nuevamente a  nuestra institución para solicitar un nuevo crédito debido a la facilidad de pago que se le brinda y los múltiples beneficios positivos que obtiene, invertirá en la compra de un molino nixtamal y maíz por mayor, para tener ingresos extras y aumentar la producción de tortillas y tamales.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener materia prima para continuar creciendo en el negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener más ganancias, mayor popularidad, mejores ventas, así como también pudo finalizar la construcción del muro en su vivienda. Se economía familiar es mejor y su familia cuenta con un mejor estilo familiar.
texts.en:
Ana has approached her lending institution again to request a new loan, thanks to the ease of payment that they offer and the many benefits she sees as a result. She plans to purchase a corn mill and wholesale corn, in order to increase the amount of tortillas and tamales she makes, as well as her income. . 
Ana's previous loan helped her to purchase the raw materials to continue growing her business, which allowed her to increase her income, sales, and her customer base, as well as to finish building a wall in her home. Her family's financial situation has improved and they now enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and a corn mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 25 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 3 years and 7 years. She describes herself to be joyful. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair treatment services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of advanced skills. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy salon equipment and cosmetics for use in the salon. Her business goal is to open a hair dressing college within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy salon equipment and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, charcoal and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Bunrith

texts.en:
Bunrith is a 31-year-old man and a loving father of two children who are his burden. Bunrith lives with his family in a peaceful village of Bakan district, Pursat province. 

Bunrith and his wife help each other manage their rice farm to ensure high production in each harvest season. Despite their hardships, they aim to educate their children up to a high level at a university because they want to see them have a bright future.

As this will be his first loan cycle, he will use the money to build a safe latrine for his family, as he has an unhygienic latrine. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Bunrith is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for his family, as he has an unhygienic latrine.

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es:
Karen vanessa  es una joven con mucho futuro, con aspiraciones y sueños por cumplir solo necesita una ayuda para poder realizar los, para lograr ser una excelente auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos el cual es el programa al que acaba de ingresar en el instituto campo alto,  por lo tanto necesita el convenio con kiva que le pueden brindar. 
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder acceder al beneficio del convenio pues los sueños son convertirse en una excelente auxiliar de farmacéutica y conseguir un buen empleo para tener una mejor estabilidad en todos los sentidos.
texts.en:
Karen Vanessa is a young person with a great future, with aspirations and dreams to fulfill; but she needs some support to be able to accomplish this.  To become an excellent pharmaceutical assistant, which is the program that she has just entered at the CampoAlto Institute, she needs the support that the agreement with Kiva can give to her.

She hopes to be able to receive the benefit of the agreement, as her dreams are to become an excellent pharmaceutical assistant, and get a good job, in order to have better stability in every way.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy was born and raised in Nairobi's Muthurwa area. She recently finished her high school education but has been staying at home due to a lack of employment for youth in the country. 

She took the initiative to look for something to keep her busy while she looked for a job. She joined a youth group that mainly takes care of sanitation in her area of residence. Through this group, she learned about the Fresh Life initiative. She thought that joining the Fresh Life movement would enable her to earn money for her personal upkeep and provide a better sanitation facility to residents in her area. 

She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. She intends to use the income she earns to provide more sanitation facilities and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a  Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as motivated. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Linet will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 67 year old woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 28 to 40 years old. She describes herself to be humble and God-fearing. 

She operates an M-Pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand her business. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add M-Pesa money for customers to withdraw. This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

Her business goal is to be a well-established businesswoman within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a home.

loans.use: to add M-Pesa money for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora que lucha a diario por el bienestar de sus hijos, ella es madre soltera  tiene a  cargo a un hijo, siendo los otros ya casados a temprana edad por lo que ella siempre les  brinda su apoyo con sus ingresos de la venta de comida que realiza a diario ambulante en un mercado capitalino. Este crédito que solicita es para comprar granos básicos, frutas, verduras, carnes entre otros que le permitan seguir haciendo comidas para vender.
texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking woman who fights every day for the well-being of her children. She is a single mother who is raising one son. Her other children married at a young age, so she always provides support to them with her income from selling food, which she does every day as a street vendor in a market in the capital. The loan that Rosa is requesting is for the purchase of staple grains, fruit, vegetables, and meat, among others, which will allow her to keep making food to sell.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, fruit, vegetables, and meat, among others.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.en:
Idigul is 52 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a pensioner. 

Idigul graduated from medical college in 1992. Since then, she has been teaching at a medical college. 

Idigul is smart and knows a great deal. She always aims for the well-being of her children. 

Now, Idigul is ill. She must to go to a doctor but she doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy medicine to treat herself. She awaits your support

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a businessman who sells drinks and beverages. He started this business in 2004 with the objective of earning income to cater to his family needs. 

His business is located in a trading center, and his clients are mainly people from the same area. He started the business with high hopes that it would earn him enough profits to educate his siblings. He works six days a week and eight hours per day. He also works with a management agency to earn a salary that greatly boosts his income. 

Alex would like to use the loan money to buy more stock so that he can serve his clients better and earn more profit. His clients are mainly people in his area of operation, and he hopes to serve them better if he receives the loan. With the loan, he will better meet the customers' needs. Alex is challenged by lack of enough capital, but he is hopeful that this will cease to be a challenge if he receives the loan of 1,500,000 UGX. 

He is determined to remain the hardworking gentleman he has always been and to use the profits from the business to educate his siblings. He would like to develop himself financially thereby achieving his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase earrings, perfume and creams for resale.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam is a resident in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 53-year-old mother of eight children. Currently, only six children rely on her; three of them are in school and the remaining are helping with the family’s business. 

To support this big family, she farms rice on one hectare of land. This is her main source of income. Nam also works for others to supplement her income. She has been in this business for 16 years and it earns her 20,000 KHR per day. 

Nam has borrowed four times through VisionFund Cambodia with a successful repayment of her past loans. These loans have improved her living conditions. For this loan cycle, she joins a group of three as a leader. Nam will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor costs. 

She hopes that she can harvest her crops on time and earn a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her tuition fees

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 33, is a mother of three dependent children. She is a resident from Monkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. 

To support the family, she farms rice as the main source of income, and her husband has helped her to earn additional income by driving a taxi. 

With this new loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia. The past loan has been fully repaid. The loan has helped her to improve her living conditions and keep her kids in school.

Now, she is the group leader of two. The total amount of her entire group loan is 2,400,000 KHR of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting and labor fees. She hopes to increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and labor fees

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter is a 44-year-old woman from the Katito region which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married and takes care of her family. She also takes care of five other people in her family.

She has been selling soft drinks and snacks for the last 10 years and generates a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

She is applying for a Solar Loan with VisionFund Kenya. This will help her have a source of home energy for lighting and other uses like charging the phone.

Her dream is to grow her business so she can support her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar panel (Sunshine Box)

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, opta por otro crédito para surtir el negocio y hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda, Comprara verduras, frutas, golosinas, bebidas, jabón, etc., con lo que mantendrá su negocio activo y mejorara la infraestructura de su vivienda.
El crédito anterior le ha permitido incorporar nuevos productos en su negocio, atender mejor a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias, su familia mantiene el mismo número de miembros y todos gozan de un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is requesting another loan in order to stock her business and make some improvements in her home. She will purchase vegetables, fruit, snacks, drinks, soap, etc., with which she will keep her business going; and she will improve the infrastructure of her home.

The previous loan has allowed her to add new products to her business, take better care of her customers, increase her sales, and have better earnings. She still has the same number of family members, and they all have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, snacks, drinks, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates, and variety of food containers.

loans.name: Sout's Group

texts.en: Sout is 53 years old and a married mother blessed with two kids. Currently, her residential area is the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province where she grows her rice and cassava as the main source of her income. The business that she has had for more than 10 years has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is Sout's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group is1,800,000 KHR, while 400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a good yield; better than last year's to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potash for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
This is Sophea, 46 years of age and a resident of Bakan district in Pursat province. She is married to a humble farmer and together they have been blessed with a child. To provide for their daily expenses, Sophea operates a small store from her home selling a variety of products to people in her community. From her current business, she is able to earn a good income for her family. Sophea's regular customers are her neighbours, friends and relatives. 

Sophea is requesting this loan because she wants to improve her sanitation practices by having a safe latrine at home. This loan amount will help her buy materials and cover the costs of the construction. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sophea is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for her family.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en: Caleb is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child who is four years old. He describes himself to be humble and polite. He operates a retail store where he sells jeans, trousers and dresses. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand his business. He will use this 100,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of jeans, trousers and dresses for resale. This will enable him to have enough stock to sell and increase his profits. His business goal is to have an established boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a home for his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Caleb's previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jeans, trousers and dresses for resale.

loans.name: Vich's Group

texts.en: Vich is 36 years old and a widowed mother from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Currently, she needs to support three children, two of whom are students and one who is too young for schooling. To feed the family, she grows vegetable as the main source of income and works as a paid worker for a fee. She has been in this business for 16 years and gets a return of 11,800 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for past second cycles. With a successful repayment, she is able to keep her kids in school. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to earn a good income so that she can keep providing sufficient food for her kids and renovate her house into better condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more paint brushes, pens, earrings and security locks for resale.

loans.name: Sithun's Group

texts.en: Sithun is 32 years old and a married mother blessed with three dependent kids; one school-aged child and the remaining one who is too young for schooling. She lives in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province where she grows cassava with the support of her husband. Besides agribusiness, she also works for others for a fee. This is the third cycle for Sithun and first cycle for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has helped her to improve her lifestyle to be better than before. Now she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on buying fertilizer, ploughing farmland and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to increase her family’s income as well as expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to plough farmland and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 38-year-old married client who has three children. Sabah is the only provider of the income for the family. He owns a small shop where he specializes in various types of textiles for various purposes. He established his business in 2009. Sabah has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. Sabah is requesting a loan of $1,800 to renovate his shop and to install signage. His aim is to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install  signage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is a glorious woman. She is married and brings up her children in the spirit of nationalism. She is a successful business woman. Dilbar has been busy with growing potatoes for more than 10 years. She has additional income from animal husbandry. From profit, Dilbar improves her living conditions step by step. She wants to develop her business and from profits repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new sowing season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, fish and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en: Leam is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children, but now only two kids are reliant on her. To support the family, she grows a cassava field as the main source of income and grows rice as well as working for others for a fee as supplementary income. Leam, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), forms a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is of 3,900,000 KHR of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees for her cassava farmland. She hopes that her cassava field will gain a good enough crop yield for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees for her cassava farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en: Ruzigul was born in 1981. She is married and has three children. Ruzigul is poor and lives with her family because her husband has a small income from growing vegetables. Ruzigul wants to sew national women’s dresses. For some years, she had not any job. She is going to organize her own sewing business now. Ruzigul wants to open a workshop and to service local people. She also wants to teach girls from her region how to sew women’s dresses. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to organize her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Bunchim

texts.en:
Bunchim is a 32-year-old married man and a loving father of one child living with his family in a remote area of the Bakan district in Pursat province. Everyday Bunchim works hard at his farming business to support his family with their basic needs and supplements his income by providing motorcycle repair service from his home. From his current businesses, he is able to earn approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

Bunchim is now asking for a loan to build a proper latrine for his family. This loan will help him buy materials and cover the costs of the construction. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Bunchim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 22-year-old single man. He has no children. He describes himself as an honest person. He operates a retail stall where he sells barbering accessories. He has been involved in this business for four years.

He moves from one barbering shop to another to sell his products, which has worked perfectly for him for four years now. He describes his biggest business challenge as getting a shop of his own so that customers can locate him at a particular place. He is working on that. He will use this 1,200 GHS loan to add stock to his business. 

He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his fifth loan with ID-Ghana. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his life status.

loans.use: to buy barbering accessories and add to his business.

loans.name: Dalis

texts.en:
Dalis is 30 years old and lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three children: one son and two daughters. One of her children is in school and the other two are still young.
 
Dalis stays at home and takes care of her children. The main source of income is from her husband’s business as a construction contractor. She is in the process of building a new house to live in, but the house is not finished yet. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to finish it.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam, age 31, lives in a village about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2009. has one young daughter and she is pregnant (see picture). Eam and her husband are garment workers.

Eam’s family does not have a proper restroom to use. They rely on the restroom at neighboring houses very often. Facing this, Eam decided to build a restroom for her family to use. She will use the rest of the loan to connect electricity from her house to the electrical utility service.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family's use and provide electricity to her house

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married, and has nine children. Hussain and four of his children provide the family’s income. Hussain is a barber. He established his business in 2009, and now he has an employee. He has built up good experience in this field is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. Hussain is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his barber shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, Pure Water and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in a cafe shop

loans.name: Yana

texts.ru:
Яна торгует женской и мужской одеждой в родном Виноградово. Торговую точку она арендует, наемных рабочих нет. Бизнесом занимается около 2 лет. Год назад Яна вышла замуж. В свободное время очень любит заниматься вышивкой. 
Яне необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт на кухне и в ванной. В ванной комнате она хочет сделать демонтаж старой плитки, поменять водопроводные и канализационные трубы, залить стяжку на пол, поменять ванну и оцеклить ее, а также наклеить плитку на стены и пол, поменять умывальник, пошпаклевать и покрасить потолок. В кухне Яна хочет пошпаклевать и покрасить потолок, залить выравниваюшую стяжку, наклеить плитку на пол и купить газовую плиту.
texts.en:
Yana sells women's and men's clothing in her native town of Vinogradovo. She rents her sales stand and has no employees. She has been in business for about two years. A year ago Yana got married. In her free time she enjoys embroidering.

Yana needs 20,000 UAH in order to  renovate her  kitchen and bathroom. In the bathroom she would like to remove old tiles, replace the water and sewage pipes,  level the floor, install a new bathtub and glaze it,  as well as install new wall and floor tiles,  install a new sink, and spackle and  paint the ceiling. In the kitchen she would like to spackle and paint the ceiling,   install floor tiles and   buy a gas stove.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Gulab Jan's Group

texts.en:
Gulab Jan is a 50-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six daughters and five sons. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession and engaged in providing transport facilities. He has a taxi that is not in good working condition and it requires a big amount of his income to pay the maintenance charges,  Gulab Jan's husband does not have sufficient financial means to maintain his taxi in a proper manor. 

Therefore, Gulab Jan is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan as part of a group with another member. This loan will enable her husband to make the proper maintenance of the taxi to provide better transport facilities to his passengers. That will be good for him to earn more income daily.

Gulab Jan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more traditional medicines

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is 52 years old, a married woman, and the mother of five children. Her son is a driver by profession, and he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance, to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Sakeena has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her son wants to buy new tires and a little bit of engine maintenance, for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her son and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

Sakeena thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires and engine maintenance services, for the auto rickshaw her son drives

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 42 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two daughters. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family. He is a tailor, by profession. Yasmeen has been running a beauty parlor for 12 years, and she contributes her income to help her husband manage the household.

Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase different types of cosmetics and other items for her business -- e.g. hair brushes, combs, nail polish and remover, creams and lotions. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will help her to increase her daily sales and profit amount. She can use this profit as savings, for her family's future needs. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and other items for her salon, including hair brushes, nail polish and remover, and lotions

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula Andrea nació el 4 de septiembre en la ciudad de Bogotá D.c, creció junto a los padres, la hermana la abuela materna. 
Desde pequeña fue una niña con grandes capacidades y habilidades  que ayudaron a formarla como persona y a tener buenos resultados académicos en el colegio. Las  fortalezas son basadas en tener fe en lo que hace, orden de las ideas, claridad en los objetivos para la vida, el deseo de aprender  cada día más para el propio beneficio, las debilidades, estrés,  baja de ánimo cuando no hacía  nada para solucionar un problema. Un poco de el ámbito familiar,  la mamá una persona muy responsable quien le dio todo el estudio, quien la apoya y dice que tiene que estudiar mucho para  no terminar trabajando en un supermercado sabiendo que para eso no se necesita mucho estudio, lo que desea es que tenga mucho trabajo, se desempeñe como una muy buena esteticista así tenga que esforzarse  mucho físicamente, la familia en general la invitan a superarse y aprovechar todas las oportunidades, cualidades y actitudes, ya que es una mujer joven y desde temprana edad piensa en lograr cosas grandes para tener un futuro como lo es un trabajo estable, profesionalizarse, casarse, tener una familia y tener una casa propia y   sacar adelante a la mama y familia.
Éxitos los cuales fueron  haber podido terminar el bachiller con muy buen rendimiento académico y disciplinario, el haber comenzado los estudios en campo alto la anima a seguir adelante con todas las metas, uno de los  fracasos fue  no pasar a la universidad distrital, lo que la obligo a tomar decisiones rápidas  y seguir intentando y abriendo mas puertas. 
El plan de acción es hacer de todos los obstáculos que se le atraviesen convertirlos en oportunidades para mejorar, focalizando los  esfuerzos, en corregirlos, dándoles un análisis de los impedimentos para seguir , quiere ser una esteticista  que convierte sueños en realidad será una persona exitosa, sencilla, humilde y temerosa a Dios , los sueños,  ser un profesional, montar un negocio, tener una casa, escogió un camino el estudio y tiene un buen entendimiento  que potencia el ánimo y corrige  errores de inmediato enfrentando los obstáculos  tal y como se vean  llenos de oportunidades, tiene una mente positiva de  que los va a superar.
Cuando vea el logro de los objetivos y  sienta esa alegría de ver los frutos de todo el esfuerzo será una meta lograda  el propósito de la vida  seguir analizando la  realidad para realizar el plan de las acciones, tener un estado de vida sencillo, servir a la sociedad, un estado amoroso tener justicia para seguir cada vez mas luchando por lo que desea. 
 La razón por la cual necesita el convenio kiva  es porque le ayuda económicamente en los pagos de la matricula y mensualidades  ya que así podría continuar en el programa con éxito  y sin retrasos en los pagos y poder responder con los  implemento de la clase  ya que son un poco costosos, la beneficio en cuanto al trabajo, en lo personal, le aportara económicamente y profesionalmente
texts.en:
Paula Andrea was born on September 4th in the city of Bogotá.  She grew up alongside her parents, sister, and maternal grandmother.

From a young age she was a girl with great talents and abilities that helped to shape her as a person and to get good academic results in school.  Her strengths are based in having faith in what she does, an order of ideas, clarity of objectives in life, and the desire to learn more every day for her own benefit.  Her weaknesses are stress and being downcast when not doing anything to solve a problem.

A little about her family atmosphere:  Her mother is a very responsible woman who gave her everything to study, who supports her, and says that she has to study a lot so that she does not end up working in a supermarket, knowing that this does not require much study.  She wants her to have a lot of work, and to be a good beautician even if she has to push herself physically.  In general, the family asks Paula to improve and take advantage of every opportunity, quality, and attitude, because she is a young woman and from a young age she thought of achieving great things in order to have a future with a stable job, in which she becomes a professional, marries, has a family, has her own house, and has success as a mother and as a family.

One of her successes is having been able to finish her bachelor degree with good academic performance and discipline.  Having begun her studies with Campo Alto, she is encouraged to find success in all of her goals.  One of her failures was not moving on to the district college, which compelled her to make quick decisions and continue trying and opening more doors.

The plan of action is to take all of the obstacles she has faced and convert them into opportunities to improve, focus her efforts, correct them, and analyze the impediments that are in the way.  She wants to be a beautician who makes her dreams a reality: she will be a successful, modest, humble, and God-fearing person.  Her dreams are to become a professional, to start up a business, have a house, choose a path of study, have a good understanding of the power of mood, immediately correct mistakes, and face obstacles that she sees as full of opportunities.  And she has a positive mentality that she is going to overcome these.

When she sees the success of these objectives and feels the happiness of seeing the fruit of all her efforts, it will be a goal achieved.  The purpose of life is to analyze the situation and make a plan of action, to have a modest state of life, to serve society, to be loving, to have justice, and to continue to fight for what she desires.

The reason for which she needs a Kiva loan is because it will help her financially to pay for tuition and monthly fees so that she may be able to continue successfully in the program without delays in payments, and be able to have the class tools since they are a little costly.  It will benefit her in terms of work, personally, and would contribute economically and professionally.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: Mohira is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Their ages are about 4 and 12 years. Mohira’s husband is a farmer. She began her own business with sewing, about one month ago. Her sewing machine is old and is in bad condition. Mohira is going to open her own workshop, in the central part of her region. She lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni, which she will use to buy a sewing machine for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Luz, opta por un nuevo crédito que invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, bolsos, ropa, peluches, etc., para tener un buen inventario y poner mejores opciones de compra a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, espera aumentar la clientela y mejorar su economía.
El crédito anterior le facilito los recursos económicos para comprar mercadería novedosa que sus clientes buscaban, sus ventas son mejores y ha tenido ingresos muy buenos con los que ha cancelado las cuotas y mejorado el ambiente familiar.
texts.en:
Luz is looking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, handbags, clothing, etc., to have a good inventory and to make better purchasing options available to her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele and improve her finances.
The previous loan provided the economic resources to buy novel merchandise that her clients were seeking; her sales are better and she has had good income with which she has paid her dues and improved her family environment.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, handbags, clothes, stuffed animals, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal bookshelf.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona reconocida por su honradez y responsabilidad, es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y una hija de 25 años de edad, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, son actividades que realiza con la ayuda de su familia, lo aprendió de su padre, su mayor ventaja es que posee propiedades en las que realiza dichas actividades.
Invertirá en la compra de ganado y pago de la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, lo que le ayudara a tener la cosecha en buenas condiciones y en menor tiempo la entregara a sus compradores, así como también engordara el ganado para luego venderlo a mejor precio, por lo consiguiente sus ganancia serán mayores.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar su economía con la que podrá pagar su deuda adquirida y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a person recognized for his honor and responsibility. Accompanied, he lives with his life partner and a 25-year-old daughter, cultivates basic grains, and raises livestock. He does these activities, which he learned from his father, with the help of his family; his major advantage is that he has his own properties on which he does these activities.
He will invest in the purchase of livestock and pay for the collection of the grain harvest, which will help him to gather the harvest in good condition and hand it over in less time to his purchasers. Thus, he can also increase the haul to later sell it at a better price, and following his profits will be better.
His dream is to strengthen the business to improve his finances with which he will be able to pay his acquired debt and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pay for the grain harvest

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier.Elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Yacine qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 54 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de vêtements pour femmes et enfants.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des vêtements pour une valeur 40000f,elle dispose d'une bonne clientéle en ce moment.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son fonds de roulement pour le commerce et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was founded in July 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same district. They are merchants who run small businesses. Yacine is shown on the far right in the photo with her arm raised, and is the leader of the group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of six children. Yacine is a merchant of clothing for women and children. 

With her ​​loan, she plans to purchase 40,000 Francs' worth of clothing as she currently has a good customer base. Yacine's objectives are to increase the working capital for her business, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Soukeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Khady qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 49 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture,elle cultive le mil et l'arachide.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter des semences d'arachide pour une valeur de 40000f.

Son objectif est de réaliser des bénéfices issus de la vente d'arachide pour  pouvoir constituer un fonds suffisant afin de faire de l'élevage.
texts.en:
This group was founded in July 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same village. Their main business is agriculture. Khady is shown on the far right in the photo with her arm raised, and is the leader of the group. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of five children. Khady is a farmer who cultivates millet and ground nuts.

With the help of her ​​loan, she plans to purchase 40,000 Francs' worth of ground nut seeds. Khady's objective is to earn enough income from the sale of her ground nuts so that she will have sufficient funds to raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase ground nut seeds.

loans.name: Tuelewane Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Sabina est une brave commerçante, dynamique, senior entrepreneur depuis 12 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Tuelewane», âgée de 64 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants, dont 7 sont déjà grands et 1 qui étudie. Elle est vendeuse des bananes dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 8 régimes  de bananes plantains. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant). Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client Sabina is a dynamic merchant who has twelve years of experience, and is a member the "Tuelewane" business association. Sabina is a 64-year-old widow and mother of eight children, seven of whom are grown up, and one who is studying. She is a banana merchant in the central market of the village.

Sabina is requesting a loan from Hekima to help her business grow. She plans to purchase eight bunches of plantains. When she started her business, she received money from her husband (during his lifetime). In the future, Sabina hopes to increase her capital, and to educate and provide for her youngest child.

She thanks Hekima for their support of women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, through granting them micro loans during this period of conflict in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to purchase eight bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy odontological materials

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a 36-year-old woman, who is married to Yupiter, a 40-year-old handyman. They are blessed with three children, namely: Aldi, fourteen, who is at grade two of Junior High; Dedi, twelve, who is at grade six of Elementary School; and Melvin, who is five years old.

To support her family needs, Adriana sells vegetables and also raises chickens to sell. She has been running this businesses since 2011 by using her savings. 

At the moment, she needs money to purchase fodder for her chickens and more vegetables to sell. Adriana has applied for an individual loan of IDR 3,000, 000, from TLM. She hopes TLM is willing to assist her with the business loan.

loans.use: to buy extra stock of chicken fodder and vegetables.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor un Cantón que constantemente está desarrollando, el mismo cuenta varios sitios turísticos de descanso que son muy visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy alegre, amable y tranquila. 
Aledaños al Cantón tenemos muchos recintos, uno de ellos es en Recinto San Bernabé en este recinto vive y tiene el negocio el señor Mauricio Revelo un hombre de 35 años él tiene un hijo de una relación anterior, actualmente tiene una nueva relación en unión libre por más de 5 años. 
Se dedican a la ganadería a la producción de leche, el aprendió de este negocio junto a la esposa y ella de los papas en este negocio trabajan un promedio de 8 horas diarias, juntos realizan los trabajos de la finca con el ganado como lo es el ordeño y la curación de la vacas productoras de leche. 
Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganado para incrementar la actividad productiva, con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el señor Mauricio agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad  brindada a él y su familia.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is the canton of love.  It is a canton that is constantly developing.  It has several leisure tourist destinations that are frequented by national and foreign tourists.  We have traditional celebrations in this canton where popular dances and the famous castle burning are performed.  The people of this canton are very happy, friendly, and easygoing.  

There are many precincts neighboring this canton, one of which is the San Bernabé Precinct.  Mauricio Revelo lives and works in this precinct.  He is 35 years old and has a son from a previous relationship; he is currently in a new common-law relationship that he has been in for over five years.  

They work in livestock and milk production.  He learned this business together with his partner and she learned it from her parents.  They work an average of eight hours a day; together they do the work on the farm with the livestock, such as milking and caring for their dairy cows. 

He will invest this loan in the purchase of cattle to increase his production.  With this new investment he hopes to improve his financial income and improve his family's quality of life.  Mauricio thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and for the opportunity they have offered him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase his production

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Felix, labora como director en un colegio publico de su comarca, su esposa lo apoya economicamente ya que ella tambien trabaja, tiene un hijo en edad escolar y para el su prioridad es la familia, solicita el credito para comprar materiales de construccion como Hierro, Arena, Piedrin, Alambres ya que desea contruir un muro enla parte frontal de la vivienda, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Felix works as a headmaster in a public school in his region, his wife helps him financially as she also works. He has a son of a school age and for Felix his priority is his family. 

He is seeking a loan to buy construction materials such as steel, sand, small stones, wires as he wants to build a wall at the front of his home. He is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic has given him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es casado y su familia está compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de 4 años de edad, como actividad económica se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a comercializar ganado, lo aprendió de su padre, y lo realiza de manera independiente hace ya 13 años, es apoyado por su esposa, tiene mucha experiencia no ha tenido dificultades que le eviten continuar trabajando.
Utilizará el crédito para pagar la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y maicillo, lo que le acortara el tiempo para procesar los granos y ponerlos  a la disposición de sus clientes, espera mejorar sus ingresos para cancelar la deuda adquirida y ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias con las cuales formara un patrimonio que dé a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is married and his family is made up of his wife and his 4-year-old son. He makes his living growing bulk grains and selling cattle which he learnt from his father; he has been performing this role independently for 13 years already, he is supported by his wife, and has a lot of experience in the field: he has not had any difficulties that have stopped him from working.

Julio will use the loan to pay for the collection of corn and sorghum, which will cut down the time to process the grains and make them available to his customers. He hopes to improve his income to repay the debt he has accumulated and offer his family a better quality of life. His dream is to strengthen his business to obtain greater profits with which he will build up his assets that will give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for the collection of the harvested corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for resale.

loans.name: Mamura

texts.en:
Mamura is a young and purposeful woman. She is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents. She is going to start her own business because she needs money. Mamura wants to open her own workshop. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ by a womens organization. 

Mamura does not have the money to buy a sewing machine for her new business, so she is asking for a loan of 850 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking season for resale.

loans.name: Gulhayo

texts.en:
Gulhayo was born in 1994. She is not married and lives with her parents in a little village. She is a sewer and one month ago, she started a business in sewing. 

Gulhayo does not have enough money to buy new sewing machine to replace her old one. She wants to give her clients high quality service, so she is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El es  Juan Felipe, tiene 14 años la carrera técnica que escogio es  porque le apasionan mucho los computadores, le gusta desarmar y armar, vive con los padres y el hermano, esta en decimo grado, la mama estudio hace 8 años en esta institución y ya logro tener el negocio propio,  por eso se que Campo Alto le sirve para comenzar  una  carrera técnica, el deseo es poner en práctica todo lo aprendido, no solo en Colombia sino en el exterior, poder empezar a ayudarle a los  padres económicamente, ya que ellos siempre ha estado apoyándolo, quiere poder tener un negocio propio y darle empleo a personas emprendedoras como el. 
Quiere que lo reconozcan por la honestidad y por la excelencia del trabajo, ya que es muy importante para el.  Se entero de Campo Alto por referencias muy buenas de esta institución, y la meta es terminar de estudiar el bachillerato y terminar la carrera técnica y más adelante estudiar algo similar de computadores en una universidad.   
Espera poner todo de parte de el, para aprender  y ser el mejor, desea que por favor le sea aprobado el convenio kiva  para ayudarle a los padres que ya le pagan una carrera con gran esfuerzo a la corta edad que tiene.
texts.en:
Juan Felipe is 14 years old, he chose a technical field because he is passionate about computers, and he likes building and dismantling them. He lives with his parents and brother, and is in the 10th grade. His mother studied for eight years in this school and managed to set up her own business, this is why Campo Alto is of use to start a technical career. His dream is to put everything learned into practice, not only in Colombia but elsewhere, to start to help his parents financially speaking as they have always supported him. He wants to set up his own business and give enterprising people like him a job. 

Juan Felipe wants to be recognized for his honesty and the excellent nature of his work, as it is very important for him. He found out about Campo Alto through the very good references that it has, and his aim is to finish studying the baccalaureate and finish the technical branch and late on his wants to study something similar to computers at university. 

Juan Felipe hopes to be able to give his all, to learn and to be the best. He hopes that the loan with Kiva will be approved to help his parents as they are working extremely hard to pay for his studies at this young age.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Gloria Lilian

texts.es:
Achuapa es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras, con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita la joven Ruiz conocida como Glorita.

Glorita Es una joven de 42 años de edad casada, cuenta con un hijito bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a su hijito que tanto ama y estima. 
Trabaja en la alcaldía municipal teniendo 10 años de laborar bajo el cargo de secretaria, hoy en día es de su deseo tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda. 

Se siente a gusto ser asalariada, pero su salario no le da para poder tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitarle a Kiva y Ceprodel un pequeño crédito para la compra de una Refrigeradora, ayudando a mejorar las condiciones de su familia. 

 
Ella considera que esto sería de gran importancia por lo que ayuda a mantener con mejor cuido los alimentos de su pequeño hijito.
Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a small municipality where there are enterprising people keen to improve their lot in life; this is where the young Glorita lives.

Glorita is a young woman of 42 years of age, she is married and has a small child under her care. With the little that she earns through hard toil, she helps to give support her son who she loves and values so much. She has been working in the municipal authority for 10 years as a secretary and now her dream is to have better living conditions.
 
She feels at ease being employed, but her wages are not sufficient to allow her to improve her living conditions. This is why she made the decision to ask for a small loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy a fridge, therein improving her family's life. Glorita believes that it is of real importance as it will help conserve her small child's food. She hopes in God that she will continue to receive this privilege of small loans which help her so much.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa tiene 65 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Maria Elisa  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte, insecticidas.

Las compras de los productos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas mensualmente. 
Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas el cogollero y lancha que caen en los cultivos. El sueño es tener éxito en la vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta cosinar y compartir con la familia.
texts.en:
María Elisa is 65 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

María is a member of the "30 de Julio" communal bank, which is located in the Zapotal Nuevo area of the Ventanas canton. Here the people make a living in agriculture.

María works in farming - she grows corn. She is applying for this loan in order to buy fertilisers, urea, manure, weedkiller, and insecticides,

María buys her products every month in the city of Ventanas.

María is facing challenges she as dealing with diseases that affect the crops. María's dream is to be successful. In her free time she likes to cook and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 38-year-old lady; she is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks, bamboos which have been depreciated over time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos because most planks have broken and lost their smoothness due to continuous usage.
 
Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth planks and bamboo to continue his business again.  She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will generate maximum profits with the help of this loan. 

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for sheltering services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton fabric to expand her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Coastal Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Accra. He is 50 years old and is married with two children, aged 18 and 16, who live at home and attend school.

For the past three years he has been selling sporting shoes in the local market. One of the problems he faces is having a small income. He enjoys the interaction with his customers and the profit he makes every time.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more sporting shoes to sell to customers. In the near future he wants to build a house for his family. He thanks the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more sporting shoes to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and soft drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 49-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a crockery store for 4 years and he is the only one responsible to feed the entire family.

Rukhsana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because her husband has to purchase different types of crockery (i.e jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets, etc.) This loan will help her husband to purchase these items for reselling purposes so that he can earn maximum profit and increase the daily sales. He can also use the profit amount as savings to fulfill his future needs.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of crockery items for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and spare parts for her motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 36-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be successful. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy  more stock. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own several shops within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

Previously, she was selling stationery.She hopes that in the future, she will get tenders to supply stationery.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nora Alexis

texts.es:
La señora Nora de 48  años de edad es soltera, tiene 01 hijo  que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de abarrotería.
Doña Nora en su negocio vende manteca, maíz, aceites, papel higiénico, platos y vasos desechables, etc. Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas productos como papel higiénico, agua, azúcar, café, pan, leche, huevos, etc. para surtir su negocio ya  que viene la semana santa desea surtir un poco más el negocio.
Doña Nora con el apoyo del crédito espera surtir más su negocio y de esa forma mejorara su condición de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Nora, age 48, is single and has one dependent child.  She lives in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  She has her own home, and she has been selling groceries for ten years.  In her business Nora sells shortening, corn, cooking oil, toilet paper, and disposable plates and glasses, etc.  

She is requesting the loan to buy more products like toilet paper, water, coffee, bread, milk, and eggs, etc. to stock her business.  Easter is coming, and she wishes to stock her business a little more.

With the support of the loan, Nora hopes to stock her business more.  This way she hopes to improve her living conditions.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January, 2014

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, water, coffee, bread, milk, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, opta por otro crédito para efectuar la compra de cerdos y pago de mano de obra para hender leña que luego venderá, espera aumentar continuar creciendo en el negocio para tener accesos a los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Para Francisca el crédito anterior le ayudo a legitimar su propiedad, también adquirió cerdos y leña la cual ha vendido a buen precio dándole muy buenas ganancias las cuales ha utilizado para cancelar sus cuotas y construir dos cuartos más en su casa, dándole a su familia un ambiente más cómodo.
texts.en:
Francisca is deciding on another loan in order to buy pigs.  She will also pay for the labor to split wood that she will then sell.  She hopes to increase and to continue growing in the business.  She wants to do this in order to have the income that she needs so much to get ahead with her family.

Francisca’s previous loan helped her to legalize her property.  She also got pigs and firewood, which she sold for a good price.  She got very good profits, which she has used to make her payments and to build two more rooms in her house.  This gave her family more comfortable surroundings.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to pay for the labor to split wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer, es un joven de 23 años de edad, con muchos propósitos en la vida, estudió hasta noveno grado en la ciudad, para dirigirse a la escuela, tenía que caminar durante 25 minutos por caminos en las montañas, y así, acortar la distancia. Él vive con sus padres, dos hermanos y un sobrino. Sus padres lastimosamente ya no pudieron seguir apoyándolo para continuar estudiando el nivel medio, pues le queda más lejos y tenia que gastar mucho más dinero.

La obligación de mantener a la familia recae sobre Elmer, y del apoyo de su padre que también trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de especies menores.
Desde hace dos años, el joven asiste a la iglesia de su comunidad, lo hace siempre por las tardes, luego de terminar su trabajo en la agricultura.

Elmer y su padre, siembran maíz, frijoles y maicillo, este trabajo lo aprendió  desde muy pequeño gracias a su padre. Además, se dedica a la crianza de especies menores (engorde de cerdos) y sus hermanos lo apoyan en dicha actividad. Hoy en dia trabaja en un proyecto de agua en la comunidad, donde espera trabajar durante seis meses.


Él necesita de este crédito, para la compra de cuatro cerdos, además comprará lamina y madera para mejorar la galera donde mantendrá los cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, también necesita cancelar $100.00 a un amigo de la comunidad que le alquila el terreno donde el prepara la tierra para hacer los siembros de miaz.

Al realizar la venta de cerdos después de criarlos, estará garantizando los ingresos económicos necesarios para la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.

Elmer sueña con constuir una casa para su familia, para que vivan en las condiciones adecuadas, además, una de sus aspiraciones para futuro, es continuar sus estudios de educación media. Y así mismo, espera seguir con su negocio de compra y venta de cerdos.
texts.en:
Elmer, 23, has many goals in life. He studied up to the ninth grade in his city. To get to school, he had to walk for 25 minutes on mountain paths to shorten the distance. He lives with his parents, his two brothers, and one nephew. Unfortunately, his parents could not continue to support him to study at the secondary school level, because the school was farther away and would have cost much more money.

The obligation to sustain the family falls on Elmer, along with the support of his father, who also works in farming and raising small animals. For two years, Elmer has been going to his community church in the afternoons after finishing his work on the farm.

Elmer and his father grow corn, beans, and sorghum. Elmer learned about this work from a young age thanks to his father. He also raises small animals (fattening pigs), and his brothers support him with this labor. He is now working on a water project in his community, where he expects to work for six months.

He needs this loan to buy four pigs. He will also buy metal sheets and wood to improve the pigpen where he will keep the pigs to fatten and later sell them. He also needs to pay back $100 to a friend in the community who rents him the land where he is preparing to plant corn.

After selling the pigs that he will raise, he will be guaranteed the necessary financial income to secure food for his family.

Elmer dreams of building a house for his family so that they can live in suitable conditions. Another of his dreams for the future is to continue his studies. He also hopes to continue with his business buying and selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, as well as metal sheets and wood to improve the pigpen where he will keep the pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Henry Exau

texts.es:
Henry, es casado, vive en un ambiente familiar compuesto por su esposa y su hijo, por iniciativa propia instalo una librería y un cibercafé, lo atiende con ayuda de su esposa, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema que le evite tener activo su negocio.
El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizara para surtir el inventario del negocio comprara mochilas, cuadernos, libros, lápices, etc., con lo que tendrá a la disposición de sus clientes productos novedosos y a precios accesibles, con lo que espera mejorar sus ventas y aumentar las ganancias.
Su objetivo es expandir su negocio, mejorar su economía y dar a su familia mejor estilo de vida
texts.en:
Henry is married and lives in a family home with his spouse and child. On his own initiative, he opened a bookstore and cybercafé, which he runs with the help of his wife. He works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and until now he hasn't encountered any problems that have prevented him from keeping his business running.

Henry is requesting this loan to stock inventory for his business. He will purchase backpacks, notebooks, books, pencils, etc. This way his customers will have access to new products at accessible prices. He hopes that this will improve his sales and increase his profits. Henry's goal is to expand his business, improve his financial well-being and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, notebooks, books, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Lesvia Neris

texts.es:
La señora Lesvia Neris de 48  años de edad es casada, tiene 02 hijos  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña  Lesvia Neris tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la venta de ropa usada sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en su negocio.
Doña Lesvia Neris está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pantalones, blusas, vestidos, camisas, calzonetas, etc. y ropa de verano ya  que viene la semana santa desea surtir un poco más el negocio.
Doña Lesvia Neris espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener el mejor negocio de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Lesvia Neris, age 48, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives in the San Lorenzo community, a valley in southern Honduras.  Lesvia Neris has her own house.  She has been selling used clothes for four years.  Her customers are her friends and people who visit her business every day.

Lesvia Neris is requesting the loan to buy pants, blouses, dresses, shirts, shorts, and summer clothes, etc.  Easter is coming, and she wishes to stock the business a little more.

Lesvia Neris hopes to improve, a little, her quality of life and that of her family.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her house and to have the best business in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January, 2014
