loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, dresses, shirts, shorts, and summer clothes, etc.

loans.name: Kelvin Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Kelvin un joven de 21 años él tiene una relación en unión libre no tienen hijos actualmente es pilar de hogar ella no trabaja por el momento está estudiando, Don Kelvin con su negocio y trabajo es quien día con día lucha para darle a la pareja la oportunidad de prepararse, se dedica al comercio de cerdos aprendió de este negocio junto a un amigo trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre el negocio y el trabajo en una carpintería. 
Don Kelvin vive y tiene su negocio San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, el mismo cuenta varios sitios turísticos y de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy alegre, amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes. 
Don kelvin solicita el crédito para el arreglo y ampliación de las chancheras lo que le permitirá incrementar la compra de cerdos, con esta inversión espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida, Don Kelvin agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Kelvin, 21, is in a common-law marriage and does not have any children. He is currently the breadwinner of his household, as his partner is studying and does not work. With his business and his work, he fights every day to give her the opportunity to study. He makes a living selling pigs. He learned about this business with a friend. He works for about 10 hours per day between his business and his work in a carpentry shop.

Kelvin lives and runs his business in San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor. This area has many tourist and leisure attractions which are popular among domestic and foreign tourists. One of the canton's traditions are its festivals, with popular dances and the famous burning of a model castle. The people of this canton are very happy, friendly, and relaxed with all of their visitors.

Kelvin is applying for a loan to fix up and expand his pigpen, which will allow him to increase the number of pigs he buys. With this investment, he hopes to improve his financial income and improve his quality of life. Kelvin is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for their support and for this opportunity.

loans.use: to fix up and expand his pigpen.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides transportation services by using an auto rickshaw. His rickshaw has become out of order due to continuous driving and he needs to better maintain his auto rickshaw. 

This rickshaw is the only source of income for his family, so he wants to fix it as soon as possible but, due to lack of availability of funds, he is unable to fix his rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he can fix the rickshaw and can drive it smoothly.

Parveen praises this honorable support from Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain auto rickshaw

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa de 67  años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene 02 hijos que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Luisa tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 06 años  a la venta medicina natural y tiene una pulpería en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la medicina natural, también vende pescado y miel de abeja. 
Doña Luisa está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como panadol, analgésicos, aspirinas, refrescos, agua, azúcar, arroz, manteca etc. para surtir su negocio ya  tiene bastante demanda para esta época,  con el apoyo del crédito surtirá más su negocio.
Doña Luisa espera mejorar sus ingresos, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Luisa, 67, lives with her husband and has two dependent children. She lives in the village of San Lorenzo in the southern valley of Honduras. 

Luisa has her own home. She has been selling natural medicines for six years and she has a small grocery store. In her business, she sells everything related to natural medicine. She also sells fish and honey.

Luisa is applying for this loan to buy more products such as acetaminophen, painkillers, aspirin, soft drinks, water, sugar, butter, etc. She will stock her business because she is experiencing a high demand during this season. Luisa hopes to improve her income. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: to buy acetaminophen, painkillers, aspirin, soft drinks, water, sugar, rice, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Fatmata from Tombo, in the western rural area of Freetown, in Sierra Leone. 

Fatmata is married with five children. After her wedding, she established her retail business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her family. 

She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. She says the main challenges to her business are price inflation and business location.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income generated from this loan will enable her to improve her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is a 40-year-old hardworking lady who stays with her husband in a small village of Maynaguri, Jaipaiguri district in West Bengal. They have one son, studying in grade 4 in village school.

She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. He farms different kinds of vegetable crops to sell in the local market. Now Kanika is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers of bitter melons for farming as an additional vegetable because it is very profitable business in her area. Kanika hopes cultivation of bitter melon will help her increase her income so she can overcome her family’s piteous condition.

Kanika is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers of bitter melon for farming.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is married and a rural woman of 30 years. She is from a small village Anandanagar in Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband, Nibas, and their only son in their own kachha house (mud, wood and straw made). Both Laxmi and her husband studied up to grade 10.  Their son is below the school-going age. Laxmi's husband, 36 years old, is engaged in a small business.

Laxmi  is engaged in a business of selling firewood. She is very enterprising and hardworking and wishes to get ahead in life. She works hard to collect wood from her village and from the neighbouring villages. She sells the wood to the people of her locality where firewood is used as fuel. In this way Laxmi tries to earn for the family. Yet they are unable to give a decent lifestyle to their family. They want to expand the business, which they can't do due to lack of resources.

Laxmi has taken a loan from BJS to purchase firewood for expanding her business. Her dreams are to upgrade their poor financial condition, well educate her son and enhance her business for a secured future.

She gives her full thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase firewood to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and cassava grain (foo foo) for resale

loans.name: Mayadashi

texts.en:
Mayadashi is a 43-year-old housewife who lives in Maynaguri with her husband, Swapan, and two sons. She studied up to grade 8 and her husband up to grade 5. Mayadashi’s children go to school. Her husband is a farmer engaged in agriculture, and he is the only income earner of her family.  

Mayadashi wants to help her family financially and decided to farm tomatoes because winter is the best season to cultivate tomatoes. Mayadashi is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for cultivation of tomatoes in her own land. Mayadashi hopes to have a good harvest of tomatoes, and then she will sell them to the local market and earn profits.

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for cultivation of tomatoes in her own land.

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is a 36-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and three children in their small house of Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She completed only class VI (grade 6) whereas her husband studied up to class VII (grade 7). Their children are studying in different classes.

Shephali’s husband sells cosmetics door to door in her local area and also supplies them to the market, but this business does not provide them enough money to give them a decent lifestyle.  

Now Shephali decided to cultivate chilies in their own land. Shephali came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and she has taken a loan to purchase saplings of green chilies and good quality fertilizers so that they can start cultivating green chilies in their fields. There is a huge demand for chilies in the present market.

Both Shephali and her husband dream that the profit generated from the business will help them to build up their savings and also help to uplift the family’s financial status.

Now Shephali is so happy and giving her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and good quality fertilizers for cultivating green chilies.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Adama from Tombo, a rural area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children.  

Adama established her wax cotton material (batik) business because she wanted to generate income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Adama requires a loan to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable her to keep up her home and increase her business. 

In the future, Adama plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton (batik) to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a 29-year-old housewife of the small town Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. Her husband, Swapan, is a fish seller who sells fish in the local village market. They are blessed with two children and both of them are school goers. 

Her husband is not able to sell fish in huge amount due to their monetary problems and that is why his income is insufficient to cover the family’s daily expenses. As he is the only income earner, the whole responsibility is upon him but he cannot find the way out. 

As soon as Manju heard about how BJS (Kiva’s partner), helps the poor community, she applied for a loan to purchase different types of fishes to sell in their local village market so that they can earn more than enough. If they can supply fish according to the village people’s requirement she will be able to strengthen her financial as well as business status. Manju knows that she can grow her business with the profit she will gain from this loan.

Manju is highly obliged and grateful to BJS and Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: To purchase different types of fishes to expand her existing fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 28 years old and her husband is 34 years old. Both of them earn by cultivating different crops in the field. They have five children and three of them are receiving an education. 

From the very beginning, Farida has had many problems running the family. Due to lack of capital it was not possible to cultivate any crop in their parental land. For this reason they have taken the loan so that they can use that land and earn some money from it. With the loan amount, she will buy potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. Both of them dream to give a bright future to their children so that their children can become established in their life and when both of them become old, their children will look after them.

They hope that the loan that they have taken will help them in their future.

Farida is thanking BJS and Kiva greatly.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a very energetic and optimistic woman who does not want to give up. She lives in a village Anandanagar in Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri, with her husband and two sons in their own house. She is 51 years old and attended school up to grade 9. Her husband, Tapan, is 57 years old and is associated with a small business. She has been selling clothing for the last six years. She sells door-to-door in the neighborhoods and villages near her own. Her two sons also help her in her business.

These days it is hardly possible for them to maintain the household expenses with their small income as the prices of everything are going up day by day. She wants to expand the business by purchasing more clothing. As they lack the capital, she needs a loan.

Purnima has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase ladies' garments such as sarees, blouses, frocks, pajamas, etc. to meet customer demand, and she hopes that it will help her as much as she needs. Her goal is to buy enough clothes to fulfill her customers' orders and drastically increase her sales.

With the extra income from her business, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life. Purnima wishes her business would keep growing so that she can support her family and will overcome the financial hurdles they are facing now and secure their future life.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for their existing clothing business.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a rural woman of 32 years. She has a secondary education. She is married to Dulal, who is 41 years old. He attended school up to grade 8. They have two children (one son and one daughter). Both are students and read in grade 9 and grade 5, respectively. They live in the village Anandanagar in Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Her husband is engaged in a small business.

Minu is engaged in a clothing business. She buys clothing like shirts, t-shirts, etc. from the wholesale market and sells them to her neighbors. She has been running this business from her house for the last five years. She is completely dedicated to her job. Her husband also helps her in her business. But of late, it has become very difficult for them to cover all the necessities of their family with their small incomes. Minu wants to expand her business by purchasing more clothing to fulfill the needs of her customers, especially in this winter season.

Minu has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase more varieties of clothing. She estimates that this loan will help her satisfy her customer's demands and with the additional profits, she will be able to cover the basic needs of her family.  She is also hopeful to give her children better education to be successful in life. She plans to open her own garment shop in the local market in the future with the profits of her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for expanding the existing business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 52, is married and has three children. She describes herself as reliable and trustworthy. 

She operates a farm where she grows mangoes and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

She will use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her business goal is to be a major horticulture farmer within five years.
 
She hopes she will be a large-scale farmer in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 42-year-old married man and has one child. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat, maize and beans and he has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His business goal is to be stable and fully grown within five years, and he hopes that in the future, he will achieve his dreams. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Shyamala

texts.en:
Shyamala is a 55-year-old married woman. She is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. Though they are illiterate, they can sign their name. They have two children. One is studying and one got married. Shyamala's husband has taken credit from the market for her family's use, which Shyamala didn’t like. Her husband, due to insufficient earnings, is unable to clear all credit that he has taken from the market. The credit was necessary to feed his family. She decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow and sell milk to give financial support to her family.

She is a hardworking woman who wants to help her husband in any situation. Now they are living in a kachha house (made of mud and straw). After having good profit from this business she would like to build a pakka house (concrete) for her family and would love to give higher education to her child so that they can live happily throughout their life. 

Shyamala is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Shipra

texts.en:
Shipra is a 41-year-old woman of Dhupguri. She has four children who are studying in different classes. Her husband has a clothing business where he sells clothes to the local market, but his income is inconsistent as he takes payment on an installment basis. Due to inconvenient payment receipts, Shipra decided to start a new business of making quilts and blankets with old clothes, sarees, old bed covers, etc., and sells them door to door and to her relatives. She learned this art from her mother in childhood. Now she is applying this art to give financial assistance to her family as well as to her husband.

There is a great demand for blankets and quilts in Dhupguri because of the cold atmosphere, and for this reason she hopes she will gain more profit from this business. She wishes with the profit of her business that she will be able to overcome these economic hurdles. Shipra is now trying to expand her business and thanks BJS as well as Kiva because without their help it would not be possible for her to go forward.

loans.use: To purchase materials like clothes, old sarees, old bedcovers etc. for making quilts and blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more popcorn and bag sugar for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, the western rural part of Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. For the past 10 years, Fatmata has had a retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., six days per week. She says that the main challenge is that sometimes business is very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, biscuits, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 31 years old. She is married with three children. She sells various items such as soaps, salts and rice. She would like to use the loan to buy more soaps, salts and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more items to her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell such as salt, soaps and rice.

loans.name: Selemane

texts.en: Selemane is a father of five children. He sells animals and has been in the business for the past year. He has requested a loan to buy more goats for resale. He is planning to use the profits from the business to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Noemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemí, tiene 28 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos, para poder generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a vender ropa y utensilios de cocina, lo hace son el apoyo de su compañero de vida, su experiencia de 8 años le ha ayudado a administrar muy bien el negocio.
Con el crédito comprara variedad de ropa y platos, tasas, ollas, et., con lo que su negocio estará ofreciendo mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes, espera aumentar su clientela, mejorar sus ventas e incrementar las ganancias.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio para poder dar empleo a otras personas, mejorar su economía para cumplir con los compromisos económicos que tiene.
texts.en:
Noemí is 28 years old. She is in married and has 2 children. In order to generate income to cover the family's expenses, she sells clothing and kitchens utensils. She does this with the help of her life's companion. Her 8 years of experience have helped her to manage her business very well.
 
With the loan, she will buy a a variety of clothing and plates, cups, etc. With these, her business will be offering better purchasing opportunities to her customers. She hopes to increase the amount of customers she has, improve her sales and increase her profits.  

She dreams of expanding her business and being able to provide employment for other people and improving her finances to meet the financial obligations that she has.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, plates, cups, pots, etc.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 20 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy more livestock for her to raise in the future.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 37-year-old female, and she supports her two children, ages 12 and 8. This is her first loan of 50,000 KES. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a VisionFund officer. Esther sells cereals, and her business is located in Marereni. She has been in this business for six years and she earns a monthly income of 10,550 KES. She is planning to use the loan to purchase more cereals to sell to her customers, and she will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Al-Radhi Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Radhi and consists of four ladies, all of them are friends and come from Sana`a, Yemen.  Ghanj is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She is a hardworking woman who assists her husband to provide for her family’s daily expenses. Her husband has a small grocery store that used to provide his family.  Her husband's business has decreased, leading to a decline in his profits due to a lack of money to buy grocery products. Ghanj decided to apply for a loan to buy a fridge and grocery products to assist her husband in expanding his business so that they can attract more clients. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and grocery products to assist her husband in expanding his business so that they can attract more clients.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
This group of five women belongs to the group called Antehwe. This group gathers women who for the most part live in the same neighborhood. They have good relationships and their main business is retail in fish, sandals and lace materials.

Margaret is 41 years old and a single mother of three, including two daughters; the youngest child is five. With the loan, she will buy two cartons fish, smoke them and sell them to customers. These two cartons will cost her GHS 1200.

With the profit she will increase her savings, repay the loan, and improve her family’s living conditions by helping her children with school and clothing expenses. 

The group will need a total amount of GHS 4200.

loans.use: to buy two cartons fish, smoke them and then sell them to customers.

loans.name: Vayisi

texts.en: Vayisi 50 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 14 years. She sells beans, and she wants to buy more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest back in the business so she can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Willian Bladimir

texts.es:
William, necesita complementar el monto de la compra de una moto taxi, para ampliar su negocio y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para poder reparar su medio de transporte y continuar trabajando, sus clientes están más satisfechos, sus ingresos son mejores, su familia se encuentra muy saludable y ha cancelado sus deudas.
texts.en:
William needs to have the full amount for the purchase of a motorcycle taxi to expand his business and give his customers good service.  

The previous loan really helped him a lot to be able to repair his transportation method and continue working. His customers are more satisfied and his income is better. His family is very healthy and he has paid off his debts.

loans.use: to have the full amount for the purchase of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 31-year-old woman and she is married with one daughter. She studied up to grade 9. She is married to Mrinal, who is 34 years old and a car driver by profession. Mrinal studied up to grade 12. Their daughter is below school-going age. They live in the small village of Petkati in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own "kachha" house (mud-, straw- and bamboo-made).

Anna is a housewife. As the main source of income, her husband works as a car driver. His income is too low to cover all the family needs. So, both the husband and wife decided to start another business to give the family financial sustenance. They have decided to start a milk supply and milk products business.

Anna heard that Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) gives loans to rural women to start up new businesses. So, she has taken out a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and start a milk and milk products business (milk, butter, curd, paneer, etc.). Her main customers will be her neighbours and relatives. She hopes the business will be a lucrative one as there is high demand for the products. She will be able to help her family financially by doing this business.

Anna plans to use the income from the business to further increase her head of livestock as well as to save money for her daughter's education. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a business selling milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Grader Traders Group

texts.en:
This group of five members belongs to the group called Grader Traders. This group gathers members who for the most part live in the same neighborhood. They have good relationships and their main business is retail in corn dough, palm oil, noddles, wax-prints and car tires. 

Emmanuel is 42 years old and a married father of three, all boys. With the loan, he will buy more car tires to sell to customers. With the profit he will increase his savings, repay the loan, and improve his family’s living conditions by helping his children with school and clothing expenses.
 
The group will need a total amount of GHS 6500 and each member would be responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more car tires to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lwansa

texts.en:
Lwansa is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Lusaka, which is the capital city of Zambia. He provides financial services to people in his community through mobile money transfers. Lwansa had a full-time job but began his mobile money transfer business three months ago because his salary was not enough to support his family needs. He currently employs one person.

Lwansa enjoys his business because it offers affordable and convenient financial services to ordinary people who may otherwise not afford conventional banking services. His biggest challenge is low working capital to satisfy his customers. He has requested a Kiva loan to boost his working capital and help him grow his business. This will help Lwanda to serve more customers and earn additional profits.

Lwansa’s biggest dream is to see his two young children through college so that they can have good opportunities for reliable employment. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business so that he can serve more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 7 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 7. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children.

Carmen plans to send her children to school, which is the reason why she is working hard, selling clothes from her house and by walking in her community and others nearby. She is excited to be taking her 18th loan with Kiva field partner Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She has increased her business, which she started with her first loan, when she sold a small quantity of clothes and other products. Now she sells more and sometimes she sells different products to expand her sales. 

As a member of Esperanza, Carmen joined this borrower group that includes some of her very good friends. She says all of them are hard workers and dedicated to their businesses. She dreams of having a successful and established business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas 6 Group

texts.en:
Adelaida is the coordinator of her group, Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors) 6. This group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long-term partner and her child. 

Adelaida is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business with a small grocery store, four years after she began running a little food market, where she sells daily food, like canned food, flour, sugar, rice and other goods. She will use the profits to provide for her family and to save. She will also save toward her dream to have her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar, canned food, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Erlinda de 26  años de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene 02 hijos que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Erlinda no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de verduras y abarrotería en el interior del mercado nuevo.
Doña Erlinda está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como chile verde, plátanos, cebollas, patastes, etc.  Para surtir su negocio ya  tiene bastante demanda para esta época,  con el apoyo del crédito surtirá más su negocio y de esa forma espera mejorar sus ingresos. 
Doña Erlinda está muy contenta de seguir trabajando. Con Prisma es su segundo préstamo  es un cliente regular. Su sueño es tener su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Erlinda is 26 years old, and she lives with her husband. She has two children that depend on her. Erlinda lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras, and she does not have her own home. 

For the past five years, Erlinda has been selling vegetables and groceries within the new market. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more products like green chilis, plantains, onions, chayotes, etc. At this time, there is already plenty of demand to stock her business. With the help of the loan, Erlinda will better furnish her store, and in this way improve her earnings. 

Erlinda is very happy to keep working. This is her second loan with Prisma; she is a regular client. Her dream is to own her home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: purchase green chilis, plantains, onions, chayotes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 29 years old and not married. He has been in business for one year and his monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan Shillings. He will use the loan to buy poultry and with the profits from expansion, he will buy cows. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya (formerly KADET).

loans.use: to buy more poultry to enlarge the business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 42 years old and she is married with five children. She sells different items in her boutique. With this loan, she would like to buy more saucepans and shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Dinobala

texts.en:
Dinobala is a 50-year-old woman. She is from a remote village in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She, together with her husband, is raising one son. She and her husband both have primary education. After finishing her education, Dinobala got married to Bhobin, who is now 61 years old and engaged in agriculture. Their only son is a car driver by profession. They live in their own kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made).

Dinobala is a housewife, but she helps her husband in his agricultural activities, after managing her household work. Their agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. They grow vegetables on their land and sell the produce in the local market. The income from their agribusiness is not sufficient to provide them financial sustenance. So, for an additional income, they have decided to start another business of supplying milk.

Dinobala requested a loan from BJS to buy a dairy cow. She plans to sell the milk in her locality. Her neighbors, friends and relatives will be her main clients. Thus, she wants to increase the family income to fulfill her goals.

She dreams to invest the earnings from the business into further increasing livestock quantities and saving money to upgrade their poor economic condition.

Dinobala is very much thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk-supply business.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is the coordinator of her group, El Sol Sale Para Todos 1 (The Sun Shines For Everyone), the members of which are located in the city of Hato Mayor, a small rural community. Antonia makes her home there with her husband in a simple structure. 

With her first Esperanza loan almost nine years ago, Antonia started her business, a "Fantasia" for selling miscellaneous products. She is now requesting her 16th loan, which she will use to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women's accessories and other miscellaneous products. 

She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business, something she continues to work very hard at. In the meantime, she plans to continue attending church and serving the people. Antonia and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Harlan Jose

texts.es: El señor Harlan, siempre haciendo planes a futuro para obtener una estabilidad con su familia, actualmente labora para una empresa privada, su esposa comercializa ropa para ayudar a su esposo en la economia del hogar, el solicita credito para la compra de bloques, hierro, cemento,zinc para relizar mejorar y cambiar el techo de la vivienda, muy agradecido el señor harlan nos muestra su alegria con Kiva y Afodenic por la confianza en el.
texts.en: Harlan is always making plans for the future to achieve stability for his family. Currently he works for a private company, and his wife sells clothes to help her husband with the economy of the household. Harlan is requesting a loan to purchase blocks, iron, cement, and zinc, in order to make improvements and to change the roof of his home. Harlan is very grateful, and he is happy with Kiva and AFODENIC because of their confidence in him.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs, and pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs, and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cream, toothpaste and soap for resale.

loans.name: Angie Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una joven que tiene 18 años de edad, actualmente ella vive con los abuelos paternos y la mascota, puesto que a los 7 meses de vida la mama la dejo y se fue, con el tiempo lorena ingresa al colegio, siempre siendo una excelente estudiante y obteniendo buenas calificaciones, a lo largo de la corta vida, cuando tenia 16 años comenzó a darse cuenta que la vocación era la de prestarle la mano y ayuda a los demás, a si recién se graduó decidió ingresar a estudiar auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto. 
Ella ya hizo los dos primeros semestres en una de las sedes, durante estos semestres ella nunca perdió ninguna materia, ya que ella es la que paga todo el estudio, lorena pagaba una mensualidad un poco mas económica el semestre pasado, pero al iniciar las practicas le informaron que el convenio que tenia en el cual pagaba mensualidades mas económicas finalizo y debía pagar el valor de las cuotas normales que son un poco mas caras, esto la desmotivo un poco ya que ella es la que paga el estudio. 
En este momento ella desea acceder al convenio de kiva para a si poder culminar satisfactoriamente los estudios como auxiliar de enfermería y poder lograr que la familia a futuro tenga una mejor calidad de vida e incluso ella, ella cuando termine la carrera, inmediatamente quiere conseguir empelo, sin embargo a futuro ella tiene metas como la de iniciar los estudios como enfermera profesional.
texts.en:
Lorena is a young woman who is 18 year old. She currently lives with her paternal grandparents and her pet. At seven months old, her mother abandoned her and left. Over time, Lorena enrolled in school. She has always been an excellent student and she earned good grades throughout her short life. When she was 16 years old, she started to realize that her vocation was to lend a hand and help others. Since she graduated, she recently decided to to study to become a nursing assistant at CampoAlto.
She has completed the first two semesters at one of the school's locations. During these semesters, she never failed a single subject. Since Lorena is paying for all of her studies, she was making a little more inexpensive monthly payments last semester. Since starting the internships, she has been informed that the agreement that she had making inexpensive payments has come to an end. She has to pay the normal fees that not just a little more expensive. This is a little discouraging because since she is the one paying for her education. 
At this time, she wants to agree to a Kiva loan so that she can satisfactorily finish her nursing assistant course. She wants the family, including herself,  to have a better quality of life in the future. When she finishes her degree, she immediately wants to find employment. However, in the future, she has goals like starting studies to become a professional nurse.

loans.use: pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
The Noyaa group is composed of three members. On average, they are 34 years old and live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Teshie in the city of Accra.

They know one another through neighbors, friendship, and business. In order to reinforce their financial capacity and better run their business, they joined the microfinance institution ID-Ghana. They are now on their ninth loan cycle, and have properly repaid their eight previous loans. This group sells groceries, hair products and jewelry. 

Georgina is the woman standing on the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans on buying more jewelry at the cost of GHS 3,800 and supplying it to customers. She operates this business from the house, which is increasing her customers’ confidence because she can be easily located.

They need a total amount of GHS 6,200.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to supply to customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 22 years old. She owns a hardware business and has been running the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more iron sheets and cement for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets and cement for sale

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 6 Group

texts.en:
Haide is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 6. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Haide is excited to be taking her eleventh loan with Kiva field partner Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to invest in her jewelry sales business, and will buy different accessories made of silver, such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc. She also plans to buy stainless steel jewelry.

Haide plans to save some of her profits in order to raise her savings for the future and to expand her business. She wants to improve her business. She wants to provide for her children to go to school and become professionals. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Cristian Leonardo

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes 
En este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio el señor Cristian un joven de 20 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen un hijo, la esposa no trabaja  ella pasa en la casa cuidando a su pequeño hijo. 
Actualmente se están dedicando al negocio de la ganadería a la producción de ganado para carne, aprendió de este negocio con sus padres, trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre su negocio y el trabajo en la gasolinera. 
Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más ganado para engordar y vender, con esta inversión espera que su nivel de vida mejore desea incrementar sus ingresos para darle un mejor futuro a la esposa e hijo. 
El Señor Cristian agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo que le dieron para emprender en el negocio y por el apoyo que ahora le están dando para seguir incrementando su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is the canton of love. It has a warm and humid climate and several resting spots that are much frequented by national and foreign tourists. As a tradition, we have the canton festivals during which there are popular dances and and the famous burning of the castle. The people in this canton are very friendly and peaceful towards all of their visitors. 
 
Cristian lives and has his business in this canton. He is a 20 year old man who has a solid relationship in a common law marriage from which he has one son. His wife doesn't work and stays at home caring for their young son. RIght now, they work in the cattle ranching business, raising beef cattle. He learned this business from his parents. He works an average of 10 hours a day between this business and his job at a gas station.

He will invest this loan in buying more cattle to fatten up and sell. With this investment, he hopes that his quality of life will improve. He wants to increase his income and give his wife and child a better future.
 
Cristian is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support they gave him to start his business and for the support they are giving him now to keep increasing his productive activity.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Om-Anan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Anan, which consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work hard as much they can to offer a good life for their families. They took out a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB. 

Arwa is the leader of this group. She is 32 years old, married and an uneducated woman. Her life conditions prevented her from completing her higher education. She is a housewife who wishes her children to grow up well and have a better education. 

She intends to buy supplies for her house, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy kitchen appliances for her house. This will enable her family to live with more comfort and will help her to improve her kitchen and make it better.

She hopes to establish a retail shop in order to have daily income and to live comfortably with her family. 

She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances for her house.

loans.name: Rosaura Aracely

texts.es:
Rosaura, se dispone a mejorar y surtir su inventario de ropa, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara variedad de ropa y mercaderia para la tienda, esto le ayudara a tener mejores ventas y más ganancias con las cuales cubrirá sus compromisos económicos.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a tener mejores ofertas para sus clientes lo que le dio un resultado positivo porque tuvo un incremento tanto en sus ventas como en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosaura wishes to improve and restock her inventory of clothing. For that reason, she is requesting a new loan, so that she can purchase a variety of clothing and merchandise for her store. This will help her to improve sales and increase earnings, and help her cover her economic commitments.

Rosaura's previous investment helped her offer better deals to her customers, which led to positive results because her sales improved as well as her income.

loans.use: buy a variety of clothing and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to properly outfit his business vehicle

loans.name: Neydi Maried

texts.es:
Ella es naydi, quien actualmente esta trabajando los fines de semana para ayudas del estudio, ella quiere ingresar a campo alto para hacer un técnico laboral, ella es madre cabeza de hogar y quiere superarse para a si poder sacar al hijo adelante, ella esta interesada en el programa de servicios farmacéuticos ya que es el programa que mas le interesa, a ella le fue muy bien en el examen de estado y por el puntaje obtenido le aconsejaron estudiar estudiar esta carrera, ya que mas adelante podría tener la propia farmacia y a si colaborar en la casa y darle un mejor futuro a el hijo, la meta es obtener un buen trabajo para a si continuar con una carrera profesional.
Ella es privilegiada de haber escuchado sobre el convenio de kiva y quien quiere ser favorecida con este convenio, ya que es complicado para ella pagar los estudios y darle lo que necesita al hijo, ella siempre le ha llamado la atención todo lo que tenga que ver con la salud, por eso ella esta tan interesada en este programa.
texts.en:
This is Naydi, who currently works weekends to help pay for her studies.  She wants to get into a better field so she can do technical work. She's a mother and head of the household.  She wants to better herself so she can get her son ahead.  She's interested in a pharmaceutical services program because it's what interests her the most.  She did really well on the state exam and because of her score she was advised to go into this career;  later on she'd be able to have her own pharmacy and work at home, too, and give her child a better future.  Her goal is to get a better job so she can continue with her professional program of study.  

Naydi is privileged to have heard about the Kiva agreement and who would be benefited by it because it's complicated for her to pay for her studies and give her son all he needs.  She has always paid attention to everything to do with health, which is why she's so interested in this program.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ghamdan Group

texts.en: This group is called Ghamdan and consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Taez is 36 years old and lives with her family in a poor area in Sana`a. She is a married housewife and has six children, some of whom attend public school. She is hardworking and knows how to manage her children's care and to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, she said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself, but it is not enough to cover her household needs. She has requested a loan of 40,000 YER to buy a washing machine to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine  to use in her house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 26-year-old married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells plates, cooking pans, cups, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are people of all types. 

Agnes describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient capital. She will use the requested KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of plates, cups, and other items. Her goal is to expand her business within 5 years. Agnes hopes that, in the future, she will improve her business and provide an education for her child. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plates, cups, and other items

loans.name: Travis

texts.en:
Travis had been creating and running blogs for several years when his friends began asking for help creating their websites. He decided to start "TechKnowTeam" — a company that builds and updates websites and logos for small businesses. He has been in operation for three months and has enjoyed a steadily increasing stream of customers. 

Travis has shown that his business can succeed and has begun the steps necessary to expand his business and reach a larger number of customers and small businesses. He hopes to purchase additional computers and eventually hire additional web designers. 

Help this father of two build his business and provide for his family!

loans.use: to purchase additional computers

loans.name: Emerithe

texts.en: Emerithe is 36 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Albalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Albalina, ha trabajado mucho para tener que mejorar sus condiciones de vida y su vivienda, ella labora como conserje para una casa privada, su esposo es comerciante vende Carne en un puesto. el credito lo solicita para comprar materiales como: cemento, arena, piedrin, arena, Hierro ya que construira un sumidero para adaptarlo al inodoro, Agradece el apoyo y confianza que Kiva y Afodnic le han brindado.
texts.en: Albalina has worked hard to improve her living conditions and those of her home.  She works as a concierge in a private home and her husband is a merchant who sells meet from a stall.  She will use the money from this loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, stone, iron bars, to install a sink and toilet.  She is grateful for the support and trust that Kiva and AFODNIC have given her.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages in quantity.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 20 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Compra sus productos en San Miguel en el Comercial Agripac y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para su familia y para invertir. Su sueño mejorar la calidad de vida.
Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte
texts.en:
Manuel is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the San Miguel settlement in Bolivar province.

He is a member of the San José de las Orquídeas group in San Pablo, within the San Miguel settlement and raises livestock and farms.

Manuel raises corn and makes his purchases at the Agripac Center in San Miguel and sells his own products in the same place.

He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizer for his corn.  This loan has helped him increase his income for his family and to invest in his business.  His dream is to improve his quality of life. 

He likes to work and play sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have three children. She has a business selling retail items. With this loan, Bernadette would like to buy more utensils, saucepans, and basins to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, saucepans, and basins to sell.

loans.name: Erika  Valeria

texts.es:
En Santo Domingo de los Colorados una ciudad muy conocida en Ecuador por ser el puente entre la sierra y la costa habita Erika, una señora de 21 años; madre soltera quien vive con su hijo en casa de padres en un recinto llamado La Florida, un sector muy productivo.
Erika es una mujer luchadora, siempre ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia. En una pequeña finca de propiedad de sus padres ha sembrado cacao y ají, los mismos que ya están en producción, cosecha y sale a vender todas las semanas al pueblo, le ha ido muy bien; por lo que ahora necesita crédito para la compra de semillas y abono y mejorar su producción.
Es clienta nueva en la institución, se siente muy feliz ya que Fundación Alternativa le ha ayudado mucho para mejorar su negocio, está muy agradecida con Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Erika lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city well-known for being the bridge between the mountains and coast in Ecuador.  She is 21 years old and is a single mother who lives with her son at her parent’s house, in an area called La Florida.  It is a very productive sector.

Erika is very hardworking and always works to get her family ahead.  She has planted cacao on her parent’s farmland and goes out to sell in town every week.  Things have gone well for her and she needs a loan to buy seeds and compost to increase her production.

She says that she is happy with Fundación Alternativa and it’s helped her business very much.  She is very grateful to Kiva for their help.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Fatmata from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child. After her wedding, Fatmata established her retail business in order to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and her business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more baby clothes, pens, perfumes, and creams to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as eggs, butter, flour, fruits and sweets.

loans.name: Xochilt Alexania

texts.es: Xochilt de 20 años, es originaria del Municipio de Cinco Pinos, residente en la Ciudad de Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una joven emprendedora, trabajadora, honesta, responsable, trabaja en una Ferretería donde se desempeña como atención al cliente, actualmente esta en cuarto año de Lic. en Enfermería, por lo que se acerco a las Oficinas de Ceprodel Somotillo a solicitar un crédito para pagar la matricula y aranceles del primer trimestre de la Universidad y de esta manera seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Xochilt is 20 years old and originally from the town of Cinco Pinos, but she now resides in the city of Somotillo. She is known for being an enterprising, hardworking, honest, and responsible young woman.

Xochilt works at a hardware store where she attends to the customers. She is currently in her fourth year of a nursing degree program. Xochilt came to the CEPRODEL office in Somotillo to request a loan in order to pay the tuition and fees for her first trimester at the university. This will enable her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, está preparando todo para la próxima siembra, por lo que está solicitando más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, necesarios para preparar el terreno en donde cultivara maíz.
Con el crédito anterior pudo sembrar sin ningún problema teniendo como resultado una abundante producción y libre de plagas, su economía es mejor lo que le permite dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
José is getting everything ready to plant his crops and so is applying for a loan in order to buy the necessary farming supplies to prepare the land where he will grow corn.

José was able to use his previous loan to sow his crops without any problems. He consequently has a good and healthy yield. His financial situation i now better, allowing him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando founded Roldan Insurance Consultants almost four years ago after working in the insurance industry for years. Utilizing a vast amount of knowledge and experience, he created an impressive portfolio of clients, including Humana and Forrester Insurance Group among others. 

Tragically, in September of 2010, problems with his health forced Rolando to take a medical leave of absence. Thankfully, his doctors declared him cancer-free in 2013, and he is excited and anxious to continue to expand his business. 

Rolando started working again six months ago, and his company has posted six months of positive growth. However, due to large medical bills and a downtrodden economy, Rolando has little capital to expand. He hopes to purchase a used car for reliable transportation to and from work and establish a positive line of credit. Rolando has the skills and experience to succeed and simply needs a small push to continue advancing his dream.

loans.use: to purchase a used car for reliable transportation

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, está renovando el inventario de su tienda de ropa por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito el cual utilizara para comprar ropa usada bien seleccionada para facilitar su venta, invertira en frutas y verduras frescas, con las cuales garantizará sus ganancias, con las que piensa cancelar sus cuotas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirir ropa, frutas y verduras, con las que pudo satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, vendió más y las utilidades son mayores.
texts.en:
Ana is stocking up for her clothes store. She is therefore applying for a new loan that will be used to buy well-chosen second-hand clothing to sell. Ana will also invest in fresh fruits and vegetables. These products will guarantee that she has profits, with which she plans to pay off her loan and improve her family's living conditions.

Ana's previous loan helped her to buy clothes, fruit and vegetables, allowing her to satisfy her customers' needs. She sold more products and had higher profits.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mirian Rosario

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 8 años, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela, ella vive en casa de la mamá. 
Doña Mirian es una mujer muy luchadora que le he tocado sacar adelante a sus  hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y varios artículos que estén de moda, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale todos los días por las mañanas aprovechando que sus hijos menores están en la escuela, deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el cual lo empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos de todo tipo en especial ropa de playa que es lo que más vende en esta época. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le da para vivir. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "María Del Carmen" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton. This area is famous for the Panama hat, it's fresh climate and the many tourist attractions located here. 

Mirian lives here. Her husband passed away several years ago but from this relationship she has 4 children aged 8, 16, 18 and 21 years old. The youngest study at Primary and Secondary school. They live in her mother's house.

Mirian is a fighter who has to work to get her children ahead so she is in business. She sells clothing of all types, shoes and other fashionable items. She sells door-to-door taking advantage of the younger children being at school. She sells on credit and she collects every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 4 years. She started the business with one of the loans she received. 

This loan is to purchase clothing and shoes of all types, but especially beachwear which sells well at this time of year. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception. She likes it as she started the business which allows her to earn her living with a loan. Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий уже пользовался финансовой помощью от КИВА. За счет вложенных средств его бизнес вырос на 1 000 гривен. Торговля потом пошла на спад и Виталию пришлось поехать заграницу, чтобы немного заработать и поддержать бизнес.
В этот раз Виталий обратился за суммой 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести крупную партию женской одеждой под реализацию. Он надеется, что при помощи большего количества одежды на продажу он сможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить семейный доход семьи.
texts.en: Vitalyi has used KIVA's financial assistance in the past. Investment of capital allowed his business to grow by 1,000 hryvnia, but it took a fall, and Vitalyi had to go abroad to find work and support the business. This time Vitaliyi is asking for 21,000 hryvnia to buy a large lot of women's clothing for sale. He hopes that with the help of a large selection of clothing he will attract new customers and improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria represented the epitome of the American Dream when she started her own beauty product line, NBP International. Dedicated to family-centered business strategies, she developed a formula that moisturizes and hydrates skin, leaving a brighter, fuller and more beautiful complexion. 

Due to a phenomenal work ethic and a reputable product, she now has clients in the U.S., Columbia, Honduras and the Dominican Republic. However, with this large customer base, her demand quickly surpassed her supply. 

Maria wishes to increase her inventory and expand her business to match and supply her product to her rapidly increasing customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen,  tiene 71 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de sus hijas y su nieto el cual es la alegría. 
Doña Carmen es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y tener para sus gastos, es por esta razón que desde hace muchos años atrás surtió un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí vende colas, aguas, cervezas, jugos, energizantes, entre otras bebidas, como por su casa pasan muchas personas ella aprovecha para vender sus bebidas, lo cual le deja sus ingresos, es así como ella a pesar de su avanzada edad logra salir adelante y en ocasiones le ayuda a  su hija con los gastos de su pequeño nieto.
Este crédito es para comprar colas, aguas, cervezas, entre otras bebidas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han servido para mantener su negocio. Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The credit group María Del Carmen meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its famous straw hats. The city has a cool climate and many tourist attractions specific to this region.

This is where Señora Carmen lives. She is 71 years old and separated but has seven children over the age of majority from her relationship. One of her daughters and her grandson live with her, which brings her joy.

Doña Carmen is a woman who likes to support herself and cover her own expenses. It's for this reason that she started a little business in her home many years ago. She sells colas, water, beer, juice, and energy drinks, among other drinks. Since many people pass by her house she takes advantage of this to sell her drinks and make an income. This is how she manages to get ahead, despite her advanced age. She sometimes helps her daughter with the expenses for her young grandson.

This loan is to buy colas, water, beer, and other drinks. Carmen has been a member of her credit group since it started and she likes it because the loans have always helped her to maintain her business. Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy colas, water, beer and other drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a website.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is one tough woman. As a female in a male-dominated industry, she had to learn to be. After working in the trucking industry for many years, she decided she wanted to be her own boss. She started her own transportation service and began delivering produce for companies in more than forty states. 

For two years, Blanca’s business has continued to grow. However, she’s run into a problem. The cold weather in the northern part of the United States has caused some of their shipments to run more slowly. Blanca is looking for a loan in order to perform maintenance repairs on her truck. 

Help this impressive woman improve the quality of her service and continue building her business!

loans.use: to perform repairs on her truck.

loans.name: Azeina Concepcion

texts.es:
Azeina, está acompañada y es madre de dos hijos de  10 y 2 años de edad, para apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su hogar desde hace dos años se dedica a vender variedad de productos de primera necesidad, lo hace de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., no representa un negocio con mayor dificultad para ella.
Utilizará el capital que solicita para comprar pan, azúcar, golosinas, bebidas, etc.  , con lo que fortalecerá su negocio con artículos que sus clientes necesitan, su economía será mucho más estable y podrá cumplir con el pago de cuotas de forma puntual y continuara dando el apoyo a su compañero de vida en los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio que le dé mejores ingresos y cumpla con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Azeina is in a relationship and is the mother of two children, ages 10 and 2. In order to help her companion with the household expenses, she sells a variety of basic necessity products. She has been doing this for two years. Azeina works from 7:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. She has not experienced any major difficulties with her business.

Azeina will use the capital from this loan to buy bread, sugar, snack foods, beverages, and other products. This will strengthen her business since she will have items that her customers need. Her financial situation will be more stable, she will be able to complete her payments on time, and she can continue helping her companion with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, snack foods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Marta Inés

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer activa y trabajadora; madre y esposa ejemplar. Llegó a la ciudad en compañía de su familia, provenientes del departamento del Tolima, con el ánimo de dar educación universitaria a sus dos hijos, ya que hacen parte de la comunidad adventista y sólo existe una universidad de este tipo en el país.
Ya radicados en la ciudad, decidieron continuar con el mismo negocio que tenían en el Tolima, un almacén de repuestos y taller de mecánica automotriz, con el que han logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos económicos del hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de repuestos al por mayor (baterías y alternadores), para satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en esta temporada del año, en la que los clientes le invierten dinero a sus vehículos, luego de la jornada de vacaciones; esto aumentará sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Marta, manifiesta que su principal propósito es dar estudio a sus hijos, por ello lucha incansablemente para generar mejores ingresos que le permitan garantizar una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is an active and hardworking woman; a mother and an exemplary spouse. She came to the city with her family from the department of Tolima so that she could give her two children a university education. They are part of the Adventist community and there is only one university of this type in the country.

Once they were settled in the city, they decided to continue with the same business that they had in Tolima - a spare parts business and auto mechanic shop. With this business they managed to generate sufficient income to pay for their household expenses and their children's education.

Marta will invest the loan that she is requesting into the wholesale purchase of spare parts (batteries and alternators). This will allow her to meet demand, which increases during this time of year as customers invest money in their vehicles after the holiday season. This loan will help her to increase her sales and the profits she earns for her work.

Marta's main goal is to provide an education for her children. For this reason she works tirelessly to generate more earnings in order to guarantee economic stability and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts wholesale (batteries and alternators)

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван с семьей — женой и двумя детьми — живет в Виноградово. Он работает маляром на местной швейной фабрике. Иван работает там уже более 11 лет. 
Иван хочет использовать сумму в 9 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в двух комнатах, а именно демонтировать старый пол, залить стяжку, настелить ламинат в обоих комнатах.
texts.en: Ivan and his family - his wife and two daughters - live in Vinogradovo. He works as a painter in a local clothing factory. He has been working there for over 11 years. Ivan wants to spend 9000 hryvnia renovating two rooms, specifically he wants to tear up the old floor, pour concrete, and put down laminate in both rooms.

loans.use: to remodel two rooms in his house

loans.name: Safarmahmad

texts.ru: Сафармахмад житель райна Чилинкул, расположенный на южной части Таджикистана. Чилинкул непохож на другие места Таджикистана. Он отличается своим климатом и неповторимой природой, благотворно влияющий на сельскохозяйственные деятельности. 44 летний Сафармахмад пользуясь благоприятным климатом родного района, хочет начать деятельность животноводства. Но чтобы начать новый бизнес ему потребуется финансирование. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить телят. Он собирается разводить скотов в коровнике. Сафармахмад уверен в себе и считает, что его бизнес получит успех. Помогите ему.
texts.en: Safarmahmad lives in the Jilikul district, situated in southern Tajikistan. Jilikul is unlike other regions of Tajikistan, in that its climate and unique environment are conducive to agriculture. Forty-four year old Safarmahmad, taking advantage of the favorable climate of his native area, wants to start raising animals. However, he needs financing to start a new business. He is asking for a loan to buy calves. He plans to raise the livestock in a barn. Safarmahmad is sure of himself and that his business will be successful. Help him.

loans.use: To buy calves and begin a new business in animal husbandry

loans.name: Sunaym

texts.ru: Сунайм 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Сунайм - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сунайм занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сунайм, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 1,56 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивает овощи и клевер, также на территории дома установлен парник, Сунайм сеет семена помидоров, ранних огурцов и капусты для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сунайм обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сунайм планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Sunaym is 51 years old, married, and has six children with her spouse. Sunaym has a high school education and earns the family's primary source of income by farming and raising livestock, which she started 29 years ago with the purchase of 1,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work she now owns three milk cows and a 1.56 acre plot of land where she grows vegetables and clover each year. She also has a greenhouse on her property where she plants tomatoes, early cucumbers and cabbage for family use and sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Sunaym came to Bai Tushum for a loan to buy cows to expand her herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further growing her livestock herd, and she also plans to save money for construction of an unfinished building.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Gulaym

texts.ru: Гуляйм 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гуляйм - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гуляйм занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гуляйм, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 4 овцы, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 1,20 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивает овощи, такие как: помидоры, огурцы, болгарский перец, капусту для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гуляйм обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку cемян помидоров, капусты, огурцов и болгарского перца. Доходы от кредита Гуляйм планирует вложить в дальнейшее дальнейшее расширение полеводства, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en: Gulaym is 40 years old, married, and has four children with her spouse.
