She has a high school education, and earns the primary source of income for her family by farming and raising livestock, which she began 20 years ago with the purchase of 5,000 som (KGS) worth of stock. Thanks to her tireless work Gulaym currently owns a milk cow, four sheep, and a plot of land of around 1.20 hectares where she grows vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, and cabbage each year for family use and sale. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). Gulaym came to Bai Tushum with the goal of further developing her business. She is asking for a loan to buy tomato, cabbage, cucumber, and bell pepper seed. She plans to invest earnings from used of the loan into further expanding her farming activities, and she also plans to save for construction of an unfinished house.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, tomato, bell pepper, and cabbage seeds

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam esta casada tiene dos hijos y vive en alquiler en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de mani blanco y mani tostado molido.

El credito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas mercaderia (mani, azucar, bolsas) y no perder clientela ya que ella vende en la calle y es muy conocida. La calidad de su producto es excelente y la demanda por emismo ha mejorado notablemente.
 
El sueño de Miriam es poder comprarse su casita y darle un mjor nivel de vida a sus hijos. Esta es la sexta vez que su credito se canaliza a traves de Kiva.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has two children. She lives in rental property in the Pasankeri neighborhood in the city of La Paz and sells roasted peanuts for a living. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy merchandise (peanuts, sugar and bags) so she does not lose her clientele.  She works as a street vendor and is very well known.  The quality of her products is excellent and the demand for them has improved considerably.

Miriam's dream is to be able to purchase a house and give her children a better lifestyle.  This is her sixth Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, sugar and bags to continue with her roasted peanut business.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and her five children in Gaza, four of whom attend primary school.  They live in a rented house and her dream is to build a house of her own.  

She has been selling clothes since 2012 in many shops as an employee, but now Hiba has decided to open her own shop.  She wants to sell clothes for kids and women.  She works hard to support her husband in providing good living conditions for her children.

Hiba is asking Ryada for this startup loan to buy shelves, an electric generator, and stock to sell.  This will help start her business.  Her dream is to improve her business, and she desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future.  She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business through this loan.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects.  To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success.  The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise.  Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy shelves, an electric generator, and stock to sell which will help start her business.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is 46 years old.  He lives in Ramallah with his wife and three children. He sells various kinds of foodstuff such as rice, flour, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it three years ago.

Basem is requesting a loan to purchase a display box and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  His dream is to expand his business, and desires to use part of the profits for his children’s education in the future.  

Basem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display box and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock.

loans.name: Cristian Javier

texts.es:
Él es Cristian Javier un joven al cual le gusta salir a delante ya que desde pequeño aprendió a que la vida no es fácil. 
Está creando el proyecto de vida el cual es empezar los estudios de administración de empresas y así convertirse en un gran profesional,  ya que el gran sueño es administrar la propia empresa. Con  ayuda de los padres y el instituto, claro que no es muy fácil para él ya que no se encuentra en una situación económica favorable. Pero esto para él no es un obstáculo ya que siguiendo el ejemplo de los padres de salir a delante y ser una persona de bien, así poder lograr el proyecto con éxito. 
Es un joven con buena presentación, encantador le gusta trabajar en equipo tiene una actitud muy positiva  para así mismo poder aprender cosas  nuevas día a día, habilidad para enfrentar situaciones de desafío y superación. 
Académicamente  en el bachiller  fue un excelente estudiante incluyendo menciones de honor, responsable ya que fue muy emprendedor, carismático, colaborador.
Los propósitos que se proponía, los lograba con mucha dedicación,  responsabilidad y puntualidad. Es muy buen compañero, trabaja muy bien en equipo. Esta dispuesto a superar los obstáculos o reglas que se le pongan para así poder tener el proyecto tal y como siempre lo ha querido un joven profesional, el beneficio de kiva le sería de gran ayuda ya que el pago de las mensualidades quedaría un poco mas cómodas y el dinero que ahorra lo podría invertir en transporte, fotocopias y otros gastos que le pueda generar el estudio.
texts.en:
Cristian Javier is a young man who likes to get ahead in life because he learned very young that life is not easy.  He has a life project and has begun studying business administration to become a good professional, since his goal is to manage his own company.  This is with the help of his parents and the institute, of course, because he is not in a good financial situation.  This is not an obstacle for him, though, and following in his parents' footsteps he is striving to become a good person and be successful.

He is a nice looking, charming young man who enjoys team work.  He has a very positive attitude toward learning new things every day which allows him to face challenging situations in order to get ahead.

He was an excellent student and on the honor roll in high school and has always been a responsible, very enterprising, charismatic and cooperative person.

He achieved his goals with much dedication, responsibility and promptness.  He is a good class mate and a team worker.  He is willing to overcome all the obstacles that get in his way in order to become the young professional he has always wanted to be.  The support from Kiva will be very helpful in making payment of monthly tuition easier.  He can use the money he saves for transportation, photocopies and other general education expenses.

loans.use: To pay semester tuition.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Sigue dedicada a la elaboracion de dulces de zaumerio, (que se usan para rituales que sirven para bendecir las casas y los negocios de las personas. esta es una costumbre milenaria que viene de las creencias en la madre tierra) los cuales los comercializa en gran porcentaje en los pueblos.

El credito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas insumos ya que este negocio le genera buenos ingresos y quiere mantener su clientela. Los dulces de sahumerio no son comestibles; sirven para la combustion en fogatas ceremoniales.


El sueño de eva es poder tenere un taller y poder contratar gente y qe se amplie su negocio, y en el futuro darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. Esta es la sexta vez que su solicitud de credito se canaliza a traves de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eva lives in her own home with her husband and children in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz.  Eva's job is making incense candies (used in Bolivian rituals for blessing people's homes and businesses, a millennial tradition in Bolivia which comes from faith in Mother Earth).   The candies are mainly sold in villages.

She needs a loan to buy supplies to continue with her business, which gives her a good income; and keep her customers. For the record, the candies are not edible. They serve as combustion in ceremonial bonfires.

Eva's dream is to have her own workshop and hire employees to expand her business so she can give her children a better future.  This is her sixth Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make incense candies for religious ceremonies.

loans.name: Melissa Alejandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Melisa es una persona muy trabadora y muy responsable con sus compromisos, vive solo con su madre en la colonia el reparto donde tienen 13 años de habitar. Es muy conocida en su colonia y en la ciudad de Santa Cruz ya que hace un año atrás ejerció su profesión como profesora en la escuela John f. Kennedy y se ha caracterizado por ser una joven muy dinámica y luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante con sus propios esfuerzo ya que desde muy jovencita se a dedicado a trabajar arduamente para lograr todos sus sueños y propósitos. 
Melisa es propietaria de una pulpería que tiene instalada en su casa de habitación desde hace un año. Su pulpería está ubicada en una zona de mucho beneficio ya que la colonia queda un poco retirada del centro y las personas tienen que movilizarse mientras que su pulpería les facilita sus compras a los vecinos  de su colonia.
Melisa el préstamo lo necesita para huevos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, manteca, refrescos, galletas, café, etc. ha decidido implementar lo que es una venta de verduras gracias a que sus clientes  han aumentado y así satisfacer a su clientela y a la vez poder obtener muchas más ganancias.
Melisa espera que con este préstamo que su negocio pueda abastecer a muchas más personas de su comunidad y seguirles brindando un servicio de calidad. De esta manera le genere más ganancias para así seguir creciendo ya que sus sueños es tener una  pulpería fuerte en su colonia.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Enero 2014
texts.en:
Melissa is a hard worker and very responsible in her commitments.  She lives with her mother in the community called El Reparto where she has lived for 13 years.  She is well-known in her community and in the city of Santa Cruz because she was a teacher there at the John F. Kennedy School last year.  She is known as being very dynamic and determined, knowing how to get ahead through her own efforts.  From a very young age she has worked hard to meet the goals she set for herself.

Melissa owns a grocery store that she established in her house and has been running for a year.  Her store is located in a very beneficial area for the community which is a bit far from the center of town, so people are on the go and her store makes it easier for the neighbors to do their shopping in the area.

Melissa is in need of a loan to buy eggs, sugar, rice, beans, bread, shortening, soft drinks, cookies, coffee, etc.  She has decided to start selling vegetables to satisfy her customers and increase her earnings.  She hopes that through this loan she will be able to sell to more people in the community and continue giving them quality customer service.  This will increase her earnings so she can continue to grow her business and have the solid community store she always dreamed of.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - January, 2014

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, rice, beans, bread, shortening, soft drinks, cookies, coffee, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Miriam Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Miriam a sus 46 años de edad sueña con poder tener su vivienda bien construida y darle a sus hijos las  mejores condicieones, ella labora para un restaurante privado como cocinera, el credito lo esta solicitando para compra cemento, arena, piedrin, bloques ya que construira un anexo en su vivienda para ontener mayor espacio. Agradece la confianza y apoyo que ha recibido de Afodenic en conjunto a Kiva.
texts.en:
Miriam, age 46, dreams of being able to have a well-built house and of giving her children the best conditions.  She works for a private restaurant as a cook.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy cement, sand, gravel, and cement blocks.  She will build an addition to her house in order to have more space.  

She is grateful for the trust and support she has received from AFODENIC and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for renovating her farm.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes mayor de edad, soltera, originaría de uno de los  municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el ron y el azúcar al igual que el comercio. Mercedes se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honrada ,responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal , ella es una pequeña empresaria propietaria de una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo diario que se utilizan en el hogar como: granos básicos, jabones, detergentes, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros, Cuenta con clientes fijos; sus ventas las realiza en camiones repartidores y en el mercado de este municipio, Mercedes desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su mini pulpería en la compra de productos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, café, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a single adult and is from one of the communities in Chinandega It is located in the western part of the country where rum and sugar predominate, together with commerce. Mercedes is a hard-working, honest and responsible person with a strong desire to improve her personal situation. She is a small entrepreneur and owns a grocery store where she sells consumable items that are used every day in the home such as dry grains, soaps, detergents, snack foods, soft drinks, etc. She has regular customers and sells from delivery trucks and in the local market.

She opens the doors to her business very early to provide the best service to her customers.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in her mini grocery store by buying basic products such as rice, sugar, beans, coffee, etc.

loans.use: to buy consumer products such as rice, beans, oil, frozen foods, and snacks, among others.

loans.name: Johany Evgeling

texts.es: La señora Johany, casada madre de un hijo en edad escolar, junto a su esposo se han propuesto mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella tiene un pequeño taller de Costura ubicado en su casa, ademas labora para una empresa privada la cual le permite trabajar en su casa, su esposo la apoya economicamente ya que labora para una empresa. el credito lo solicita para comprar Telas, Hilo, Elasticos, Accesorios varias ya que realizara uniformes y otros pedidos que le han llegado, Agradece el apoyo que se la ha brindado al otorgarle este credito.
texts.en:
Johany is married and the mother of a school-age child.  Together with her husband they have tried to improve their living conditions.  She has a small sewing shop in her house, and she also works for a private company that allows her to work from her home. Her husband provides financial support by working for a company.  

She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, and various other sewing notions for making uniforms and for other orders she has received.  She appreciates the support she is receiving with this loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Nestor Gonzalo

texts.es:
Nestor es un hombre de 60 años de edad, nació en Latacunga, de la provincia de Cotopaxi vive en una casa, herencia de sus padres, desde hace algún tiempo atrás. Terminó sus estudios primarios con mucha dedicación y sacrificio, Nestror tuvo un espíritu luchador y continuo estudiando un poco más hasta cursar algunos años en estudios superiores, trabajaba y estudiaba al mismo tiempo lo que para el resultaba muy complicado y lamentablemente no llego a culminarlos. Tuvo que conseguir un trabajo que le ayudara a salir adelante día tras día. Viene de una familia muy humilde y luchadora en donde sobresalen los valores. 
Actualmente se dedica a vender ropa en el mercado mayorista de Latacunga Pujili y Saquisili, desde muy temprano sale de su muy humilde hogar y pasa más de 8 horas diarias trabajando, aparte de esto hace unas pequeñas carreras que le ayudan un poco más en sus ingresos considerando su avanzada edad Nestor ha demostrado un ejemplo de lucha continua. Lamentablemente Nestor tuvo un grave accidente y resultado de este, le tuvieron que amputar su pierna, es por esta razón en principal que el vio en nosotros una oportunidad para mejorar sus días y solicitó el prestamo para la compra de una prótesis y para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. La vida también el negó una compañera a su lado y Nestor es una persona solitaria que aún no pierde la esperanza de tener a su lado a una gran mujer que al amanecer le regale una bella sonrisa.
Nestor hace llegar un cordial y efusivo agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Nestor is 60 years old and was born in Latacunga, which is in Cotopaxi Province. He lives in a house that he inherited from his parents some time ago. Nestor finished his primary education with great dedication and sacrifice. With a determined spirit, Nestor continued his studies a little bit at a time until he was able to finish a few years of his higher education. Working and studying at the same time was very complicated, so unfortunately, he was not able to finish his degree. Nestor secured a job in order to get by each day. He comes from a humble and industrious family that emphasizes outstanding values.

Nestor currently sells clothes at the wholesale markets in Latacunga, Pujili, and Saquisili. He leaves very early from his modest home and spends more than eight hours a day at his job. In addition, he takes on a few small jobs to earn a little more income. Considering that he is an older adult, Nestor has demonstrated that he is an example of continued determination.

Unfortunately, Nestor experienced a serious accident that resulted in the amputation of his leg. For this reason, he saw an opportunity to improve his future by requesting a loan. He will buy a prosthetic and also make improvements to his home. Life also denied him of having a companion alongside him. Despite being alone, Nestor has not lost hope of finding a nice woman that he can wake up with in the morning and who can give him a beautiful smile.

Nestor expresses his warm and affectionate thanks to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making it possible for him to grow in his work and his personal life. The money will help him fulfill one of his greatest wishes.

loans.use: to buy a prosthetic and pay for improvements to his home.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: Noel de 48 años, es originario de la Ciudad de Somotillo, casado, maestro, con tres hijos, es una persona honrada, honesta, responsable en su trabajo y con su familia, se desempeña como maestro de Educación Secundaria en El Instituto Autónomo de Somotillo, solicito a Ceprodel Somotillo un crédito para el pagado de matricula y aranceles del primer semestre de la Universidad de su hijo, que esta iniciando el segundo año de Ingeniería, su sueño siempre ha sido que sus hijos sean profesionales y da gracias a Dios y a Ceprodel que siempre le han brindado el apoyo económico para salir adelante y preparar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noel is 48 years old and is from the town of Somotillo. He is married and has three children. He is a teacher and is known as an honorable, honest, responsible person both at work and as a family man. He is a secondary school teacher at the Instituto Autónomo in Somotillo.

Noel is seeking a loan from Ceprodel Somotillo to pay the first semester registration and tuition fees at the University for his son who is beginning his second year of engineering.

His dream has always been to see his children get professional qualifications. He gives thanks to God and to Ceprodel who have always provided him with financial help to get ahead and support his children.

loans.use: pay the first semester registration and tuition fees at the University

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: El Señor Danilo José de 46 años, es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega, residente en la Ciudad de Somotillo, caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador dedicado a su familia y a su profesión, amante a la labor que realiza, ha sabido manejar su condición de vida, casado,  con 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta y fabricación de medicina natural, cuenta con un negocio propio. Actualmente se presento a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, miel de abeja, envases, frascos, capsulas, esencias, etiquetas, para la fabricación de sus productos.  Debido a la demanda que presentan sus productos ha logrado aperturas otra farmacia naturista mejorando de esta manera sus ingresos e incrementando su capital.
texts.en:
Danilo José, 46, is originally from the city of Chinandega, resident of the city of Somotillo. He is characterized by being a good worker dedicated to his family and his profession; he loves his labor. He has been known to manage his life condition. He is married with 2 children. He makes his living selling and making natural medicine; he has his own business. Presently, he came to Ceprodel with the goal of applying for a loan for the purchase of prime materials: honey, capsules, essences, jars and labels for the production of his products.

Given the demand that his products present, he has achieved opening another natural pharmacy. In this manner, he has managed his income and increased his capital.

loans.use: to buy honey, capsules, essences, jars and labels.

loans.name: Osiris

texts.en:
Osiris, an associate minister for a local Baptist church, is determined to make a change in his community. He started his own media production company, Osirian Entertainment, two years ago in order to shine a positive light on the African American and Latino communities. He aims to produce quality films for young African American and Latino audience. He has written over 21 screenplays and has surrounded himself with great minds, including executives from Ebony and Jet Magazine. 

Osiris has the ideas, the inspiration and the network to help get his business off the ground. All he needs now is the equipment to produce his films. With this loan, Osiris will purchase a camera and lights to produce his films. Help Osiris create his positive-message films and fulfill his dream of providing a positive influence on his community!

loans.use: to purchase a camera and lights

loans.name: Luciano Wladimir

texts.es:
Luciano Wladimir tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Luciano Wladimir se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, ranger, insecticidas, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas mensualmente. Con la ayuda del crédito cambiaria en una forma positiva porque con el credito tendrá más ingresos.

El sueño es tener una vida productiva para así tener un negocio fiable y productivo. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar con la familia.
texts.en:
Luciano Wladimir is 23 years old and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Luciano is a member of the July 30th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm workers.

Luciano Wladimir is a farmer who grows rice and corn. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), insecticides, and liquid weed killer. His purchases and the sale of his products are conducted in the city of Ventanas on a monthly basis. The loan will be a great help in a positive way because he will be able to generate more income. His dream is to have a productive life, as well as a reliable and productive business.

In his free time, Luciano Wladimir enjoys being with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita’s husband used to travel from their native France to the United States to sell beauty products. Roselita, a teacher at the time, decided to follow and the two moved to Florida almost three years ago. They opened up Paris Beauty Store together. 

Roselita quickly established a network of distributors and wholesale customers around the world. However, like many business owners, she and her husband have found it difficult to support their family while still investing funds back into the business to expand. With this loan, they will be able to buy additional French products. They expect the sales from these new products to triple the profit and help them to open additional locations. 

Help this energetic entrepreneur expand her business, provide for her family and create jobs! 

Visit Paris Beauty Store’s website at www.parisbeauty.net.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a die cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer and software

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nakaryd

texts.en:
Nakaryd is a classic example of an entrepreneur who realizes that the key to success is to never give up. Originally from Venezuela, Nakaryd was soaring high in her business ventures in the cheese and fitness industry when one day, back in 2004, she was forced to leave her house and she lost everything she had. It was during this unrest in her hometown that she decided to come to the United States as a political refugee to start a new life.

Despite having lost everything, Nakaryd knew that her entrepreneurial spirit was the greatest asset she had. Eager to live the American dream and wanting to set a good example for her family as an independent woman, she decided to reignite her passion in dance and turn it into a business.

Nakaryd is now a certified instructor of Zumba, a form of workout that combines Latin and international music with fun and effective exercises that is gaining popularity across the country. She wants to start a business offering Zumba lessons on a one-to-one basis in her backyard. “I want to motivate people to feel happy about themselves and to help build their self-esteem, and dance is an excellent therapy for that!” she says with a wide smile on her face. 

She hopes to use this loan as start-up capital to buy sound equipment and to market her business so she can finally chase her vision of creating a cultural center, where each day she can contribute to make the magic transformation in all aspects of her clients’ lives through dance. 

Contribute to Nakaryd’s loan and help her kick start her Zumba and fitness business to get her backyard thumping and rocking!

loans.use: to buy sound equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is the founder of a company that specializes in cleaning the exhaust systems of restaurants and other establishments. She started her business in May 2013 after being in the restaurant industry for over 40 years.

Genevieve is proud of how quickly her business has grown. Her clients include universities, the Miami Zoo, restaurants such as Olive Garden, and other residential projects. The company has been in operation for almost a year and the goal is to become the largest minority-owned exhaust service provider in South Florida. However, in order to expand, Genevieve needs to provide advanced training for her technicians along with better equipment for optimal customer service. 

Help Genevieve grow her business!

loans.use: to purchase better exhaust cleaning equipment and train her employees

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a proud businessman and immigrant from the Dominican Republic. He owns and operates an auto shop in New Jersey. Even though he specializes in car electronics, he covers everything from engines and transmissions to A/C and heater repair.  Even though his Newark shop is located far away from the Jersey Shore, Eduardo still suffered significant damage from Superstorm Sandy. After the storm hit in October 2012, he had to close down completely for two weeks. For months afterwards, demand for his services dropped off, as the surrounding community was still recovering from the storm’s damages. 

 However, the second half of 2013 looked stronger for Eduardo and he is excited for a comeback year in 2014.  As a first-time microloan borrower, he will use this loan to purchase a forklift and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a forklift and renovate his auto shop.

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
Ella es una muchacha de tal solo 18 años de edad llamada Andrea Estefanía de bogota, ella estudia en el instituto de campo alto en el área de la salud cosmetología y estética corporal, ya que ella desde que estudiaba en el bachillerato siempre vivía interesa en esta carrera y ahora que la está ejerciendo está muy contenta y orgullosa de todo lo que ha aprendido ya que esto era lo que le agradaba desde siempre. 
Ha aprendido a realizar procedimientos estéticos para la mejora  y el embellecimiento de la gente, ya que esto también ayuda mucho en la salud de las personas.
Por eso no se arrepiente de haber escogido esta carrera tan agradecida y valiosa para todas las esteticistas.
Por lo tanto mientras pueda seguirá ejerciendo la carrera sobre todo lo que tenga que ver con el área de la salud, diplomados, seminarios y talleres por que el fin de ella es ser una gran esteticista y tener el propio spa para poderle brindar trabajo a las demás esteticistas y ser muy reconocida en el mundo, para realizar excelentes procedimientos estéticos con profesionalismo y la mejor calidad. 
Por eso da gracias a la institución de campo alto por brindarle la oportunidad de estudio y tenerla como alumna y poner en alto el nombre de campo alto.
texts.en:
She is a young woman, 18 years of age, named Andrea Estefania from Bogotá, and she studies at the institute Campoalto in the field of wellness, cosmetology, and body esthetics. Ever since studying in high school she always had an interest in this career and now that she is practicing it she is very content and proud of everything she has learned since this is what she has always enjoyed.

She has learned to perform esthetic procedures for peoples' wellness and beautification, since this also helps in their overall health.

This is why she does not regret choosing this career, which is so appreciated and valuable for all the estheticians. 

Therefore, while she can, she will continue practicing this career on top of everything else having to do with the field of health, classes, seminars, and workshops because her goal is to be a great esthetician and have her own spa so she can offer work to other estheticians and be very recognized in the world for performing excellent esthetic procedures with professionalism and the highest quality. 

That is why she is thankful to the institution Campoalto for offering her the opportunity to study and have her as a student and to honor the name of Campoalto.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 40-year-old married, rural housewife. She has two children (one son and one daughter).  Both of her children are students. One is in college and the other is in grade 12.  Anjali studied up to grade 7, whereas her husband Parimol attended school up to grade 9.  They are from the village of Bengakandi in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband works as a laborer on a daily wages basis.

Anjali's daughter Somita is in grade 12. She is a smart girl who is very serious about her studies and meritorious too.  She seeks educational help, which her parents cannot afford due to their poor financial condition. Every year, the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books.

Now Anjali is requesting a loan from BJS to pay for her child's school fees, tuition fees and other study expenses.  With this loan, now she can accommodate all these expenses. Anjali aims to see her children get high grades.

She and her daughter (in the picture) are very much thankful to Kiva and its partner BJS for the loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a married housewife. She lives with her husband and two school-going children (one son and one daughter). They are in grade 6 and grade 2, respectively.  Swapna is a 32-year-old illiterate woman who can sign only her name. Her husband Ganesh is also illiterate. They live in the small village of Bagnan in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Swapna's husband is engaged in agricultural activities. He is the only earning member in the family.  But his small income can hardly cover the family necessities along with their children's educational expenses.

Swapna, though illiterate, always wants to give a proper education to her children.  Her son Sanjib is a student in grade 6.  He is a very studious boy who is always busy with his studies. He is striving to give his best to his studies.  But he needs help from a private tutor, which his parents are unable to give.

Thus, Swapna has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase necessary educational supplies (books, pens, pencils, notebooks etc.) and to pay school fees so that her son will not face any difficulties in his study.

Swapna and her son Sanjib (in the photo)  are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies and pay school and tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Subhasini

texts.en:
Subhasini is a very courageous woman.  Being an illiterate woman of 27 years, she is striving to provide an education to her children.  She is married to Nakul and is a housewife. Her husband attended school up to grade 8.  But they are determined to give their children a higher education. They have three children (1 son and 2 daughters).  All are students. They are in grade 9, 6 and 3, respectively.  They live in the small village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Subhasini's husband is a cycle-van puller by profession.  His income is too low to afford the educational expenses of his three children.

Their son Bijoy is in grade 9 and stands first in every class.  He has been carrying on his studies without any private tutor's help.  But now he needs help from a private tutor.

Subhasini has heard that Kiva's partner BJS gives education loans and she has applied for a loan.  She plans to use the loan to purchase the necessary supplies such as books, notebooks, pens, pencils etc. and to pay school and tuition fees for her son's smooth education.

She and her son (in the picture) give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva to help them reach their goal.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies for her son

loans.name: Mitali

texts.en:
Mitali is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a housewife and blessed with one daughter who is a student in grade 7. Her husband Sanjoy, 36 years old, is engaged in cultivation. Both Mitali and her husband have an education up to grade 7.  They live in the small village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own house.

Mitali's husband is associated with the cultivation of vegetables. They have a small piece of land where he grows different vegetables and sells the agricultural products in the local market. He is the only earning member in the family.  But his earnings are not sufficient to give a decent lifestyle to the family. Now they have decided to cultivate mustard seeds on their farmland.  As mustard oil is made from mustard seeds and is used widely in cooking in West Bengal, they think it would be a profitable business for them.

Due to the lack of money, she applied for a loan from BJS.  She plans to purchase mustard seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

She wants to secure her daughter's career with good profits from this business. She is very happy to become a member of BJS and thankful to Kiva for funding her loan, as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: To purchase mustard seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tiffanny Michell

texts.es: Esta historia tiene como motivo pedirles una ayuda educativa para tiffanny michell una niña que tiene muchas ganas de estudiar de progresar y salir adelante, ella acaba de entrar al instituto campo alto a estudiar auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos, carece de recursos económicos para una universidad, por eso se inscribió en este instituto, pues le parece que es muy bueno y ella puede proyectarse y tener un buen nivel académico, pero los recursos son un poco limitados, por eso recurre a el convenio con kiva, con la esperanza de poder acceder al beneficio del convenio, pues los sueños son convertirse en una excelente auxiliar de farmacia y conseguir un buen empleo.
texts.en: This is a request for educational assistance for Tiffanny Michell, a young woman who has a desire to study, make progress, and get ahead.  She has just enrolled in Campo Alto to study pharmaceutical services.  She lacks the financial resources to pay for her university studies, which is why she enrolled in this institution, because she thinks it is very good and that she can improve herself and get a good education.  She is requesting a loan from Kiva because her finances are limited.  She is hoping to get a Kiva loan because she dreams of becoming an excellent pharmacy assistant and getting a good job.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene, es una señora que trabaja en un kinder como conserje y su esposo es guarda de seguridad, ambos unen esfuerzos  para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Este crédito lo solicita para comprar materiales de construcción como piedras cantera, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, para continuar con la obra de anexo en la parte de enfrente de su casa, la que dio inicio con una primer etapa de crédito, ya que su casita es muy pequeña y desea más espacio  en el hogar, para que sus nietos jueguen.
texts.en:
Marlene works in a kindergarten as a cleaner and her husband works as a security guard. The both work together to improve the conditions of their home as their children are adults and live independently. 
The loan that she is requesting is to buy construction materials such as quarry stones, cement, steel, zinc and beams to continue with the expansion work to the front part of their house. This expansion started with a first round of credit as their house is very small and they want more space in their home so that their grandchildren have more room to play.

loans.use: to buy quarry stone, cement, steel, zinc and beams.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a rural woman.  She is only 31 years old, is married to Gautam, and is a housewife. She studied up to grade 9. She has two school-going sons. They are in grade 8 and grade 5 respectively. Asima lives with her husband and sons in their own house in a small village, Tekatuli, in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a smart and industrious woman. She always works hard for the well-being of her children.

Asima's husband is associated with a hotel business. The labourers and truck drivers are his main customers. As he is unable to invest more in their business, the income is not sufficient to afford the educational expenses of their sons, after covering the family needs.

Asima always wants to give proper education to her sons. One of her sons, Suvo, is now in grade 5. He scored good marks in the last annual examination and is very much serious about his study. If he could get private tuition, he could do much better. All the teachers expect his outstanding result in the final examination.

Asima seeks the loan to support her son's education, so that he does not face any hindrance in his education. She plans to use the loan to purchase different educational equipment, such as books, notebooks, pens, pencils, a uniform, geometry box, etc., and pay the school fees and tuition fees for her son.

Asima and her son, Suvo (in the picture), are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees and purchase necessary educational equipment.

loans.name: Ashalata

texts.en:
Ashalata is a 50-year-old married woman. She is illiterate and from a remote village, Khagrabari, in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband, Nitai, is 56 years old and is also illiterate. Together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter). Both are students. Their son is in grade 10, and their daughter is in college. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made).

Ashalata's husband is engaged with a small business. His income is too low to give the family a decent lifestyle. In order to generate more income, Ashalata is also engaged in a business of making incense sticks. Yet, they are unable to cover all the necessities of the family. So, it has become a problem for them to afford their children's educational expenses.

Their son, Uttam, is now studying in grade 10. He is very much serious about his studies. In this year, he will appear for his Madhyamik Exam (State Board Examination).  But, he needs the help of a private tutor for having a better result.

Ashalata learned about BJS (Kiva's partner) and applied for a loan for buying study materials, such as books, pens, pencils, etc., and also to pay the school fees and tuition fees for her son. She tries heart and soul so that she can give an interrupted education to her children.

Ashalata and her son Uttam (in the picture) are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give their hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay tuition fees and school fees for her son.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  su  hijo y esposa. Su negocio es el servicio de molino desde hace 2 años.
Don Roberto tiene su esto negocio en su casa de habitación y debido a que es un lugar muy céntrico tiene muchos clientes. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para brindarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino. 
Don Roberto espera que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera y así aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
 Don Roberto desea en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio ya sea comprando otro molino,   con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que surja y de esta forma darse una mejor calidad de vida


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
Roberto is a very hardworking and responsible person. He lives in a community in southern Honduras with his wife and son. He has earned a living by providing milling services for 2 years now. Roberto runs this business from his home, and due to a central location, he has many customers. 

He needs the loan in order to buy tools to perform maintenance on the mill. Roberto hopes that his business will improve and increase his income, which will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life. In the short term, Roberto hopes to grow his business, maybe by buying another mill, and thus continue supporting his family and give them a good quality of life even if economic hardships arise.

Choluteca, Honduras, January 2014.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mill.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 36.  She is a rural housewife from the village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Ganesh who is 40 years old. They have two sons. They live in their own house. Both Kalpana and Ganesh are uneducated and can sign only their names.  But their sons are students in college.

Kalpana's husband is a farmer by profession.  He has ancestral land where he grows different vegetables in different seasons.  Both Kalpana and her husband give their hard toil to grow more vegetables to get more income.  Yet, their earnings are hardly sufficient to provide all the needs of the family.  In order to generate additional income, they have decided to start a milk supply and milk products business.

Kalpana has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  She plans to make milk products such as butter, paneer, and curd from the milk and will sell the products door to door in her locality.  As the products are in great demand, they hope the business will be a lucrative one and help them to generate additional income.

This additional income will help her to get over the financial hurdles and help to give her sons a better education to become established in life. In the future, her dream is to have her own herd of cattle with a greater production capacity to secure their future life.

She is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rakhimakhon

texts.ru: Рахимахон 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Рахимахон - средне-специальное образование, работает в местной больнице, в качестве лаборантки. Муж-пенсионер, в свое время служил в Афганистане и получает пенсию как -воин-афганец. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахимахон занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахимахон, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, которых она ежедневно доит и реализует поставщикам молока, имеет очень хороший доход, также имеется 1,30 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, перец, помидоры, огурцы, лук для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахимахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку семян овощей для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Рахимахон планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Rakhimakhon is 50 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. Rakhimakhon has finished junior college. She works in a local hospital as a lab assistant. Her husband is retired. He has served in the military in Afghanistan and is receiving a pension as an Afghanistan veteran. As a main source of income for her family, Rakhimakhon grows produce and raises livestock, having launched this business 20 years ago with the starting capital of 6,000 KGS. Thanks to Rakhimakhon's hard work,   her farm now includes three dairy cows she milks every day, selling milk to wholesalers and deriving a very good income from it. She also has a land plot of 1.3 ha [about 3 acres], where she  plants potatoes, peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions ever year, for her own family needs as well as for sale. Her monthly income is 16,000 KGS. in order to develop her farm further, Rakhimkahon has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan to buy vegetable seeds for the planting season as well as fertilizers. Rakhimkahon plans to use her resulting revenues for a further expansion of livestock. She plans to save money to build a new shed for her farm animals.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 26-year-old housewife who is married to Subol, 29 years old. Both of them completed their primary education. Together, they are raising two children (one son and one daughter).  One of them is in school and the other is below the school-going age.  They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Mona's husband has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells paint for painting houses.  He also works as a worker under a contractor to put paint color on houses. He is the main source of income for the family.  Mona helps her husband in his work after managing her household work. Of late, they are facing financial problems.  They need to invest money to expand their business and increase their profit to overcome the financial hurdles.

Mona has come forward to help her husband.  She heard about Kiva’s partner BJS and has taken a loan for her husband.  She plans to purchase colors for her husband to expand the business. This will help her to generate greater profits and help her to pay school fees and other educational expenses for her children.  The profit from the business will help them to upgrade their poor financial condition. In future, they want to expand their business and start a factory making paint colors of their own.

They are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase house paint to sell

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
La señora Lesli   es una persona responsable, trabajadora  y  honesta, vive  con su esposo  e  hijos en  un barrio  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta    de golosinas en su casa de habitación y también vende de manera ambulante.
Doña Lesli  desde hace mas de 4 años el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de cebollas, chiles, pollo, res, aceite, arroz, lechugas, harina, plátanos, etc. para seguir realizando su negocio. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Lesli  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una tienda de golosinas donde pueda  atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lesli  desea seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad.	


Choluteca, Honduras  –Enero  del   2014
texts.en:
Señora Lesli is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. She lives with her husband and children in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. Her business for more than four years has been the sale of snacks in her house and on the street.

Lesli needs the loan to buy onions, chiles, chicken, beef, oil, rice, lettuce, flour, plantains, etc., to continue doing business. She hopes that with this loan, her sales will increase once she has more product to offer and can better serve her customers.

Lesli hope to meet her needs and improve her and her family's quality of life a little. In a few years, she hopes that her business will continue to grow and become a snack shop where she can better serve her customers. 

Lesli hopes to continue supporting her family and that her children will become respectable people with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras  – January, 2014

loans.use: to purchase onions, chiles, chicken, beef, oil, rice, lettuce, tortillas, plantains, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 27 years old, illiterate and can only sign her name. She lives with her husband Mohon and three children (one son and two daughters) in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).  Her husband is 38 years old, uneducated and a farmer by profession.  Two of their children are going to school and read in grade 9 and grade 10. The third one is below the school-going age.

Jayanti's husband is in agriculture, which he learned from his parents.  He is extensively engaged in cultivating potatoes and beans. He works there all day long and sells his produce in the local market. By doing this agribusiness, he somehow manages his household expenses. As it is not possible for him to maintain all the costs, Jayanti does animal husbandry in order to help her husband. She has one cow and two goats. She wants to expand the business in order to generate more profit to give the family more financial sustenance.

Jayanti applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a milk cow.  She is a very hardworking woman. She plans to sell more milk at a good price. She will also increase her daily income with the help of the milk cow, which will help her to educate her children properly and give a decent lifestyle to her family.

She hopes in the future to purchase more cows with the profit generated from her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña María espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
 Doña María espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  2014
texts.en:
María is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with her children and her husband in a community in the southern part of Honduras. Her business is selling and making tortillas and it is well known in her community and there is much demand for her goods. 
María needs the loan to buy raw materials such as corn, wood, and lime to keep making her tortillas and making income that is very important for her household. 
María hopes that, thanks to the loan, she will have the supplies she needs to keep running her business and so to meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes that her sales increase as this would be reflected in her family's quality of life. 
María hopes that her business keeps growing and becomes the most well known in the community as this would enable her to keep supporting her family and giving them the best opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business

loans.name: Elsa Suyapa

texts.es:
La  joven  Elsa  una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive  y su  hijo en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de Ropa y  achinería  lo cual  hace desde hace más de 10 años.
Doña Elsa tiene su negocio en su casa y dicha actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. El préstamo lo necesita controles, aretes, ganchos, colas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña Elsa espera mejorar la situación  económica de su familia y que  en un corto plazo  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido de su comunidad y seguir  apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero  del   2014
texts.en:
Elsa is an enterprising, honest, responsible, and serious young woman who lives with her son in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business is buying and selling clothes and trinkets and she has been doing this for more than 10 years.
Elsa runs her business from her house and this activity is her main source of income. She will use the loan to buy controls, earrings, necklace clasps, etc. She hopes that the loan will help her sales to increase as she will have more merchandise to offer her customers and to meet their needs. 
Elsa hopes to improve her family's economic situation and hopes for her business to grow in a short time and become consolidated so that it becomes the best known in the community so that she can keep supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - January of 2014

loans.use: to buy controls, earrings, necklaces clasps, etc, for her business

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Xiomara es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos. Tiene 30 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace varios años, como una forma de incrementar los ingresos de su familia. Su meta próxima es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que estos finalicen, y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos escolares tales como: Cuadernos, Lápices, Borradores, Libretas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra diversificar los productos de su pulpería. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y acondicionarla de una mejor manera.
texts.en: Xiomara is a native of the city of Estelí. She is married and has 3 children. She is 30 years old. She is a businesswoman and she runs a stationary store. She began this business some years ago as a way to increase the family's income. Her next goal is to support her children in their studies so that they finish school, and to improve their living conditions. She is requesting this goal to buy school supplies such as: notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other things. She believes that the loan will be a great help as she will be able to diversify her stock in the stationary store. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house and to arrange it in a better way.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as: notebooks, pencils, erasers, and others.

loans.name: Brigith Andrea

texts.es:
En un hogar humilde y hermoso, nació una niña llamada Andrea, la  mama la dejo a los dos meses de nacida con los dos abuelos, ellos cuidaron siempre de ella, mientras que las tías cuidaban de la  hermana, a la edad de 6 años ingreso a la escuela donde estudio la  primaria con un excelente nivel académico y una de las tías  se encargó de Andrea, tomando un excelente cargo como madre aunque, A medida que el tiempo pasó la familia entro en una gran depresión por la muerte de el abuelo ya que él era el que mantenía unida la  familia.

5 años después falleció la tía que se encargaba de la niña y de la hermana,  fue una derrota más para la familia, pero la vida sigue, se aprendió  a levantar  nuevamente   de una pena más. 
Culmina el  bachillerato y comienza a estudiar enfermería con el apoyo de la familia y de un programa llamado kiva, se puede decir que el primer semestre fue algo tan espectacular, ya que aprendió miles de cosas en compañía de las compañeras.

Terminado el  semestre falleció el único tío, pero así termino con buenas notas y gracias a Dios conoció a mucha gente que le ayudaría a crecer como persona. 

Desde pequeña soñó con ser una buena enfermera porque  le encanta ayudar a las personas y seria excelente aprender salvar muchísimas vidas, por eso decidió ser parte de campo alto porque sabe que es una buena institución para empezar a crecer  como persona, también desea tener una gran familia con hijos, tener una moto y una casa propia.

Es muy inteligente, juiciosa y responsable ya que trata de hacer las cosas perfectamente sin ningún error, ya que es una persona muy competitiva.
texts.en:
In a humble and lovely home, there was born a baby girl named Andrea. Her mother left her at two months of age with her grandparents. They took care of her while the aunts took care of her sister. At the age of 6 she started primary school, where she excelled academically. One of the aunts decided to take Andrea in and took care of her like a mother. Eventually, the family entered a period of great sadness due to the death of the grandfather, who was the person who had kept the family unified. 

Five years later, the aunt who took care of Andrea and her sister passed away. This was another difficult time for the family, but life continued and they learned to start again from this setback.

She has finished high school and is starting to study nursing with the support of her family and a program called Kiva. The first semester was wonderful because she learned many, many things in the company of her classmates. At the end of the semester her only uncle passed away, but she finished with good grades. And thanks to God, she met many people that are helping her grow as a person. 

Since the time she was young, she dreamed of being a good nurse because she loves to help people and it would be great to learn how to save lives. So, she decided to be part of Campo Alto because it is a good institution to learn to grow as a person. She also wants to have a great family with children, a motorcycle, and her own house.

She is very intelligent, of good judgment, and responsible. She tries to do things perfectly without mistakes, because she is a very competitive person.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Myrian Pilar

texts.es:
Ella es una estudiante que está en campo alto en el área de salud, estudia  cosmetología y estética corporal llamada myrian pilar.
La estudiante se intereso en la carrera de cosmetología por el instituto que ha sido muy reconocido, también con el propósito de  embellecer a las mujeres y hombres del mundo,  ya que esta carrera siempre estará ejerciéndose cada día y actualizándose, esto la motivo para continuar estudiando y como también para ella misma, que pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y así mismo poderle brindar el mejor servicio a la comunidad. 
A ella le gusta lo que estudia porque ayuda a la autoestima de muchas de las personas que de pronto no tienen los recursos para hacer una cirugía estética  ya que son de muchos millones.
Ella y muchas de las esteticistas dan la oportunidad de procedimientos que se pueden realizar con aparatos de última gama y productos de la mejor calidad para que ellas vean los mismos resultados sin necesidad de tener que practicarse algún proceso de cirugía estética, ya que esto también afecta la salud.  
Ya que los tratamientos en estéticas son un poco más económicos ella también por ese motivo le gusto mucho lo que estudia y va a seguir estudiando más sobre la salud y los beneficios. 
Ella  está muy satisfecha con todo lo que ha aprendido en el instituto y la enseñanza que le han brindado, por lo mismo ella quiere tener el descuento con kiva, ya que le da la opción de pagar un valor más económico y como ella paga el estudio de ella y la hija los gastos son un poco más elevados, pero ella seguirá estudiando segura de lo que quiere y la meta fijada que tiene.
texts.en:
This is a Campo Alto student in the field of health. She studies cosmetology and body esthetics, and her name is Myrian Pilar.

This student became interested in the cosmetology degree at the institute, which has been well-recognized, as well as in the idea of beautifying the women and men of the world. In this career, she will forever be practicing and updating her skills daily; that is the reason for her to continue studying. She will also continue for herself, so that she can have a better quality of life and thus be able to provide a better service to the community.

She likes what she studies because she improves the self-esteem of many people who for the moment don't have the resources to do a cosmetic surgery, as those cost many millions [of pesos]. 

She and many estheticians provide the opportunity to get procedures that can be done with the latest selection of tools and top-quality products so that they see the same results without needing to have to undergo any cosmetic surgery procedures, since those can also affect their health.

Since these esthetic treatments are a little more economical, she really likes what she is studying and she is going to keep studying more about health and these benefits.

She is very satisfied with everything she has learned in the institute and with the instruction that they have provided to her; therefore, she wants to have the Kiva discount, since they give her the option of paying a more affordable rate. Since she pays for her own education as well as her daughter's, her expenses are a bit higher, but she will continue studying, sure of what she wants and the goal that she has set.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics for resale in order to save to open her own store

loans.name: Henry Alexis

texts.es:
Henry, está acompañado, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, por entusiasmo propio inicio la apertura de una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes, no es una actividad difícil para realizarla, no cuenta con ayuda del extranjero.
Invertirá en la compra de golosinas, huevos, pan, sal, bebidas y granos básicos, para tener debidamente surtido su inventario y de esa forma responder de inmediato a las demandas de los clientes, espera aumentar la clientela y por consiguiente sus ganancias serán mejores, con las que cancelara las cuotas del préstamo y mejorara su economía familiar.
Sueña con formar un patrimonio para su hijo y continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Henry lives with his partner and has a 6 year old daughter. Through his own enthusiasm, he opened a store where he sells products of daily use to his customers. It is not a difficult business and he doesn’t have any employees.

He will buy sweets, eggs, bread, salt, soft drinks, and basic grains so he can have a properly-stocked inventory. This way he will be able to respond immediately to the requests of his customers. He hopes to increase his clientele so that his income will be better. He will use it to pay the loan repayments and to improve his family’s economic situation.

He dreams of making a better future for his son and to continue strengthening his business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, eggs, bread, salt, soft drinks, and basic grains.

loans.name: Sara Margarita

texts.es:
Sara, con 68 años de edad, durante gran parte de su vida se dedicó a ser ama de casa y dependía económicamente de su esposo, sin embargo, siempre tuvo una mentalidad activa y emprendedora, gracias a ello, desde hace 10 años montó su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que nació con muy poco capital, poco surtido pero con muchas ganas de prosperar; su excelente organización y manejo le permitieron crecer y aumentar sus inventarios de acuerdo a lo que sus clientes le iban solicitando hasta convertirse en un negocio reconocido y próspero que es hoy en día.
La solicitud del crédito la realiza con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato, dulces, entre otros), esto le permitirá aumentar las ventas, ya que podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos de su clientela, haciendo que sus ventas e ingresos se incrementen notablemente.
Sara manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para lograr sus proyectos, especialmente el de adquirir una nueva casa y ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara, who is 68 years old, was a housewife and depended economically on her husband for a great part of her life.  Nevertheless, she always had an active and entrepreneurial mind, and thanks to that, she set up her own business 10 years ago, a grocery store that was born with very little capital and little stock, but with a great will to prosper. Her excellent organization and management allowed it to grow and increase its inventory according to what her customers requested, until it became the recognized and prosperous business that it is today. 

She has applied for a loan with the goal of investing in the wholesale purchase of stock (soft drinks, beer, snacks, and candies, among other items). This will allow her to increase her sales, since she will be able to satisfy the various tastes of her customers, making her sales and income increase considerably.

Sara states that her greatest wish is to continue working to achieve her goals, especially that of acquiring a new house and offering a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (soft drinks, beer, snacks, and candies, among other items)

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 14 años de edad, se dedica a la venta y reparación de llantas, también realiza trabajos de estructuras metálicas, es un oficio que aprendió de de su hermano, desde hace cinco años es independiente, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
EL crédito lo utilizara para comprar llantas en diferentes tipos y tamaños, para complacer a sus clientes en sus necesidades, espera tener mejores ingresos, más clientes y cancelar puntualmente su deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más grande y autosostenible.
texts.en:
Florentin is married. He lives with his wife and their 14-year-old daughter. He sells and repairs tires. He also does structural metal work, a trade that he learned from his brother. He has been independent for five years. His schedule is from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. He will use the loan to buy tires of different types and sizes in order to satisfy his customers' needs. He expects to have better income and more customers and make his loan payments punctually.

He dreams of having a bigger and self-sustaining business.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Norma Dilenia

texts.es:
La  joven  Norma  una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive con su  hijo en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  achinería  lo cual  hace desde hace más de 3 años.
Norma vende en el mercado de su comunidad, dicha  actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. El préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de toda clase de achinería como colas, ganchos, vinchas, glases, peines, hilos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Norma espera mejorar la situación  económica de su familia y que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido del  mercado y seguir  apoyando a su familia al igual que su hijo para que se convierta en una persona  honesta  con principios y valores.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero  del   2014
texts.en:
Norma is an enterprising, honest, responsible and serious young person. She lives with her son in the community in southern Honduras. Her business is buying and selling notions, which she has been doing for more than three years.

Norma sells in the market of her community, and this activity represents the greater part of her income.

She needs the loan to buy every kind of notion, such as ponytail holders, hair clips, headbands, nail polishes, combs, thread, etc. With the loan, she hopes that sales of her business increase by her having more merchandise to offer customers and meet their needs.

Norma hopes to improve her family's financial situation, and that in the short term her business keeps growing and strengthening so that it becomes the best-known in the market. She hopes to continue helping her family and that her son becomes an honest person with principles and values. 

Choluteca, Honduras –  January 2014

loans.use: To buy hair clips, headbands, combs, thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oneyda Patricia

texts.es: Oneyda de 36 años, es originaria de la Ciudad de Somotillo, soltera, estudiante, se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora, responsable, con deseos de superación, actualmente esta iniciando el primer modulo para obtener el Titulo de Licenciada en Ciencias Naturales, a pesar de los tropiezos de la vida ha sabido salir adelante y continuar con sus estudios, solicita a Ceprodel un crédito para la cancelación del primer modulo y poder culminar su carrera y de esa manera lograr su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Oneyda is 36 years old and originally from the city of Somotillo. She is single and a student. Oneyda is known for being an honest, hardworking, and responsible person who wants to succeed. She is starting the first module of a degree program in Natural Sciences. Despite the setbacks in her life, she has been able to move forward and continue her studies.

She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can complete the first module of her program and be on her way to completing a degree. This will allow her to fulfill her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay for the courses in the first module of her university degree program.

loans.name: Santos Pantaleona

texts.es:
La  señora Santos es una persona responsable, emprendedora  y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta de nacatamales desde hace 10 años. 
Doña Santos el préstamo lo necesita para la  compra  de leña,  carne, papas, maíz, condimentos, etc. En su negocio recibe la ayuda de sus hijos esto ayudando a tener una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Doña Santos necesita el préstamo para comprar más materia prima  para surtir su negocio. Ya que tiene bastantes clientes y la materia prima que tiene no satisfacen las demandas, así planea también aumentar sus nivel de  ventas para poder ayudar a sus hermanos en sus estudios y tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Santos is a responsible, entrepreneurial, and hard-working person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras, along with her children. Her business for 10 years has been selling nacatamales [a dish made from corn, meat, and rice wrapped in a banana leaf].

Doña Santos needs the loan to purchase firewood, meat, potatoes, corn, condiments, etc.  Her children help her with her business, and this helps her to give better service to her customers.

Doña Santos needs the loan to buy more basic ingredients to stock her business. Since she has quite a few customers and the basic supplies that she has don't satisfy the demands, she thus plans to also increase her level of sales to be able to help her brothers with their education and have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – January  2014

loans.use: to purchase firewood, meat, potatoes, corn, condiments, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent on his land and purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Mirna Esperanza

texts.es:
Mirna, es una mujer emprendedora que desde su juventud aprendió de su madre a vender ropa nueva, usada y otros productos para uso personal, hace 15 años lo hace de forma independiente, es casada, tiene dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, no ha tenido algún impedimento para dedicarse a dicha actividad.
Utilizara el crédito para invertir en la compra de fardos de ropa usada y nueva, con lo que su negocio será grandemente fortalecido y se mantendrá al día con las diferentes modas de temporada, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía.
Aspira a tener su propio puesto en el mercado municipal de su localidad para atraer más clientes y así aumentar sus ganancias, para dar a sus hijos oportunidades de una buena preparación académica.
texts.en:
Mirna is an enterprising woman. She learned to sell new and used clothing and personal items from her mother at a young age. She has been working independently for 15 years. She is married with two children, who are currently studying. She has not had any obstacles in her work.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of new and used clothing. This will greatly strengthen her business and she will be up-to-date with the latest styles. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her finances.

She hopes to have her own stall at a market in her community to attract more clients and increase her earnings. She will then be able to give her children the opportunity to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing.

loans.name: Maria Adina

texts.es:
María, es una señora que vive junto  a dos nietas y una hija, es casada, por apoyo de amistades emprendió el negocio de venta de ropa nueva, lo cual realiza desde hace cuatro años, de esta forma ella genera ingresos para cubrir parte de los gastos de su hogar.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, etc., surtiendo su inventario con nuevos estilos colores y tallas para continuar  satisfaciendo los gustos de sus clientes, espera fortalecer su negocio para tener mayor rentabilidad.
Sueña con mantenerse vendiendo lo suficiente para obtener los ingresos necesarios con los que cancelara las deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María is a married woman who lives with two of her grandchildren and one of her daughters. With the support of her friends, she started a business selling new clothing, and has been running this business for four years. This is how she generates earnings to cover part of her household's expenses.

She will invest the loan that she is requesting into the purchase of blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, etc. She will stock her inventory with new styles, colours, and sizes in order to continue to satisfy the tastes of her customers. She hopes to strengthen her business to become more profitable.

María dreams of continuing to make enough sales to generate necessary earnings, with which she will pay off her debts and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce for his self-owned fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and build fence around his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel  tiene la edad de 48 años, está divorciada y vive con tres  hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos pollos y el alimento del mismo. Ella desea darle una  adecuada alimentación para que tengan un peso ideal   y venderlos en los lugares aledaños y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica y de poder seguir. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR.
